text:
I've eaten at many buffets in LV.  I just don't know why, but any buffet that is North of the strip just isn't up to par at all.  And the Medley at Aliante is no exception.  First of all, at breakfast and lunch (not including weekends and holidays) there is virtually no line.  Great if you're hungry and can't wait to eat something.  The service staff seems to be really good and their personalities are really good.

That is basically the good part, with a few exceptions.  One of the first things you see upon entering is the huge soup and salad bar, with the fruit prominently displayed.  It looks awful.  All the melons are cut in different sizes and looks worse than if my 6 year old grandkid got hold of a knife and started cutting.  The tables and booths are of decent size and comfort.  Usually go to buffets at lunch, as that is my big meal of the day.  Went for some soup and tried the minestrone.  The flavor was ok, but the pieces of vegetables were much bigger than the spoon.  The salad bar itself seemed stocked with the usual ingredients but no bell peppers.   Everything down to the prepared salads seemed to be prepackaged.  Went over to the Mexican section which had some small but decent tamales, menudo, fajita fixings, taco fixings and the salsa bar.  Most of it tasted blah!  Went to the American, wow, they had my least favorite fish again, tilapia!  Carving station had beef and turkey.  The Italian had some dried up baked pasta dish, pizza with lousy crust, spaghetti + meatballs, sausage and peppers and marinara sauce that was so watery it wouldn't stay on the meatballs.

The Chinese section had a variety of foods that my diet couldn't handle so I stayed away.  At the BBQ section they had pulled pork, kielbasa, hot dogs and hamburgers that were not cooked to order but tasty and they had a decent no-bean chili that tasted ok and French fries and corn bread.  There was a decent selection of deserts but no vanilla sauce for the bread pudding.  The NSA deserts had very little variety, but sometimes they put out the cookies which taste ok.  The coffee is pretty decent.

All in all you get what you pay for I guess.  Would not have a problem paying a little extra for better quality food and presentation.  Seems like all the food workers don't take pride in their cooking because the food almost always looks like it was just dumped in a serving plate and put out.

I went there for the breakfast buffet. Lots of food. The carving station was excellent. Fruit was fresh and the waffles were delicious. Out server was always available for re-fills and clearing dishes away. The discount with the Alliente card was excellent. I would like to try the dinner buffet next.

I went to the French Market for the all you can eat BBQ beef ribs.   First of all, even though they call it BBQ it's not.  The ribs are roasted in an oven, and then just before serving the cook slathers some BBQ sauce on the ribs, puts them on the fire for 60 seconds and then serves them.  There is no BBQ flavor, no smoke, no spice rub, no falling off the bone tender.  They don't give you a steak knife so eating them is a pain.  The ribs have been cut so that the only meat is the little strip of meat between the bones.  Very disappointing - but all you can eat - for about $10 if you are a member of the players club.   

The salad bar had the bare minimum ingredients to call it a salad.

The deserts were more looks than taste.  Tasteless meringue in the lemon meringue pie, tasteless pumpkin pie, cannolli with barely any filling.  Best desert was the cream puff.

There are much better buffets in LV (but they don't have beef ribs).

Prime rib that melts in your mouth.
And a good price with your connected card.
Vegas really is a foodie paradise

Friday Night Seafood
I'm just not that enthusiastic about this place as my 1st two visits. Tonight was the Seafood Buffet for $17.99 with $1 off with players card. The oysters were absolutely scary looking. I've never seen oysters look so dried and shriveled up before. And there was a large bowl loaded with them. But we were happy with the salmon, the king crab, snow crab, shrimp, craw fish, mussels and clams. But not so impressed with the $37 we paid for this. We could have gotten the same things at Asia Buffet for $28 and enjoyed the oysters and a larger sushi selection. The desserts here deserve 5 stars because they all are very delicious. I have no complaints. 

I'll be back.... just not for Friday night seafood. Any other time I want to say will be my money's worth.

Has been eat in at the Orleans Casino French Market Buffet for quite some time now.  I can confidently say it is one of the most consistent buffet in Las Vegas. Their food selections r quite fresh n huge! With your typical basic Salad Bars, Mexican, Chinese, Italian, American, BBQ n Seafood and also an above average dessert section with Cakes, Pies, Gelatos, Soft Cones n some French Finger Pastries. I believe Wicked Spoon n Studio B is still the reigning chanp of dessert decadence! But Orlean's French Market Buffet is still one of the few most value honest deal buffet in Las Vegas! Your hard earn dollars will go along way by eat in here!

This will be a shorter review than what I usually write. This buffet sucks. Truly. The BBQ station serves sour cream, horseradish & another sour cream that's lumpy. Instead of labeling it sour cream/horseradish mix they call it sour cream. Desserts are dry. The carrot cake especially.  There's a breakfast station too, although I couldn't find it. Everything I had was bland, dry or had a funky taste to it: chili tasted like corn, dumplings bland & dry, same with fried rice. Someone in my group found it & he took one bite of scrambled eggs & pushed his plate away. I'm not a buffet person but have been to a few that are actually good. This isn't one of them. It's easily the worst in town. I stopped for lunch elsewhere after "lunch" here. Servers were nice & attentive.
Best off strip buffet in town.  If you're looking for all the choices and flavors of the bigger casinos but want a better price and less crowds then this is the place for you.

We had 3 ruby players cards for our family of 5 adults and my son and for my son they wouldn't do the discount of $5. We told the cashier and she wouldn't do it. The service was average. 

The food was good but not excellent. I liked the shrimp, crab, and other foods but their fruit was unripe.

The price was reasonable for its food which I liked. Each adult is $21.99.(kids older than 8 are full price)
This was the first time I'd been to this buffet. Went for dinner and it wasn't bad for the price. Plenty of selections. Soft serve was a little too sweet, but there are plenty of other options.

In town for the WCC basketball tournament and did not want to drive and hunt.  Decided to try the buffet and the price seemed okay.  $56 for two -- whoa!  Turns out I guess I missed the fact that it was Seafood Night.  Too bad because I am not that big a fan of oysters and Alaska King Crab legs which were flying off the serving trays.  The food was okay for buffet food.  I was served a thick slice of roast ham and there was a wide variety of food overall, but I never did find the fried chicken.

Grossest buffet I have ever been to! After seeing a nasty wirey white hair in the chorizo, I thought I was going to throw up. Then a lady came around me and grabbed a bunch of them on her plate, I was going to tell her but I froze because of shock.  I tried to force my self to eat since I was starving, but just couldn't do it. The price was $7.99 per person and supposedly included champagne but we were never offered any and no one around us had any so we just assumed it it was just the name for a breakfast during the weekend.  The price was low enough for me to just sit there and drink coffee while my hubby had a plate of french toast and an omelet. We went to eat elsewhere right after since I hadn't eaten. The staff is rude but what do you except from a cheap buffet. They couldn't pay me enough to step foot in there again, well maybe a million dollars, ha ha. It sure does remind you that paying more for quality food and service is worth it.

No great stand outs here. Nothing that I wanted to go back for - sad. Crab, crayfish, salmon (maybe the best item I ate), ribs - bland, prime rib - overcooked.  Desserts were run of the mill high production type desserts.  My lemon meringue pie meringue was so hard I couldn't cut it without a knife.

Oh my goodness my mouth is watering just thinking about this buffet

Its located in New Orleans, a little off the strip, but it is well worth the drive. The price is unbelievable! $7.99 for lunch on a weekday! For a buffet! With seafood! and steak and dessert! I don't understand how they are even making a profit!

For seafood, they have fish, crayfish, shrimp and KING CRAB LEGS. They have a variety of american food (steak, mac n cheese, grilled cheese), chinese food, mexican food, italian food (pasta, lasagna, pizza), BBQ (mongolian BBQ and baby back ribs) and over 25 varieties of desserts. 

Everytime I go to Vegas, I come here and eat my heart out like a little fatty. 

Highly recommended for a casual lunch and a great cure for hangovers :)
Better than most buffets.. The lunch time hamburger bar and seafood night are awesome. The decor and service is top notch

Went here for the Sunday champagne brunch. My family and I paid $13.99 per person. And we were promptly seated. There is quite a variety of food. There are smoked salmon, primed ribs, crab cakes, breakfast foods (i.e. blintz, pancakes, waffles, and bacon), an Asian food station (i.e. Kung Pao chicken), cheeses, a Mexican food station (with churros!), an omlette station, some crab legs, shrimp, veggies and fruits, and finally, dessert. Overall, the food tastes great. I love it. The only things I do not like are: 1) the tiny, cheap, plastic champagne glasses and 2) the infrequency of waiters/waitresses coming around asking if we were okay or if we needed anything. I waited forever to ask for more coffee or champagne. I wish there were more waiters or waitresses going around. And they also take a while to take our plates. But I am willing to look over these things because my tummy is nice and full because of French Market Buffet. And yes, I am willing to go there again.

We went to the French Market Buffet on Christmas day.  We were looking for a good buffet, off the strip, without the 2 hour wait in line.  We were in line before the 1100 opening.   At the carver's station the roast turkey was very good.  The ham was very watery, like it was boiled or steamed.  At the other ethnic stations, the food appeared to be from the day before.  The mexican refried beans were old-looking.  Mind you we we at the start of the lunch buffet.  You could get breakfast, and the scrambled eggs were freshly made, but room temperature.   The steam table temperatures were not hot.

End result two of us got sick

The waiter service was great.  

Bad show for such a special occasion.

Much better than we thought! We came here after getting married in Vegas and to our surprise it was amazing! The day before we came by to check if they take reservations and were surprised to find out they did! It worked out perfectly. Another amazing thing, we came on Octoberfest day so the price was only $10 a head! Amazing! It is like the Rio World Buffet but for a third of the price! Now I will admit it does not have all the selections of Rio but it was just as good! I do highly recommend you coming here for cheap but good buffet with a good variety!

I love the renovation!! It looks very modern and cute. $20 for the dinner on a Sunday is a great deal! The steak was the best buffet steak I've had in a while. They definitely expanded for the better, and their staff is very friendly. I had Kathy our server and she was so nice. She made sure our glasses were full and she always cleared our plates as soon as we were done. She really made the experience a lot better. I would recommend the dinner, the food was hot and fresh. Definitely my new favorite buffet in Las Vegas!

I have been to this buffet Handful of times for breakfast and once for dinner.

I'm giving this buffet four stars based upon overall value, service, and decor.
The prices are great. Example: $5.99 for breakfast with players card. Service has always been great. The restaurant is spacious, modern, and overall attractive setting. 
The food pretty decent, stick to the cooking stations and fresh foods. Does it compare to the Wynn buffet or Wicked spoon? No, you get what you pay for. It is was it is, accept for what it is and you'll enjoy it.

This buffet was pretty bad. The food was edible but that's the nicest thing I can say.

The staff was slow and rude. The price was 15.99 but it was more in line with a 9.99 buffet. They even had the nerve to charge $10 for a two year old child. 

The orange juice tasted fake and they were so slow to refill our drinks. 

At one point my two year-old spilled her drink. A staff seemed annoyed to bring me one dry towel before walking away.

I would not return here again.

Great food diversity. Delicious and a lot of choices. I just would like to know why it takes so long if there is more than 50 tables available and the line still growing? Also a child under 12 shouldn't pay full price for Sunday brunch.
Came here for breakfast. It ha decent variety of food and snacks. One negative is that it open at 8am and those of us on business trip need to eat earlier.

I don't think so. 

This "buffet" is probably one of the worst buffets I've ever eaten at. The food was bland, the staff was rowdy, and the utensils were dirty. When you eat corn that tastes like nothing, you know this is a waste of 14 dollars. 

Just don't come here at all.
The $11 weekday lunch buffet at Orleans Casino is an excellent value. Delicious prime rib and ham. Great deserts selections as well with 12 flavors of premium ice cream.

We will keep this one simple Went on two different nights, comped so we thought we would take advantage. Seafood night was somewhat phoned in. It just strikes me as an old folks home buffet. Bland and brown. Oh well if it's free it's worth it.
The stars are all for the service.

3.5
Been here a ton of times...with tax it's only $7.45 or something like that for the breakfast..show up near the end of it and you get to eat all the lunch stuff as it comes out.  It's not the best buffet but when it comes to getting your moneys worth it might be! I prefer this place over the Caesars dinner actually....the best deal on the strip is probably the $35 unlimited buffet for 24 hours offering 7 different casinos...PH. Cesars, Imperial, Paris, Harrahs, Rio and a couple others...but if are in the hole from gambling bad, the buffet at Orleans is a good way to feel like you won some of it back.

French Market Buffet is located in The Orleans Casino Hotel. I had the Saturday Champagne Brunch for approx. $10/person. (There is a $1 discount if you have their player's card.) After seating me, the waitress promptly took my drink order.  You can order champagne from the waitress but I chose not to drink the champagne.  

Buffet food selection:
French Market Buffet offers a selection of food ranging from American to Asian.  As expected, the selection is not as grand as buffets located on the Strip; however, there was a good variety of food for the price paid.  The food was reasonably tasty.

There is also an omelet bar (my fav!) where one can order an omelet with ingredients that include ham, sausages, bacon, cheese, green peppers, mushrooms, etc.  My omelet was delectable!

Desserts:
The coconut macaroons and chocolate cake was super delicious.

The waitress refilled my drink without me asking.  The facility was clean and well-kept.  Overall, I had a pleasant experience and will return mainly for the price.

This was probably the worst food I have ever eaten in my entire life. The roast beef tasted like they put poultry seasoning on it the chinese food was over deep fried and when I finally tried the prime rib it tasted like it was rotten. The only good thing on the buffet was the Mexican food and the desserts were good. I stayed at the Orleans for a month and I wouldn't give them another dime to eat there that horrible buffet could be complimentary with your stay and I still wouldn't eat there again.

I was there for the Christmas brunch. The crab was good, the selection of dessert was vast, and the coffee was great with the dessert. Everything else was... meh... But at this price, there's not much you can complain about.

went here for Sunday brunch. For about $15 per person quality should b better. The pork ribs tasted like it was re-heats. Osso bucco was tender but sauce it up so it looks appetizing  not like it was  the heat lamp all day, the sad thing was we were here when it just opened. Crawfish and ham were good, desserts looked good but I was lo carbing it. I'm not a salad person but the grilled veges, cheese platter at sPalad bar was nice. Maybe the m resort spoiled me, but was not impressed With the orleans buffet .

This Review is for the Friday Seafood Buffet. $ 18.00 per person 
Peel and Eat Shrimp, Hot and Cold Crab Legs, Tuna in Dill Sauce, Fried Shrimp Patties, Craw-fish, Clams, Oysters on the half shell, Salmon on a wooden plank, and several additional seafood selections. Many traditional Buffet items were also to be found. 
Average quality seafood with poor to average preparation. Some items were over fried and tough - other fried items were barely cooked enough. Crab-legs were small - ensuring lots of work. A seafood stew was mainly mushrooms. The Clam Chowder soup was very thick with only a promise of clams. The Seafood Buffet was Pricey for the quality of the food. Very good service by the wait staff. 

I would suggest this buffet for Breakfast or Lunch - or even better with a Comp or Coupon.

If you're playing tables always ask the Pit Boss for a comp - they will rarely(if ever) volunteer one. On Slots ask the Players Club what it takes - Before you spend your money here.

First, let me say that I'm not one to eat at a buffet, sorely because i lose my appetite when I see piles of foods on trays lined up from one end of the wall to another.

I was forced (yes, forced!) to go here with my family - party of 8 with two toddlers. Usually, for big parties wiith messy toddlers, the host would normally sit you in the corner away from other gobbling patrons, but not our case. we were just a few feet away from the food, yet not too close from foot traffic.
(that's 1 star)

The buffet, being in the Orleans casino, serves southren food (among other "international theme") - from crawfish to hush puppies. They also have cooked and raw oysters. Not bad for a $20. The only drawback is the desert section - they dont have much to offer tehre. But then again, I get stuffed easily and usually dont have much room for sweet shutffs.
(that's 2 stars)

This is no Rio buffet, so there's really not much waiting. However, being that it was graduation week, there were a lot of locals with their graduating kids (still on their cap n gown). Stilll, we only waited for about 8 minutes.
(that's 1 star)

I got a bad impression of our server at first because instead of neatly placing our silverwares on the table, she would just toss it from the other end of the table, so I had to catch my fork as bouncess across the table. 
(that's -1 star)

I was in Vegas for 4 days and ate here twice.
First time was for breakfast, a decent selection of stuff to choose from; you have fruit, waffles, pancakes, bacon, sausage (normal breakfast foods). Nothing to spectacular on that end considering the biscuits and gravy they had was below my expectations (gravy lacked flavor almost as if they were afraid to make that traditional peppery white gravy you crave with biscuits and gravy), drink service was also a little slow but it was to be expected for a Saturday. But then you get to the desserts which were available during breakfast; not only did they have donuts but they also had cake and pie. I'm a sweets fanatic but have a pretty severe nut allergy and the lady working there (I can't remember her name but super sweet and a little older lady with brown hair in a bun) was very understanding of that and gave me a full list of everything with nuts, cooked near nuts, and may possibly be contaminated with nuts. I was pretty happy with that since I got a fresh slice of the most delicious peach caramel cake I've ever eaten and convinced me to give the buffet another go but at lunch to see if it was better than breakfast.
Second time was for lunch and lets say I was left feeling a little disappointed. The cooks  behind the buffet prepping food didn't seem to know much about the foods and had to go track down other chefs to ask if anything contained nuts or was cooked in peanut oil; while nothing was prepared in peanut oil other foods "could have nuts". Disappointing since they couldn't name anything that had nuts at all and I had to guess at what would or wouldn't be safe to try and eat. The lunch options were not very impressive either, the fried fish was kind of "meh" the pasta at the American station was very oily/greasy almost as if they had only boiled the noodles and melted butter onto them. Italian food left A LOT to be desired, the pizza wasn't very great but even bad pizza is good pizza, but there were not many pasta options. Plain noodles and only meat or marina sauce, a few options for various different pastas (none of which really stood out) and one sad looking vegetable lasagna. Drinks this time were quicker to arrive and be refilled. And then we get to desserts, whoever makes these do a superb job and they ladies who work in that area (the one from Saturday was there again) are the nicest workers I have ever met. They saved what would have been a disappointing lunch with the offering of a delicious blueberry cheesecake that I had two pieces of.

Overall: very average quality food offerings, except desserts those are superb; but the price is pretty decent compared to the other buffets.

No difference between the meals at this buffet and any of the other $8 - $11 casino buffets.  Line is usually short during breakfast and lunch during the week.  Earns four stars instead of three because the staff has always been great when I've eaten here.

I used to go to this Buffet when I lived closer but haven't been here probably in 5-6 years at least. I usually figure a buffet is a buffet and know what to expect. Last night, this place was just a big MEH! Most of the food tasted exactly the same as other items and some of it was less than appealing in it's presentation. I'm also not a big Prime Rib fan but I do at least like it to not be smiling at me. It was clean inside and looked nice.
The service was great and friendly, which is unusual for a buffet. I won't be back soon.

Great buffet with affordable pricing. It is the most expensive on Friday nights so a way to save money is do lunch or a late lunch before they switch to dinner pricing at 4 but stop letting people in for lunch at 3. They have a bbq, italian, mexican, american, chinese, seafood, and mongolian/Hawaiian station plus desert.  It's fresh and good quality.  Not as good as some of the more pricey buffets but for a $9.99 lunch it beats the $35 buffets anyday. Make sure to get a player card for a better price.

Decent lunch buffet, with variety. Good price. Tried the beef brisket and ribs, which got great reviews from others--good flavor, but lots of fat on them. Most of the food was bland.
Definitely save room for the dessert bar. Deep-dish pecan pie was quite tasty. Oreo cake was good too.

I don't expect much from buffets because I've been disappointed so many times. I went at 4pm for the seafood buffet which was way overpriced. I paid 86.00 for four people including a 6 year old child. There are no discounts on seafood night for children. I also had a players card. I thought the food was okay. I did enjoy the variety of desserts (sugar-free). Overall I think you should go when you're really really hungry and feel like splurging. It  wasn't amazing but it wasn't horrible. It was like "eh".

Last night me and my husband and 2 years old little girl had a dinner there. I was surprised that they charged for 2 years old kid. $9.99 for 2 years old kid. And mine was $10.99. Only $1 cheaper than mine? She didn't eat at all. Only had couple piece of fruit.

After a canceled flight, I wound up spending my airline meal vouchers here for dinner and a breakfast. The prices for dinner change daily, depending on the night's theme cuisine. My night was BBQ and it cost about $15.

Like a lot of sub $20 buffets, the food offerings here need to be attacked with a strategy in mind. I have my own system for deciding what to pick, but the most important buffet rule is to immediately stop eating anything that isn't GOOD. There's a lot of crap at this buffet and a lot of stuff that's so-so, but there's some real good stuff to be eaten, as long as you're not busy chowing down on dried-out, fake, instant, imitation, bland funk.

I found the roasted chicken to be excellent, like actually worthy of being on a plate being served in a regular restaurant. The crawdads were unique and it was my first time trying them. I didn't care for the taste, but I don't have anything to compare them to, so I switched over to the peel and eat shrimp. The salad bar was decent enough. The bread pudding was amazingly good. The service sucked, as my water was never refilled, I had to scrounge for a second napkin, and at one point my table was totally cleared while I was up getting more food.

Breakfast was about $8. The OJ was fake and tasted funny. The coffee was not bad, but not good. Skip scrambled eggs as they're fake too. Instead, get your eggs off the top off the Benedict offerings. You don't want to eat the whole Benedict, just the egg, as the rest is gross. I have a weakness for cheap-o breakfast sausage with syrup on top and I wasn't disappointed. Don't bother hoping for a nice pastry to pair with your last cup of coffee because they're all pretty horrible.

Overall, FMB is worth the price it seems, but don't think you're going to get the variety of a full buffet, as most of the food is no good. Be picky and search out the few gems to be found, then jump in with both feet.

This buffet has gone downhill. The overall prices without discounts are 21.99, which is not worth your money because the food is less than ok. The fish tastes like its been frozen for months and the pastas are watery or too dry... the Chinese and Mexican food were ok and the American food was worse than mediocre. The desserts were good, especially the gelato. Overall, don't come here to eat unless you are dying of starvation!

Ive eaten at a lot of the buffet's in Vegas, but this one at The Orleans is the best. All of their food was great, and I don't think I came across anything that i did not like. Service was also amazing, never had an empty glass. I definitely recommend this place! I will be coming back.
My review is pretty much the same as the others. Would be nice if they were open a little later than 9. Busy enjoying your time and cut it close getting there by 9. Will eat there again.
Avoid this place....the only thing good was the omelette & beef ribs. Bland fried rice, salty biscuits & gravy, & a cardboard tasting rice Krispy treats.
Bad, bad, bad.  Poor service, flavor was off on almost all of the food, we both ended up with a horrid stomach ache the next day.  Quantity  Quality. This place is overpriced for what they offer.

The Orleans is always a place I like to frequent when I am in Vegas.  For some reason, I find their buffet to be a good value, and call me crazy, but they make a crazy-good tuna salad!! Yes, of all those options (including crawfish-not for me), I return again and again for some of that tuna!  Not the biggest or brightest buffet, but I am still a fan and will return each and every time.

I used to like this buffet for value.  However, after my recent stay at the Orleans and 2 visits to the buffet, I need to update my review.   I thought the first time was a fluke. In the past, I never noticed them  putting out food that is way past it's prime.  However, there were several items I used to enjoy that should have gone into a compost bin rather than being served as food.  Watermelon and some items at the salad bar were especially disappointing since I had enjoyed them in the past. My boyfriend is the meat eater, and he said the quality of the meat had gone down too.

The pricer Sunday brunch was the most pleasant of the meals we had.   The free champagne, which wasn't bad, helped make the experience more enjoyable.  They had better fruit on Sunday, and had a  chocolate fountain to dip fruit, rice krispy treats, macaroons and marshmallows in.   

I never cared for the cakes and pies at the French Market Buffet.  They are pretty, but like most Vegas buffet desserts, they taste like they use a cheap oil instead of butter.  The cobbler is usually good, and so is their ice cream and gelato.

We always like the servers and tip them even if the quality of the food is bad.  It is not their fault.

Came here with my husband for brunch on Saturday morning and we had the server Marcelo. He probably was the worst server I've ever had there. Took his time clearing our table when I watched him he was much quicker getting to the older couples and smiled much more around them. He seemed at when talking to us. Never checked on us once while eating. Never brought us napkins. Idk if it's because we are young, but I work in the service industry and I tip very well. It's not right to stereotype.
The most horrible food quality - save your money. Dont know how anybody could give this place the many positive reviews seen here.
Steak night buffet cost $21 + tax . The food and services were ok. I liked bean sup , it taste very good. Weekend come here with friend eating and gambling . Happpppyyyyy if you win..,,,,

For someone that enjoys the Vegas buffets and has been to 50 of them this is by far the worst one in did not like any of the food the clientele where the worst I have ever experience, if you want a cheap Buffett try Fremont.

Fairly good food.  Unpeeled shrimp.  No turkey.   Good breakfast stuff still out at noon. Would not be my first choice, but not to bad.  Overall the hotel and casino are fine.  Other restaurants  here are very good.

Probably the most food I've wasted at a buffet and I hate wasting food.  Quality was not good as a few things were inedible.  Chewy shredded hash browns, hard coated chicken fried steak, face clenching sour pineapples, and overly fat and greasy sausage.  Now at $7.50 you would think it is a value meal but I would not come back if it was free.

Good food, great atmosphere for a good price.  Drawbacks: Very crowded, which is actually a good sign.  We ate here for lunch 3/5 days one week b/c that is where we received tickets from training.  Worth the price. Good presentation.  Good food.  The only negative food experience was the roast beef was a bit bloody for me, but I just didn't eat it.

Went here at the French Market buffet in the Orleans for lunch on a Christmas Monday, didn't have to wait long. Everything looks and tastes fresh. I especially love the Korean short ribs and rotisserie chicken which they served! They are both to die for! Would love to come back for more. Please save me a seat. Thank u. Almost forgot to mention. The cost is average! Only $10 per person without club card. Worth every pennies. So, What are u waitin for?

As some others have been saying, the terrible quality of this place may be due to it being under construction. But it is, as it stands now, terrible. Food is close to cafeteria quality. We went for brunch, and upon trying the eggs and sausage, I found both to be undercooked. The eggs were so runny it was unbelievable. One of the two gave me food poisoning, so here I am 24 hours later, missing out on my vacation because I'm now confined to my hotel room. I rarely use Yelp for anything other than checking reviews people have already left, but I was angry enough to make an account and write this one up myself!

I find it hard to believe that this isn't the best Buffet deal in Vegas.  Once again, had breakfast this moring and it was out of this world!  The custom omeletes, made to order, are just as good if not better than the ones for $35 on nthe strip.  The cooks and staff are always very friendly and make this a fantastic place to start your day.  Along with my omelete I had fresh watermelon and honeydew melon and fresh baked cookies to dip in my cofee.  Try it and you will see.

For 12.97, pretty damn good food. I also didn't eat for like 6 hours before that so that can be a factor. No complaints.  4 stars because nothing stood out too far to be a 5. But it was damn well delicious. Too bad they have no cookie dough ice cream. I'll be all over that shit  . The egg drop soup though was a little bland and tasted too much like baby corn. 

I was a satisfied customer .

The buffet is arranged into nine serving stations. They include the soup & salad bar and the Italian, Mexican, Chinese, Mongolian Barbecue, American, Seafood, BBQ and the dessert bar.

I have eaten here many times. The food is not outstanding but there is plenty of variety and I can always find things here that I like. The salad bar recently had marinated artichoke hearts which is a big plus for me. The beef ribs are meaty, tender and flavorful. And you can gorge yourself on the shrimp and crayfish. And numerous other offerings keep me returning. I found the dessert bar to be just so-so but overall it's a good buffet. And I'd have to say that the prices make it one of the best buffet values in town. If you present a B-Connected card which is free from the Orleans casino, you'll save an extra dollar on the buffet. The same card is valid at all Boyd Gaming properties.
The brother casino has a better buffet for a cheaper price. Lines here are longer and food is okay. Not coming back as there is better for cheaper with a free shuttle!!!

This was my first visit here - way out in the high north central part of Las Vegas. The buffet room itself is very impressive looking: classy, large, beautifully decorated. Breakfast opens at 7AM. The staff was welcoming and very friendly. Customer activity apparently starts off slowly after opening for breakfast. Table service was excellent and food was neatly arranged and visually appealing. The place was immaculate clean. Breakfast offerings were fairly standard with a slightly above average selection. Food quality was above average. No one should have a problem assembling a decent breakfast here. 

It looks like a well-run operation in fairly upscale and relaxing surroundings. I hope this great-looking facility develops into a busier operation as development in the area continues and customer traffic increases.
Definitely not worth 22 bucks only reason im eating here is that it was comped my wife almost broke a tooth on some chicken no seafood salad which is cheap to make

Have been in Vegas for 5 days and the Orleans is right down the road.  We've eaten at the buffet 3 times and have enjoyed the lunch and dinner.  The staff is always checking for drinks and keeping the table clean. Ate 90% salad bar and loved the selections. Found the smoked ribs and that became our desert. Really tasty. Ate at 2 of there other properties and would give the Gold Coast a three star and the Main Street a two star.

So I'm a fan of breakfast, aren't you?
Well, $7.99 per person & all you can eat :D
Mon-Sat 7am-10pm
Sun 8am-10pm
I came in around 9:45am & was lucky to get some lunch food with purchasing the breakfast price. (useful information, don't you agree?) ;)
So on with the food... Yes, it does the stomach good. Chocolate waffles, make your own omelet, unlimited bacon. Yum!
And the perfect drink to compliment your breakfast: O.J.
There's a lot of selections and a fruit/dessert bar is available also.
This place isn't one for top-notch, but it satisfies my pocket and tummy.

Over priced! You don't get what you pay for! This is the first and maybe the last time I eat here! Instant mashed potatoes and the wine was horrible!!!! There's more , but it'd take all day to name all the bad and cheap food! 
I will say that the service was good!

4 stars for great value in terms of price vs quality and selection among near-strip buffets. Removing one star for making me poop longer than usual. But adding a star for nice decor. Removing another star for making me look fat. I'd also subtract couple stars for putting me into food comma for 2 hours, which makes this place a little more expensive as time is money. But the overall experience was very good and I'm giving it 5 stars to negate older reviews posted before remodeling, as this place now deserves much better rating.
Anyway, I wasn't aware of the recent remodeling and was nicely surprised when visiting for Christmas Day dinner.  I usually don't care for expensive remodels that are often used to increase the price, but in this case it worked somewhat well and the Orleans buffet now deserves the place among the top buffets in Vegas, even though still far from perfect. There are no crab legs (except Friday nights) and therefore this buffet cannot be compared to the best ones that do serve them. Yet, the price reflects the lack of crab legs and justifies rating this location among the top of those that do not have them. The food quality and selection makes this place among the top 5 in Vegas on my list, little behind Bacchanal, M, and Wicked Spoon, while beating all of them on price.
I was especially surprised with ribs, which were better than those served in many restaurants. They had good selection of other meats, although some could've been added only for Christmas. Green beans, sweet potatoes, and other vegetables were fresh and cooked well. Lots of other selections from various cuisines, at least during Christmas Day. Some things that I would like to see added would be mushrooms and au gratin potatoes. Desert selection not as amazing as top buffets but still along better ones in Vegas. The holiday price was the same as the regular price during nights and weekends ($19 with rewards card), therefore I'm assuming that the selection and quality may be similar every day.
Nice decor and friendly waiter further helped providing great experience.

I love this buffet for one reason - all you can eat crab legs for less than $20 on Friday nights!  If you get the players card you can save $1/person.  Most of the other food on the buffet is mediocre - but if you love crab legs as much as I do you don't have any problem!  Great price!

The Orleans and Boyd did spend at lot of money to renovate the buffet.  It's too bad they put all the money into the building instead of the food.  About 5 years ago the food was good.  No I can't believe it passes the state requirements.  None of the hot food was hot.  All the food was bland.  The hubby loves the Mexican food at most buffets but everything here he said was cold and tasteless.  We had a buy one get one deal so at least it only cost us half to be so disappointed.
We will not be returning to this Boyd establishment.

This is our go to buffet for. weeknights don't want to cook.  The food is presented nicely but quality and taste is inconsistent from visit to visit.  Since it has become a boyd property the carved beef is not as tender or flavorful and the dessert area has less variety and not kept up as before. The staff is friendly and attentive.

SO and i visited today - another freebie...overall, we liked it....even if we had to pay, i think it's worth the money...$15/ person

plus - free glass of wine...sure it's table wine...but it's drinkable
           bbq foods - ribs, pork and beef, pork loin, sausage
           variety - like most casino buffets - about 7 food stations -               bbq, seafood, mongolian ( yes...they say mongolian
            but i did not try any of the foods at this station ) chinese, 
         mexican, italian, etc
         decent variety of desserts

minus - steak ( it was steak night ) - allegedly ny steak...hmmm
               it ain't high quality, but i don't expect high quality !!!

the drink server - very pleasant and attentive

i would call it a "2nd tier" buffet, but it's one of the better 2nd tier places ( it's comparable to the green valley and red rock station casino's )

Enjoy !

Very good. Here for easter brunch. One issue is they dont have chicken gumbo this morning. They had it yesterday. Still give 5 stars. Prime rib was good and rare. Omlette station great. Steak and sausage great. Pasta station great. No sugar added chocolate pie and cake is superb.

Went with the family about an hour before they closed for dinner. I wasn't that impressed-it seemed like it was the place to eat your sorrows away with mediocre food after you lost a decent amount of money at the casino. Because of the odd time, we were placed at a small corner of the eating area, and rarely had anyone come and take away our plates. It was definitely A-Ok.

I give 3 stars cause the service is excellent all the servers are wonderful and courteous, the food on the other hand is blah don't get me wrong there's tons to choose from but the food is not good, has no flavor I got the brisket was inedible tasted really weird like plastic, maybe to much liquid smoke, and the beef ribs tasted the Same just weird tasting, and the dirty rice was that yucky,, I then tried the breakfast u cAnt go wrong with that, but the sausage had a distasteful  flavor also and kind of soggy in the middle, the Asian food was ok the egg rolls were actually really good... I'm at hmmm with this place I want to really like it but to me the food just tasted weird and lacking flavor big time,,,

Garbage! They got rid of the Friday crab legs and kept the expensive price. The steak is terrible and shrimp is cold and not peeled... No grilled shrimp anywhere! Do yourself a favor and buy your own bag of frozen/peeled shrimp and cook it however you'd like... You'd be happier you did than coming to this expensive slop house...Do not come here!

Slightly better than average.

Pros:
Even though the line can get long, they always manage to keep it movin'.
Reasonable price.
It's in The Orleans(which is the casino I go to the most after The Palms).
Decent variety.

Cons:
A lot of the food is pretty bland so every time I go here I end up getting the same things over and over again...
The ~Mongolian section is random and weird(how about having an Indian, Caribbean or Mediterranean section instead?)
Not enough Cajun/Creole/Soul Food, disappointing for a place which is always tooting it's "VIVA NEW ORLEANS" horn.

This is probably the buffet I've been to the most out of all the Vegas buffet, and it does it's job. It definitely hits the spot, but it's sorely lacking in many areas unfortunately.

Very, very disappointed.  We frequented this buffet before the BIG CHANGE. The food was always good. Lunch or dinner.
We went for lunch a few days ago. The food has changed drastically.
The potatoes in the potato salad were CRUNCHY. Couldn't eat it. The greens were SUPER SALTY. Couldn't eat it. The black-eyed peas were CRUNCHY. Couldn't eat it.  No hush puppies or cornbread. NO CATFISH!!!  They offered planks of pollock that looked AND tasted like they came out of a box of a GENERIC brand of frozen fish!!!

Definitely not worth it anymore. Thought the prime rib night would at least worth the trip but it was dry and all food for that matter was not that good. If you want to spend 35 I'd recommend going to south point.

I want to give this buffet more stars but my honesty won't allow me. The price and quality of food go hand and hand in this establishment. This is a place I would eat with my friends when hungover and dehydration has set in. This a wonderful casino with great service but the quality of food is fair at best. I've been here 2-3 times and have always walked away full. I stick to all of the food that looks and smells hot and fresh. Seafood here may be a gamble but I enjoy gambling at the Orleans. I have never gotten sick because I take my time to eat food that looks of good quality. The dessert bar was forgettable. The breakfast buffet is well worth the price. All in all, I would have to say the breakfast buffet is Key.

Went there an while back, had 2-1, The food was good, the service was great. Beats what is on the strip, and for half of the price. Been going back for at least an year at least 2 an month, never had nothing bad there.

Yuck!  I would never visit this place again for dinner!  Food quality is poor, selection is okay, but the food is not that great.  The food was not hot - the desserts looked much better than they tasted.  We went as a family with 4 kids and 2 adults $103 for dinner...  We arrived at 3:05 PM, we were told it was too late for lunch, and were told they closed from 3-4PM (for dinner transition).  They would not let us in even though we did not care about dinner...  We ended up waiting it out at the bowling alley (non smoking area) and then came down at 4 PM and waited in line for 25 minutes!

When we finally got to eat we were very disappointed.  This place is much worse than our local casino back home at Tulalip!

Kids are FULL PRICE!  Food selection is well below average for a casino in Vegas, food quality was below average for Vegas...  I will not be back!  Very disappointed - I went there based on all of these reviews, sad I can't share the same positive feedback.

This place is only one step above old country buffet...  Save your money - eat elsewhere for dinner.

The buffet at Aliante Casino has a nice variety of food
and the price is reasonable if you have a coupon or discount.
In general the quality and taste of the food is adequate;
the most notable exceptions being the tough green beans and
the dressing which was mushy and lacked flavor.

The biggest problem is that the property is not well managed.

When we arrived at the buffet there were two long lines
extending into the casino, and there was no way to tell
the difference between the lines.  The buffet manager should
put out signs to mark the VIP line and the general line.
After a while somebody started herding the customers out of
the casino into an area closer to the wall.  This should have
been done before the line got so long.  It would also help if
the buffet manager would put ropes along the wall to make it
obvious where the line forms.

After standing in line for an hour the cashier would not
accept our players card because it was the "old" style.
We had to get out of line and go to the  Players Club Counter
to get a different card.  The casino should have notified
patrons that their cards would have to be exchanged.

The dessert bar is understaffed.  The gelato service area
alone requires one full time person.  There was only one
person to handle gelato, pies, cobbler, pastries, toppings,
and everything else.  Because of this the lines were long
and the service was slow.
They stopped putting out desserts about an hour before closing.
At 30 minutes before closing there were no more cookies and only
a few slices of pie left.  When we left there were still people
entering the buffet, who obviously were paying for desserts that
they would never get.

The salad bar had items placed in random spots.  It was impossible
to follow the logical progression of getting salad, then toppings,
then dressings.  The person in charge at this buffet does not have
experience running a food service operation.

The Orleans buffet it just average if you ask me. Of course its above any other buffets you have anyways else (thats not on the Vegas Strip). But to me its like your hometown/JJ North/ Chinese Buffet that offers maybe better seafood of course.

Well, I've come here for breakfast and dinner and let me tell you that right now, I give them a 3. Of course I am comparing it to the Mandalay Bay, Bellagio and Wynn buffet. When you have those, you cannot compare these buffets. Of course, you pay for what you get and comparing a 14 dollar buffet to a near 40 dollar buffet, you will get quality and choices. Service is alright, food could be a little better of course. Crab legs, reminiscent of those you can find at Todai's.

But yes, if you looking to not paying too much, or if your looking to not wait in long lines, or if you are looking to get away from the strip, then come on down to the French Market Buffet at The Orleans.

Wow, what a treat. Yes not on the strip, but there lies the charm. After a dismal buffet at a pretentious  strip hotel, this buffet renewed my faith that there are still inexpensive finds in Vegas.
I had the Sunday brunch buffet. It was a couple of bucks more than their normal breakfast, but the selections were phenomenal. Flat iron steaks cooked perfectly, pork onion gravy for the chicken fried steaks, gumbo, jumbalaya, ribs and more ribs. Crawfish! Every dish I tried felt the gave it special attention. Their gelato dessert area rivals the Rio. And for sunday brunch, there's a chocolate fountain and sparkling wine.
Kudos Orleans! 4 stars to food, bumped to 5 for cost and service

I'm extremely easy to please so this is my first 1-star review and let me just tell you it's for a reason. There was not a single item here that had flavor or wasn't dried out. Lowest quality food I've ever put in my mouth and I feel disgusting right now.

We have been coming to this buffet since the hotel opened. It is a decent buffet given the price. The selection is very limited compared to other buffets on the strip but it is enough to fill your appetite. The service is always great here.
After the renovation, it looks modern. Perfect customer service & great selection of food. Delicious!!!

This buffet is awesome! They have a wide variety of items including sushi, BBQ, Mexican, Italian, Asian, salad bar, dessert (even sugar free options), and much much more! 

Your tastebuds will not be bored! I loved how the buffet items changed from breakfast to lunch to dinner and even the next day there were items they didn't offer the prior day. Also during the champagne brunch they have a chocolate fountain! 

They offer an all day pass Monday-Thursday for $25 and Friday-Sunday for $28...such an incredible deal! It's a great way to save money on food while in Vegas. I will definitely be returning!

I usually give this place a 5 star. But this visit at "seafood night" was sooooo disappointing The crab looked generic/plasticy and it was wayyyy too salty! :( it's usually never this salty but tonight it was on some other level! I had to take my blood pressure pill after this! This was dangerous!
This is a big step up from the old place. Lots of choices with good flavor. I would go back again

This buffet is sooooo foul! The mimosas for the Sunday brunch had almost NO ALCOHOL! I had to drink 5 to get somewhat of a buzz.. All the food is lukewarm, no seasoning and they let it sit out all day! I could practically taste the FOOD POISONING! 

The only thing that was good was the ice cream and thats because they didnt make it themselves. (Blue Ribbon Brand) The flies were relentless! Bugs buzzing around the food! So vile! So disappointing! Never going back!

Buffet isn't my thing but my girl was having a craving.. So we searched around and saw that the Orleans has what is said to be a good buffet. Good is subjective and lets just say there were lots of people that seemed to be enjoying themselves there.. I just wasn't one of them.. 

Options.. Seafood.. American.. Mexican.. Pasta (Italian I guess) Chinese, and big ol desert bar. Well It was all very plain Jane and wasnt something I would partake in again.

Buffet food is generally low end but this was really just the bare basics of buffet food. Lots of starches and low quality proteins. I guess that's how they make money but it was all very average and pretty sucky. The Chinese food was really bad.. nothing Chinese about it.. unless u figure Panda Express is from the mainland.. but PE blows this away in spades.. American.. was just crappy dried up prime rib.. with lows of bread and fillers.. Salad bar didnt even have seafood.. like shrimp etc..

I wouldn't recommend.. was just too low quality.. price was low.. like the quality.. $28 for two of us.. lol.. should have known..

After reading past reviews I was just expecting an average buffet. I decided to go anyway since I was coming to Aliante for a movie. I came for the Sunday brunch & with your players card it only comes out to $11. Everything was outstanding! Not your typical bland buffet food. Everything tastes fresh & full of flavor. Top it off with all you can drink mimosas!! Our waitress Rikki always made sure our drinks were filled & plates cleared away. She always had a smile. Bottom line, great food & outstanding service!

Hate to give a bad review, but if you like the Orleans buffet, please un-friend me. THIS WAS GROSS!

Seriously, this is crap. Hopefully Mr. Boyd does not show up at my house and takes this as constructive criticisms!

We had a comp, I still wanted a refund! the people in front of us paid $44 for 2 on Sunday Night "Summer Sizzling Southern Crab & Shrimp Boil". Which comes with a free beer. I asked the server about the free beer, he asked if he should go get it for us? What? I asked what kind, he replied "Blue Bell Beer" ... ummmm, again, what?   No, I guess we will pass, since we did not want to inconvenience the server.

Now, let us break this down - "Summer Sizzling Southern Crab & Shrimp Boil" - they got one part right, it was still summer. Sizzling? Nothing sizzling in here, maybe luke warm. Southern? Well, they did have crawfish, but they tasted funky. Crab & Shrimp Boil - yes, very bad crab legs ... shrimp boil? They had some popcorn shrimp that were kinda fried ... no boiled shrimp at all. Oh, and the meat?  They claimed it was tri-tip. Chewy and had a weird after taste

I have been in Las Vegas for over 20 years - and this was easily the worst buffet experience to date.

This is a typical casino buffet, a bit of a crap-shoot. Most of the food is pretty good, not spectacular. It's probably as good as you can make at home, but we do enjoy the variety.

In the past, we thought the desserts were particularly good here, but they weren't this time, which was very disappointing. 

However, IT IS A GOOD VALUE and you get plenty of food choices. I would not discourage you from going here, just don't expect fine dining. It's a good dinner though. (or lunch)

What a disappointment! This will be our 4th time here. Usually my husband and I are very pleased but after today's visit we won't be back! It started in line, on Sundays it's $13.99 or $12.99 with your players card. Usually I carry my card since I have a purse. Never has it been an issue where they only give one of us the discount but today the sassy grouch at the counter wanted my husbands card too. Oh well it's just $1. So we are seated at a table with no place settings and a bowl with one coffee creamer. I was waiting for a family to return to their table as if it was in use. the waitress comes and gets us silverware. She takes our order. Me: coffee and a water, him: champagne and an orange juice. She rolled her effin eyes at him! Really Zoraya? Is his order  really going to ruin your day with your busy section of 4 tables? She didn't even refill our drinks. We are good tippers since we both are in the service industry but this lazy horrible waitress got $0.00! like I said before usually the service is great, even on champagne brunch day. Today it looked like everyone was on the same cycle.
Been to eat at better buffets in Vegas. Steaks were tough, pecan pie looked green (see photo). I did like the Mexican section. Food seemed to sit out all day. Will not be back, sorry

This review is for the Friday night seafood buffet.  $31.99 for subpar food.  Before the renovation, the price was cheaper and the food was so much better.  King crab was also on the seafood buffet, but not anymore.

The crab legs were so skinny like the Chinese food buffet and the meat did not come out in 1-piece.  No matter what you did, the meat kept breaking apart and stuck in the shell.  The oysters had quite a bit of shell in the meat.  Luckily the crawfish was huge and the dungenous crab was pretty good.  

Prime rib was non existent but roast beef was on the menu.  When the prime rib did come out, it looked very dry and unappealing.  Everything else was just "average."

If you are charging $31.99 premium price for a seafood buffet dinner, the food better be up to par with the price that is charged.

Unfortunately, you are paying for their renovations with a lower quality food product than when it was the French Market Buffet.

Sadly I uses to love this buffet, but now I will never frequent this place as the quality has gone downhill.  The breakfast buffet is just as bad.  Please make the necessary changes if you want to charge strip buffet prices.

(Late post)

This review is really about the quality of the food and not about the staff or service.

I took my family here for the Mother's Day special (crab legs and prime rib) that they were having.  We live nearby and had not been to the buffet yet so we were really excited to try it for Mother's Day.

I have to say that I was very disappointed in what they had available for an occasion such as the one we attending.  With that said, besides the crab legs and prime rib, I'm sure what they were serving is pretty typical to what they serve everyday unless otherwise specified.  That's normally what most buffet restaurants do.  

Nevertheless, the quality of the items are what I was dissatisfied and disappointed in.  It all looked cheap and tasted that way as well.  What's worse, were the crab legs!  Most, if not all of the crabs legs looked like scraps - crab legs with no actual meat inside of them.  

Sounds strange right?  That's what I thought.  I've never been to a buffet restaurant where each one of my family members would grab a plate of crab legs just to return to our table with what appeared to be 80% of empty crab legs.

The disappointment comes in because the property is so nice.  But maybe that's my fault.  I have high expectations for the Aliante Resort Casino.  I mean, I didn't expect it to be Bachanal at Caesers or Wicked Spoon at the Cosmo but I did pay $25/person and so I wasn't expecting Jerry's Nugget either, lol.

Either way, I will try it again simply because it is by my house.  But honestly, that's really the only reason I'm going to give this place a second chance.

Came here yesterday for my first time as I haven't been here before I seen a couple of the reviews of this buffet and they were okay at best so I was skeptical came here at around almost 630 place was packed as there were people from a wrestling tournament from around the world staying here it was so packed that the lines were going almost out side. Anyhow me and my friend got in because me and him use the coupon we had where you get a free meal at the buffet so was lucky to not spend much of anything here. Now onto the food although it was good they didn't have many options to choose from with the foods at each station it was limited at best but the food was good just wish they kept up with the freshness of the food I went to get my plate the first time got some chicken bit into it as I sat down and it was dry and not that fresh but the second time I got some it was fresh and chewable just wish they were consisted with stuff like that also got the pizza it was good and hush puppies they were delicious and I got some mac and cheese out of the rest of the stuff I mentioned that was the worst no flavor bland and even if you added salt or pepper to it it still tasted awful. Besides that are server who got us our drinks worked her was very friendly and always at are table to make sure we were okay and got our refills we also gave him a tip as he worked hard and went that extra mile for us. Overall this buffet is okay would I say this buffet is one of the best out here no not a chance but you do get your money's worth besides the limited options of food and dessert and you'll leave here full I probably might come back one day as it's not really that bad and the customer service is good I give this place 3 stars.

Food taste: 4/5
Food variety: 5/5
Food quality: 5/5
Service quality: 4/5
Price: 4/5
Restaurant cleanliness: 4/5

Overall, it's one of my top three buffets in LV.

Took a December trip to Las Vegas for some family and friends fun time ! We visited the buffet at the Orleans hotel for dinner for the first time since it was remodeled. Standing outside the entrance - the remodeled buffet looks very nice and classy - quite a change from the old French Market Buffet. The name has also changed to the Medley Buffet. The buffet now has several cooking stations with much improved food ! The buffet was just OK before - now it's definitely gone up a notch ! Everything we had was very tasty and their selection was significantly improved ! I would now recommend the newly remodeled Medley Buffet at the Orleans !

Hands down better food than the Bellagio or the cosmopolitan. I would take the bus here from my resort, and then walk back to try and burn off some of the calories. it was so good I went twice.

Directions from the Las Vegas Strip at Tropicana. cross the street to the north side of of Tropicana. there you will find a bus stop. Take any bus going East, but there is usually only just one. get off one the Orleans is anounced.

Mike starting to get a Players Club card as this will give you one to two dollars off.

Directions to French Market is very well marked.

Once you pay and are stated the choices are unlimited. come prepared with what food styles you are looking for. the good stuff like the sea food and barbecue, it's at the far left. this is also where things get very exciting and tantalizing.

At least four different types of ribs in addition to a large carving station, with some of the largest portions of smoked brisket you can imagine. perfectly seasoned, with many rings of smoke, and a fatty bark if you request that. I always request fatty bark pieces. my serving was at least a half pound.

it's a good point to remember that it in a buffet like this, to take advantage of things that you don't normally get to eat so skip the salad bar and go for the expensive things like shrimp and grilled vegetables.

Shock and awe on the dessert station. the tiramisu was so good I went back for thirds.  but in addition there were several varieties of gelato as well as sugar free desserts.

Service was five-star five-diamond. but my diet Pepsi and my water never went empty and I did not have to ask. licked clean plates were whisked away unobtrusively when you would come back to the buffet. From the cashiers to the cleaning crew, everyone greeted you with a sincere smile and kind words.

What really stood out was the number of regulars and locals, that have a choice of hundreds of buffets. What keeps them coming back is the delicious food and service. and I do not have to reply on cheap gimmicks like the Cosmopolitan....stop putting food in different containers such as miniature skillets. this is nothing more than a gimmick to get you to eat less.

I would recommend French market to anyone visiting Las Vegas.
Don't trust the photos. The food is worst a school cafeteria food. I rather to pay a little bit more for better quality food.

So we promised the kids we'd  have a  buffet on this past trip to Vegas.  Just didn't want to break the bank to do it.  French Market Buffet was perfect for this situation.  Can't beat the $15.99 per person price for Champagne Sunday Brunch.  We were so happy that we could have peel and eat shrimp, crab legs and crawfish at this price.  The quality of the food is good, not great.  Definitely not the same quality that you'd find at a five star on the strip hotel, but if you are looking for good variety at a reasonable price, this is the place.  There was a carving station, great BBQ options, Mexican selections, Chinese Food , salad bar and standard breakfast fare.  The best part by far was the desserts.  Got our money's worth there alone....there was a huge selection of french pasteries, gelato, cakes, cobblers and other goodies.  If I was looking for top quality food/impressive selections, not sure this is the buffet I'd choose, but especially if you have kids, this is a wonderful option.
Buffet quality is getting worse each time. Seems like food is not prepared properly or is old. Three in party got sick after eating here.

The renovation looks good but the food is awful. If you're looking for bad food and bad service in a good looking buffet, this place will work for you. 

I went to the renovated buffet the week they opened. While the food was disappointing, there were a few items that were edible and I thought it showed promise. I went back today and I could barely find anything worth eating.  Anything that cost more than a few pennies to slop up was removed since their grand opening. 

They raised prices but lowered their food quality with the reopening.

In just a week food quality has fallen dramatically. If they keep this up they will just be serving ten versions of potatoes and twenty variations of cabbage  and some rice with nothing else soon. Instead of crispy fried chicken they had frozen pre-fried chicken wings which were cold, soggy and disgusting. Instead of a rich oxtail stew they had dried out "roasted" sweet potatoes. The clams and mussels were replaced with shells that were pretty much devoid of anything else. Their BBQ ribs were so over cooked and dry they were worse than jerky.  

Service was terrible as well. Waitress was very nice but she could not keep up with all her tables and our dishes were piled high and sitting there throughout the meal. 

It's such bad management to invest so much money and effort into creating a gorgeous new buffet only to ruin it by basically serving reheated the cheapest frozen foods out of some deep discount food warehouse.  I was really looking forward to this new buffet and utterly disappointed.  My review may be a bit harsh and overly critical but Ii really want management to fix this buffet.  There is so much potential to have a destination worthy buffet at the Orleans. 

I hope management rethinks their strategy and decides they should do better ... it's hard to do worse.
Ate breakfast buffet because of being hungry cereal was my choice, not worth the breakfast buffet don't waste you money beside the dessert don't waste your time and money ..!

We ate here when it was owned by Stations and I thought the buffet sucked. Since the new ownership I think the food is much better. $10.99 for dinner is a good deal especially if you have a 2 for 1. The BF likes Tuesday nights as they have Hawaiian roast pork.

Waited an hour in line to be told that my color players card was no longer used. So then had to wait 30 minutes for a new card and buffet was closed. What a disgraceful customer service. Won't ever come back for gambling or dinner after being treated like this and ruining my Friday night dinner.

I don't think I have ever been happier in my entire life. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is because it's not as convenient to get to.

$17.99 for champagne Sunday Brunch (without player's card) and they did not mess around with the champagne. They basically just poured the entire contents of the bottle into our drink glasses (and it was just two of us). The servers were very attentive and fun. 

The buffet itself: heaven

Made to order omelet station-delicious with plenty of options.

Seafood! Delicious baked clams, sushi, lox for bagels, calamari, and plenty if other options I did not even try (including crawfish which I thought I would try but instead became our table mascot).

Plenty of fresh fruit and cereals including oatmeal and grits. 

The rotisserie chicken melted in my mouth and had I not filled up on everything, else the honey glazed ham looked amazing. 

Dessert selection: wow. So many cookies, pastries, pies, and cakes to choose from, but I had to have the chocolate fountain. 

If I could have stayed for more time (and had a bigger stomach), I think I would have tried everything in the Mexican and Italian sections because everything looked delicious. 

Keep in mind that I have never been to another Buffet in Vegas, so perhaps there are better ones out there, however I know where I am going the next time I am in Vegas.
Good prices great service! I have been going to the breakfast buffet for years and am never disappointed.
Rude cashiers and hosts, some grouchy (rib and meat cutters) and nice (ice cream server) people behind the food counter, nice server, okay food. Don't waste your time or go when you're super hungry.

Very reasonable, especially if you have a players club card. So get one for the buffet. Great place to take the kids, and very well priced. Menu items from pretty much all over the globe. If you are in the area, or staying here, it is well worth it.

Food is ok . I really just ate desserts . Desserts ok . Overall customer service sucks . Cashier very dull. No customer service what so ever . When seated asked to sit near another family but we had to pay 1 dollar more to get seated near each other that's not the problem  at all what's the problem when I asked they brought that up but in a rude way... it's like paying for extra guacamole we charge more! . They sat us like maybe near each other but still refuse to put us next to each other knowing theirs an empty table there.  Jesshhh ok well first time here u could of said something  First and probably last. Customer service f-  had to call someone for refills when asked she asked what I needed in a very rude and like I just shouldn't of asked her anything . Stupid lady ur help obviously refill .. 0 stars

This place was okay. Ate here on a Friday night. Had the Alaskan King crab legs from their hot station where they serve you hot crab legs with clarified butter. Only problem I had was.....it smelled like fish. I have never had crab smelling like fish.     More like fish water.....if that helps. Crab supposed to smell like crab, not smelling of fish....water. Other than that even if Boyd Gaming now owns this casino, the buffet is basically the same as the buffets at Station Casinos. Meh.

I love it here! I've only been on Fridays for seafood night. The crab legs are amazing and everything else is just as good. I'm always full and satisfied when I leave.  The variety is amazing, I can't wait to return.

Customer service isn't the issue, it's the poor quality of food. Compared to other casinos in the area (Cannery, Santa Fe, etc) Aliante is nowhere near theirs. Food seems like it has been sitting under the heat lamps for 3 days. Go spend your money elsewhere.

this is one of the "to go" buffet when I visit LV.  honey love their desert, especially pecan pie.  I love their craf fish and filled my plate with shrimp.  sometimes, their green chile pork stew or shredded beef for taco are really delicious.  I only go there for lunch which ends at 3pm, you can eat till 4pm before they removed everything and shifted it to dinner. with their player's card, it's only $7.99 for lunch.  No boby can beat the price for the variety of food you can get.  yes, when I went Wed lunch, they do have beef ribs, beef brisket, roast chicken at the craving table.  I mean for that price, it's much better than hometown buffet which is the only choice I have at home. not all the food taste great, just need to find what you like.  egg rolls are always fresh and crisp, they do have the mogolian dish, I never have a chance or room for that, eat too much shrimp.... anyway, as long as you set your expectation correctly, you will be happy.

So far I have been here in Vegas for 3 days. I've had several buffets. Including one of the supposed 10 ten buffets in Vegas (Cravings) which totally sucked. The French Market Buffet was awesome. Very flavorful food with the perfect amount of seasoning... Thank u... After 3 days finally good food
Great new modern remodeling with expanded choices.   Great selections , always open omelet station and  a salad bar. Friendly service

Pretty good buffet and better than the surrounding local casinos.   Good salad bar and desserts.    Pizza also good.   Can't say anything is excellent but average or above.   One little thing I notice is that they must have a lazy food preparer in the back because their chicken for their fajitas and Chinese dishes is cut in large pieces and not small as usual. Try fitting them in a small corn tortilla and see what happens.   Same with some of the veggies.   That shows they rush things and need to be more attentive.  Service is also good. Like in most buffets they need to stir their foods more often.

I ate here with my family for breakfast. It cost around $9 a person. Pretty cheap for a breakfast buffet. There wasn't that long of a wait. This was my first time here. They had pretty normal/expected breakfast foods like pancakes, waffles, eggs, bacon, hashbrowns, etc. The food was ok. Nothing great that stands out that makes me want to eat here again. We ate here because one of my relatives were staying at The Orleans so we just ate the breakfast buffet here.

The food is ok for the price. If you're in the area and looking for a decent priced breakfast buffet, try this place out.

Been here many, many times.  It's not horrible but not at all worth full price.  The service has gotten better but is barely average.  Food is edible at best, nothing worth remembering.  The Last time we ate there a teenage kid vomited standing right next to my husband all over the floor and chair.  We told our server who didn't seem to care or even attempt to get it cleaned up.  Kind of ruined the whole buffet for both of us.
Great buffet,  newly remodeled,  added more to the menu and better quality food! Big difference from before.. We caught the dinner buffet $18.99 with a player's card.. Well worth it!

How funny that another group of people had a problem with the manager Rochelle  and the other person we had problem with the cashier Brittany. We are handicapped and most hotels have a handicapped line but we called to make sure and were to go.    So we went to the Medley Buffet at the Aliante Hotel and Casino.  On 2/13/15 we went there, it was about 6:30pm.  We were told that we should go where the handicapped placard. This is where we ran into Brittany and we asked her were are we suppose to go because there were 2 signs that had handicapped and also a black and a purple Aliante card.  Well Brittany said that the handicapped line was the main line and i said do we have to have these other 2 cards and she said yeah but you have to spend alot of money.  We then went to the rewards center and the manager was there, we dont remember his name but he was nothing but helpful. He walked  with the manager back to the Buffet and there was Rochelle.  He spoke to Rochelle and Rochelle talked to Brittany then all of a sudden Brittney Spouts out I never told them that, i then said yes you did and Im not going to argue with you about this.  It is what you said.  So the Rewards manager talked to the Rochelle and we were told that we will be next.  Once the rewards manager left, , Rochelle then opened her mouth and told Brittany to take this person, this person, this other person and then she said take 6 other groups before us.  Brittany then said to Rochelle that she already rang us up, Brittany even had our card and money in her hand.  Rochelle told her to clear it from her register, Brittany then handed me my money and card back.  My other half said that sh will not give our money to Aliante and she said lets go.  So we walked out of the hotel, still have not eaten and went home.  Rochelle was just a rude person and Brittany was no different.  Now Aliante will get NOTHING from us.  Rochelle and Brittany need to know what customer service really is.  If i were there boss, they would no longer be working for the Medley and also Aliante hotel and casino!!!!!!

I just went to this buffet this last weekend and boy was it worth it! The buffet was around $15 per person for dinner which wasn't too bad compared to all the other buffets esp. on the strip. They served all kinds of food like: italian, mexican, u.s.a., mongolian, chinese, bbq and delicious desserts. I was pleased with the variety of food and service was great. It was so much better than the Bellagio buffet. I totally recommend this place!

Super mediocre. This place was maybe 2 steps above Hometown Buffett.  But for 8 dollars, you get what you pay for.  

Me thinks this will only be good for people who are crawfish fanatics.  Something about sucking a crawfishes ass I can't get with.  

Everything was so bland and basic. The only thing I liked was the pizza because it was fresh out the oven.  The shrimp had that old smell to it. The fried rice was bland and dry.

I hear that their breakfast and dinner is delicious. But lunch was not.

They have a gelato bar. I think this is the direction dessert is going in Vegas buffets and i dig it.

The Orleans buffet might not be the most popular in Las Vegas, but in my humble opinion, it's one of the best! It consists a plethora of diverse dining stations. Each station has a wide variety of its particular cuisine. The food is great, the price is right and the staff is very personable. Your meal is discounted, when you use the hotel's B-connected card. They also offer a three meal (breakfast, lunch and dinner) pass at a discounted price. I highly recommend The Orleans Hotel buffet!

A buffet is a buffet is a buffet (unless you are willing to spend the BIG dollars to dine at the Bellagio buffet...THAT one is amazing.  But I digress...).  We came here with some free buffet tickets in hand (you've GOT to love free Vegas!) and without much of an appetite so we didn't try much.  Overall, the French Market Buffet isn't anything amazing, BUT it does have everything.  There were sections of food "types":  American, Mexican, Seafood, Asian, Italian and they each had a really decent selection.  The food was okay, the service was actually pretty good, and the atmosphere was typical buffet.  I think this is definitely a decent choice if you are staying here and want to eat on the cheap or with a lot of choices, but I wouldn't go out of my way to come here if I wasn't (especially with the other [better] choices that The Orleans offers).

Came to The Orleans strictly for the French Market Buffet! To my surprise the remodel was complete and now open as the Medley Buffet. The staff was amazing in accommodating our large party  and Miss Peggy was our waitress and she was awesome! The Buffet itself left a little to be desired but I still got my money's worth. It's going to run you about $12/ per person for  breakfast, $15 per person for lunch, and $20/ per person for dinner . What I remember starting from the left to the right:
Salad  bar with traditional items and pasta salads, soup bar with about 3-4 options, southern type food like black eyed peas and greens, Asian American food, sushi bar , omelette bar with breakfast items, rotisserie chicken, ham, roast beef, then enchiladas and a nacho bar and a taco bar, with traditional Mexican soups. Lastly was the  Italian section with vegetarian lasagna, pasta bar, ceased salad with house made dressing, and three types of pizza .
