Finally we have reached the  dessert  section that was home to three types of freshly baked cookies , about 10 flavors of gelato , individual mini dessert and cakes . Fountain drinks are included in your price with free refills so don't be afraid to quench your thrust! Plan to spend an hour and a half 2 hours dining at a pace that ensures getting your money's worth. In case you need to drop and reload midsession the restrooms are located right outside of the venue across the casino.
Not worth the cost.  Limited choices and poor food quality.  Will never go back, let aline take a guest.

Love, love, love this place. Great food, friendly staff and great prices. Perfect for that off the strip place. Italian food great, Mexican food (enchiladas) great and the sweets are "oh so wonderful." You might wait a hot minute at holidays but that's ok. Oh also parking is free.

If I had a choice, I'd still eat at the Courtyard Cafe with the lower rating I gave that because I don't like waiting in line, and it was a long wait - but mostly because it was senior day, and all the seniors who were members of B-Connected had their buy one get one free coupons.  I also don't like competing for food at the buffet line.  So, that said, what I'm saying is that the cons are that i don't like that the place was too popular.

And I can understand why it was popular on the day we went.  Of course, the senior couples are eating at half price, which is a great deal because the regular price for lunch is $8.99.  $8.99 itself is a very good price for this buffet.  The variety is good: you have American, Italian, Asian, Mexican, etc. stations, and the quality is good for a buffet (I tend to rate buffet food with a lower expectation that sit-down food).  I enjoyed the shredded pork carnitas, the chile verde pork was okay, and the bbq ribs, I enjoyed also - I can't remember everything I had, now, but I do remember sampling a variety, and I normally don't do that at a buffet.  I normally have two servings and stop.  Here, I think I went back three times, then went for soup (I had a cup/bowl of the hot and sour, and that was a bit disappointing - the broth was too thin).  

The popular item seemed to be the craw-fish. I passed by tables where people had stacks of craw-fish on their plates.  I myself, took a nice quantity of shrimp, and except for peeling the shell, basically had a nice shrimp cocktail (on a plate). 

If the line is super long, like out the door (as it was this day), I'll probably end up at the Courtyard cafe, but if the line is not too bad, and I'm hungry, you'll be finding me in this line.

I have been a loyal fan of this place since 2008.  My brother and mom live in the area and they are regular customers. To me, are more hits than misses.  First off, I love this buffet over many of the others in town because of the prices which can vary from $8 for breakfast to $25 on Prime Rib and Seafood night, with discounts for most meals with a Player's card.  And you can thank gamblers whose lost wages make the price lower than restaurants without losing gamblers.  I love that buffets faster, no one screws up your order, and you don't have to leave a 15% tip.  As regular customers, though, my brother, Mom, and I always leave $4-5 for our servers who all recognize us by now and always treat us well and know our drink selections and bring refills without asking.  That's a special treat during the Saturday and Sunday brunch when the mimosas flow freely.  

The hits include the brunch omelet bar when you can even order egg white versus whole egg...with a wide array of combinations.  I always order everything in it, including melted cheese and jalapenos. Usually, their piles of bacon are crisp and not greasy.  I also love the times they have Prime Rib, not the regular roast beef. which can be dry sometimes. The Prime Rib is great with fried rice or various potato versions.  I enjoy the pulled pork in the Southern section with sweet yam casserole and collards.  In the Mexican area, I like the tacho bar and menudo with a rich broth, and you don't have to eat the tripe if that's ain't your thing. The good soups are clam chowder and cream of mushroom.  

And since most of us don't eat enough veggies, there are some decent choices such baked yams, plain boiled peas and carrots, Chinese stir-fried eggplant and bok choy, Italian style summer squash, and buttered carrots and green bean casserole when available. To me, their tastiest vegetable dish is the baked yam casserole. The roast pig  night on Tuesday is great, and is a favorite with the large FIlipino community here in North Vegas. Thursday night is pasta night...they pile shrimp on their Fettucine Alfredo.  The words "I'm on a diet" are prohibited on those nights.

Their salad bar quality varies with the seasons.  Don't expect really sweet melon in the winter.  The salad bar choices are good but somewhat limited.  I would like to see more and variable prepared salads...But  I like their cole slaw, imitation krab, and carrot raisin salads. Eat some jello, too....it's made from beef collagen and good for your joints.

The desserts selection and quality vary, but their pies,  pastries, and cakes are usually decent though not particularly memorable.  My favorite dessert when available is the chopped hazelnut chocolate bar. I also like their ice creams.  

The misses to me include the orange chicken and sweet and sour pork.  Anything deep fried with sauce on it is always gummy.  But that's not just here, but almost anywhere.  Their corn on the cob is rarely sweet. Their Alaska king crab I like but some say it's too salty for me.  I don't like their burger patties that sit out.  If you can't tolerate smoke, that might be an issue because smoking is allowed in this Casino, like all Nevada casinos.  Most people don't smoke in the aisles walking to the buffet, though.  And their air filtration system is state of the art, for what it's worth.  Also, there is no bathroom in the restaurant, so bring your alcohol wipes or wash hands before entering.  
 
The lines can be long during Mother's Day, night time, and weekend brunch.  If you ever have a large party, please talk to them know beforehand and don't go during the busiest time.  We once had 15 people at 11 AM and it was a fantastic time.  And if you have any handicapped person in your party, they try to seat them ASAP.

But really, the best thing to me is the service of the staff.  A few of them come up to my mom who's been a regular customer since 2008 and give her a hug or a warm hello.  The value is overall pretty good.   When unlimited breakfast is $6 with beverage if you have a Player's Card, for the price of a fast food breakfast, it's hard to beat.

The buffet is located at the Orleans hotel.  We came here for Sunday brunch which was about $14 per person.  They charge adult prices for any kid 8 years or older even though they don't eat like adults.  They separate their food by regions, American, Asian, Mexican and Italian.  They also has a separate section for desserts. This was typical buffet food, the ribs were my favorite.  The omelet station is a little different.  The ingredients for your omelet are in a salad bar and you grab what you want and place it in a bowl.  You then give the bowl to the cook who then makes your omelet.  Overall, food was decent for the price you pay.

AWESOME! Affordable, delicious, tons to choose from. Ate here multiple times and always had a good meal. Breakfast is my fave and if you go around 10am, they switch to lunch about 10:30/45 so you can get those choices too!

Don't try taking a piece of fruit with you to go though. They'll stop you! :-P
Everytime we go to Vegas it's a must love their Breakfast buffet. .Prices are pretty good...
Good food good prices for the family. Service is really great food is fresh. Don't pass up the ice cream bar.

$15 for an all you can eat buffet that includes PRIME RIB? I AM IN!

The prime rib was my favorite. I really ate about 3 slices. & thats ALOT because i ate the other food as well. The workers were very nice and the reasonable amount of items on the buffet were okay. I was sad they didn't have FRIED CHICKEN but its okay.

I'm not too sure if we'd be coming back here, but it was a nice change and surprise.

I was pleasantly surprised to eat at this buffet in the Orleans Hotel and casino. It was moderately priced not much of a long wait and really, really decent.

I went for breakfast, primarily. I enjoyed the really crispy bacon, the scrambled eggs we're perfectly scrambled and fluffy. I also enjoyed the buttermilk pancakes. I've been to buffets in Vegas such as Caesars Palace, the Bellagio, Winn, Harrah's, The Flamingo, Rio, pH, etc. This one was nearly half the cost and was about as good as most. Nothing fancy but good and satisfying.

The service, on the other hand, was very lacking and almost non-existent. I basically got up and got my own coffee and tipped accordingly.

We had a large party of 13, so was a bit challenging getting us in, but we all waited for a few tables.  The selections are good, there is a BBQ section with beef ribs, chicken, bbq beans, corn bread, a New Orleans section with Jambalya, gumbo, collard greens, mud bugs and red beans and rice, a Chinese section of fried rice, noodles, char Sui, a carving board section of roasted chicken, turkey and roast beef, gravy mashed potatoes, an Italian section of pastas and pizzas.  A salad and soup bar and a dessert section with selections for diabetics.  Serve was nice, refilled our sodas, Walter and coffee.  There is just nothing that jumps out at you that says delicious, mediocre buffet food, the crawfish was good, collard greens good, hush puppies good, roasted turkey was dry, gravy ok, couldn't find the bread.  Ice cream or the gelato was very fluffy/airy, not a good texture, soft serve I passed, the cookies were ok.  Again, nothing stands out at this buffet.

There is no buffet that I frequent more than this one, and not just because it's close-by, but because for the price you get a pretty good meal!  It's even better if you're a gambler there because you get a discount, sometimes a comp!  I have been coming here for years, and the food is always consistently good.

They offer the usual American-Asian-Mexican-Italian-salad bar standard that I've come to expect in the average buffet here in Vegas, so you shouldn't feel like you won't find something you'll enjoy.

I eat here once a week or so, and my favorite go-to items are their BBQ items... I love their ribs and their brisket!  I also judge buffets by their mashed potatoes and I believe this buffet has some of the best in town -- none of that powdered potato crap, this stuff is legit, smothered in yummy butter!  They have a mongolian grill if you're the type who likes fresh-grilled asian fare as well.

They have a really great selection for dessert!  Although my favorite is always the gelato, if you're lucky enough for them to have chocolate chip cookies that day, make sure you swoop some up!  

I usually go for lunch or dinner, but the other day I woke up early enough for the breakfast buffet for the first time in a long time, and was pleased to see that they offered many gluten-free items, and their made-to-order omelets were on point!

Great selection and affordably-priced, this is my little gem of a buffet off the strip.

This place is an awesome value for the money. It was cheap to begin with, but they recently lowered prices and you still get a discount with a Coast Card, even if you have no points on your card. A lot of people seem to just go for the crawfish, which were OK, but nothing special since they appear to have just been boiled in water. I'm used to them being boiled in seasoning so I don't really like them plain. However, there is so much more to eat than the crawfish. The salad bar is nothing special, but they had watermelon. I think they are just coming into season since I didn't see them at too many other buffets. There were lines for the watermelon here. I was lucky to grab some just as they were restocking.

My friends reported the BBQ station was very good, but I mostly skipped it since we had Brazilian BBQ the night before and I wasn't really in the mood for more meat. I ended up eating a lot from the Cajun station and the USA station. The Asian station had stuff for Mongolian BBQ, but I didn't see too many people take advantage of it. I should have since I love Mongolian BBQ, but I really couldn't take too much grease that day. The Mexican station had stuff for DIY tacos, but I was too lazy. The pasta station was probably the most disappointing. The pizza was OK, but the other items were either horribly mislabeled or complete failures. It could have been the former since they did have Salisbury steaks in the USA section labeled as terriyaki chicken.

The dessert section is a big surprise. Not only did they have some pretty good cakes and rolls, they also had a good gelato selection. Overall, I really enjoyed this buffet. I honestly could have paid twice as much and still be fairly satisfied. They also have beer and wine specials ($6 bottle of wine) for those who are interested. The only negative was our server seemed kind of upset the whole time, although she did occasionally refill our drinks and take our plates.

By far my favorite buffet in Las Vegas.  The food is outstanding, the selection is great, and the service is also great.  You also cannot beat the prices.  $7 for breakfast if you're a B Connected Players Club member or a guest at the hotel.

Even if I'm not staying at the Orleans during my visit, I will make it a point to get to this off-strip hotel for breakfast, lunch, or dinner at the buffet.  I highly recommend doing the same for others as well.  You will not be disappointed.

I've been here many times before but tonight I am soooo disappointed. First after we pay the gentleman  in the tux looks at us and does not say a word to greet or to let us know we need to wait to be seated. We wait then the girl comes to take us to our seats. I wait over 10 minutes in an empty buffet for someone to get my drinks ordered. Usually  my grandma is very simple to satisfy but even for her she tried different things and finished non of it. The food was cold the pork was dry. I don't know what happened but I used to think this place was pretty  decent but not after tonight's Tuesday night hawaiian pork night. My $23 is better spent on 2 meals elsewhere. Thumbs down you guys. Thumbs down.

Been going here for 15 Yrs Plus. Best Food, Quality Selection, Great Fresh Flavors, Many Stations to choose from, and very reasonably priced. Forget about the big Casino Over Priced Crap. Great Deal Right Here.

The seafood is what gives it 3 stars, the service wasn't courteous and it was messy everywhere. It's a decent buffet, desert is ok, price is ok, hot chocolate is good, 
I see myself going again, only for the seafood (:

For the price, this is an excellent buffet.
Been here 4 different times for lunch and each time it's exceeded expectations.
Everything from salads, soups, entree selections, and the deserts were all well prepared, fresh and flavorful.
Looking forward to our next trip to LV, and will be hitting this buffet at least a couple times :)
Oh, and the Hotel rooms and Casino are also excellent!
Food was just plain, not of a lot of variety either. Not a place I'd be eager to come back too.

***Friday lunch review***
CHEAP!!!!...but expect what you paid for...

We've always wondered and were curious about the casino buffets away from the strip.  On Friday around noon, we had to go to AutoZone and Orleans Casino just happened to be around the corner...we said...why not?

The buffet has no lines which was nice...Yes it is nothing like the buffet you experience on the strip but for the price, it is ok...not bad.

* Price:  $8.99/person...CHEAP

* Food: NO CRABS but small cocktail shrimps with shells still on them.  My most memorable was Mongolian BBQ...it's descent (oh don't ask for beef...it's tough and tasteless) Crawfish available...but dry.  Oh I would stay away from the desserts...

* Service = pretty attentive.

* Ambiance = honestly, it has a feel of run-down old casino buffet but it's ok.  It has it's charm...very relaxed and casual.  

Ok, no sophisticated gourmet here...basically, if you dream of being able to go to a mall food court and eat whatever you want, all you want....this place is it.

I've never seen steak cooked on a gas grill with 1' high flames. They looked like charcoal and surprisingly enough...  tasted like charcoal.

Second round I asked if they had any steaks that weren't being charred and they brought out a pan with several steaks that looked like they had been microwaved. No flavor at all.

The good news is that I like salads, but for some reason the salad bar only had salad and a few toppings. 

Management should be required to eat the food they are serving. I get that its a buffet, but it is possibly the worst buffet I've eaten at and I've been to a hotdog buffet at a bowling alley in Pahrump... 

Cut up my player card and not going back.

Garbage. 

This place used to be awesome before it became Medley buffet. Now the food sucks. 

They used to have seafood on the weekend (Fri and Sat). Then they changed it to just seafood on Fri. Now they have completely got rid of seafood night. WTF?! 

By the way, they also raised the price. For whaaaaat???? Luckily we get comped dinners here. There is no way in hell I would pay for this food.

For anyone thinking of coming here without a comp, please don't waste your hard earned money and go somewhere else.

I stayed at the hotel, that portion was great. However their buffet is probably one of the worse ones I had while I was in Vegas. The dinner buffet was about 15$ which is cheap for dinner, but the food wasn't all there, the beef was dry, the desserts seemed old and it tasted like it' sbeen sitting out there for a while. The best part was that they had italian meat balls that were tender because they were overcooked in the sauce. I would say avoid this buffet and goto in and out about 4 blocks towards the strip.

Finally tried their Sunday champagne brunch.  Only complaint was that we overate.  Line was about 15 minutes long, service was good, food was fresh and had great selections.  Getting refills on drinks was no issue and the champagne tasted great.

Service was good, that's what the 2 stars are for. 
Came for the seafood and it was not good. Extremely salty crab legs ( the main thing we came for) and the rest of the selection of seafood was blah. Live and learn , I guess.

Yuck. I was in the area and hungry so I decided to stop in for the Sunday brunch buffet, which is $11.99 pp with a players card. It was a little after noon when we got there but the brunch is supposed to be until 3. All the breakfast items were cold, old and hard. I tried the eggs and they were hard and crusty. The French toast was rock hard and the sausage patties were inedible. The best thing I had was a bagel with lox and cream cheese! The dessert section was lame, but they did have gelato and a variety of soft cookies. I tried the spumomi gelato and added little mini marshmallows on top and I almost broke my tooth chewing on one of the marshmallows. I will not be back.

This review is for December 22, 2016. This buffet is located inside the Orleans Casino. If you have a players card, there is a BOGO deal. 

The customer service, particularly the front, I was not satisfied with. The woman who rung me up had an attitude the whole time. I asked her how the BOGO deal worked because my dad did not know, she rolled her eyes at him and ignored him. I had to ask another hostess. 

The variety of choices of the buffet was amazing. They had USA, Asian, Mongolian, Seafood and Barbecue. The chefs were fast paced ensuring each tray was stocked. The quality was great as well. I'm very particular with how I like my barbecue, but none of the meats were too salty or underdone. I appreciated that.

My son and I didn't really know what we wanted to Eat, so he suggested going to the buffet since we has a two for one coupon. They have American, Tex-Mex, Italian, Asian, & BBQ. The Asian food definitely has the best selection and quality. Of course they also have a soup and salad bar with fresh fruit. And they have a great dessert bar with cookies, different cakes and pies, and ice cream. $16.99 or $12.99 with a player's card for dinner!

Tried the lunch buffet here this past Saturday around 2pm-ish  - pretty decent for the price of $10 per person and they weren't super busy at that time.

Service: 

The service was okay - our waiter was a bit slow and they didn't really clear out our plates as quickly as we ate...actually it would stack up quite a bit before he or anyone came to clear it. He was also hard to wave down to get refill on drinks. It did get a little busier with big parties of people coming in - looked like there was a graduation somewhere cause a lot of graduates came in to eat with their families. 

Food:

They have pretty good selection of cuisines and not to mention an unbelievable amount of choices at the dessert section. They had a lot of comfort food for sure - fried chicken, mac n cheese, jambalaya, etc. What's interesting was that they had really good pizza - usually buffet pizzas are okay - but the pizza here was really cheesy and the crust was really perfect - not super thick and not too thin - so to my surprise I think their pizza was pretty awesome. 

They had a lot of good choices for desserts too - 7 different flavors of Gelato - the peach ice cream was the best and the Watermelon Sorbet was very refreshing. In addition, they also had Tiramisu, red velvet cake, cookies and just too many to name - However I did like their Chocolate Cream Pie the most - it was pretty heavenly. 

Overall this was a pretty decent buffet for a pretty fair price - at least for lunch. I would come back here again.

My family and I came to eat at this place (7 total). They have No Children's Price and No Senior Price. My son is 7yrs. old and my grandmother is 95yrs old. We paid for the price for 7 adults. 

They sat us by connecting 3 tables that are not even and seems that the table was not wiped down clean. Tried asking if we can be move since they have sooooo much open area but they can't. The carpet floor at my end table had a very bad odor. And their high chair need to be clean way better, it was dirty. Instead I held my 1yr old on my lap. Our server was ok.

The food was really good and different than the other buffets. my only complaint was that the crawfish was plain. and for a place that is supposed to resemble new orleans they should have put creole seasoning on it. i didn't like how the server was rushing us to get out of the place since it was mother's day and a line. overall most of the food was very good and the price was great.

When I was in Vegas last year, I came to the Orleans French Market Buffet. When I showed up this year, I was surprised to see a total redesign and re-vamp, now as the Medley Buffet.

First, although the previous buffet was cute and rustic, it was clearly aging. I love the new set-up and decor. Its chic and modern and I like that it feels more "open" and fresh.

That said, the food was hit or miss. Some things were pretty good, while others weren't great. The shrimp scampi and the stuffing were mushy, but the cuts of turkey and salad bar were delicious. It seemed to be like that with most of the food, so quality wasn't consistent. 

Our waitress was a bit MIA most of the night. I get that its a buffet so you don't need constant attention, but we didn't see her often and that made it difficult to get refills on drinks or dirty plates taken. Other than that, the service was adequate. 

There's a nice variety on desserts but I don't like the addition of having some of the small desserts behind the glass case and having to ask for them. It made it feel like I was inconveniencing them, or that I shouldn't take as much, even though its a buffet and had they been out in the open I would've gotten one of each. 

Overall, its a decent value buffet. I would come here for a lunch and maybe a dinner again. There are better buffets around, but this wasn't the worst by far.

Love the food selections and quality available. Seating arrangement however is very uncomfortable as tables are pretty close to each other. Customer service with waiters are usually a drag and they hardly care for you. Overall, I would come back but hesitant to recommend to others.

The Medley Buffet was average. We went for Sunday Brunch and it was ok. The food was good except the eggs benedict and shrimp pasta. The shrimp did not taste fresh. The mimosas were extremely weak. I question if there was any champagne. The decor was nice and the wait was short. I would go again but it was not 4 stars.
This place is pretty good and really good for the price. Compared to other places I've been that cost more or the food sucked I will come back here again the next time I'm in Vegas.

This buffet was mediorce from the beginning.Wanted to pay seperatly....cashier could not figure out how to do it.We get seated.We go to the buffet.Fake crab meat in the ceveiche.I asked server what the steak was? She said it steak.It was rib eye....looked liked donated beef of anything....maybe beef to be discarded.She would identify the steak.I did not eat eat it.I chose the ny strip and prime rib.Both were just edible.The rest of the dishes were just ok.....edible....not really good.For the money....
not worth it.Inferior food......They need. to improve the quality and up the price

This is for Sunday brunch .it was ok, I was kinda disappointed but I think my expectations were just too high. They have a pretty decent variety of lunch and breakfast items. Nothing was bad but nothing wowed me either. But you will definitely find something to eat. And it was cheap
 10.99 with the club card. So for the price it's definitely worth it.

Awful and over priced! We come to Vegas every year and we drive to the Orleans hotel and Casino for their amazing breakfast Buffet.  We arrived to the Buffet to find that it was closed and under construction. There was the other breakfast buffet inside the same hotel. It was 13 dollars per person which was more than we were used to paying at this type of venue but we were there and hungry so we gave it a shot. We were so disappointed. Firstly we were there at 9 am. Not anywhere close to lunch and there we more dinner food items then there were breakfast....crawfish, ribs and salad bar. Don't get me wrong I don't have a problem with that except that there was no yogurt, fruit, grits,ect. The only bread they had was held in an area that you had to wait in line for an employee to make toast. Our 7 year old got pizza which looked and tastes like it sat for two days. We had to pay full price for a 7 year old which made the experience that much worse. 
 The wait staff brings you drinks. Ours was was not friendly and when she asked if We needed refills she didn't even wait for an answer and had already walked away.

Don't waste your money at this place.

After hearing about this buffet by many friends recommending it, I decided to make the trek over to the pretty Aliante Casino to try it out...

Atmosphere:
As previously stated, the Medley Buffet is located inside of the Aliante casino. The seats are pretty comfortable, and the decr is visually pleasing. It's very nice on the eyes. However, there isn't a bathroom inside the actual restaurant. You have to go outside of it to the casino floor over next to the TGI Fridays. Not a big deal, it's just inconvenient when your daughter needs to go. Also, due to where the restaurant is located, the place smells terribly of cigarette smoke and the perfume they spray to combat it. It's to be expected, since it IS a casino, but just be warned that it IS there. 

Price:
The price for this particular buffet is fairly expensive for the quality of food I had received, in my opinion. We paid $12 per person, including the child price and using the Aliante Players Club card. It is more expensive on Fridays and the Weekends too, so please take that into consideration. (We went on a Thursday night) They do give a discount for people with a players club card (which is free!), so I suggest that you get that first for a couple bucks off each person. 

Food:
The food here is decent. They have different stations clearly labeled above them such as Mexican, Italian, Barbecue, Asian, and traditional American food. The desert selection isn't too vast or impressive, but what is there is pretty good. Unfortunately, though, the food isn't much different from other, cheaper buffets such as Golden Corral or Ryan's. 

Overall, I wouldn't necessarily say to go out of your way to go to this buffet, but if you're nearby, can afford it, and your party can't decide what type of restaurant to eat at, then stop on by and fill your bellies up until you can't walk out!

I was very impressed. I have tried a few buffets in town and I've falling in love with one. But it's very expensive. I heard a few good reviews about this one so we decided to check it out. It was nothing short of amazing. Great customer service. The food was amazing. 10.99 for brunch with a players card. Fresh omelettes made to order. So many items to choose from. I enjoyed everything I picked. I left feeling so full. I will definitely be back and I will ring family here too.

Orleans has stepped up their buffet since the previous one! The food was delicious and fresh! Each time I would get up to get more food, the seafood dishes would restock like the crawfish, oysters, and mussels. The waiter was polite and very attentive towards each table with their needs. The only thing disappointing from this seafood dinner was the crab. Usually the crab would be snow crab legs however today was dungeons crab legs which doesn't have too much meat in them.
You can't beat this for $15.  It is worth the short drive off the strip.  Food is decent.  Staff is nice.  Great if you have a big group to feed and don't want to drop $20+ a head.

This buffet is ok. I used to like it a lot more when they had steak night on Saturdays. Once Aliante was bought out by Boyd they seemed to make small changes and now Saturday night is prime rib/shrimp night. Lines here are hit or miss. It's usually totally dead during weekday breakfast and lunch, but can get packed at night especially when they have their specialty nights: Tuesday pig roast, Wok Wednesdays, and pasta Thursdays.

My favorite things here are usually the BBQ meats - pulled pork, baby back ribs. The pig roast on Tuesdays is good but the meat goes quick, so you need to grab it as soon as they put out a fresh pig. Wednesday night is basically Mongolian BBQ/stir fry. They get super backed up though so it may be a good 15 min before you receive your cooked creation.

I live in the area so we drop by a few times a year. If you don't live up north, I wouldn't recommend the trek up just to eat here. It's really not that great!

I've been coming to this buffet for over a decade just for the BBQ station and the  ribs! They have a fair selection of foods to keep you happy and its all very tasty. 

Dont tell anyone ......but i heard they added a new chocolate fountain.....*wink wink*

I have been going to the Orleans and this buffet for many years. It has always been my favorite buffet and game me an excuse to spend the day in the casino, aside of the many times that I have stayed at the Orleans. However, I went to the Orleans on 7/4/17 to go to the buffet followed by the casino visit. The regular buffet area was closed and they had a mock buffet on the other side of that part of the casino. The line wasn't long, but we had to wait for 45 minutes to be seated. The food was about 1/4 of the amount of choices that the other buffet had, and it was of poor quality. The employees were commenting on how bad this was. We got it over with and I lost interest in the casino. I emailed the Orleans and received a response from Rhonda, the buffet manager. Basically I was told that that's just the way it is. They charged the regular price and did not notify their gambling customers that there was a change. Rhonda said that she hopes that I will come back to that buffet sometime, though wasn't acknowledging that there was a problem with their setup. I'm done there and maybe someone else will avoid wasting their money sometime.

Went for the seafood buffet...was so excited to have the crab legs but they were dissappointing. Im not sure if it was not cooked well or just bad crab but it was more work than it was worth.   Crab meat was sticking to the tendens so when you then cracked the shell the meat wouldnt come out. Tried the prime rib and it was so bad and overcooked hid it under a plate and sent it to the garbage. Tried eggrolls they were terrible... the only thing good was the clam chowder which was actually amazing.

After the NBA Summer League was over, me and a couple friends wanted to find a buffet that was decent & good priced despite being in VEGAS. I believe this hit the mark exactly. At $22, i thought this was a reasonably priced Buffet in the Orleans Hotel & Casino.

The food was A-OK in my opinion is slightly better than the average home town buffet in your local town. I got my fill and did not feel gross after lol. this Buffet worked out and 3 out of 5 is exactly the kind of food your getting. Nothing that makes you say this is good but will fill you properly.

One of the best places to eat in Vegas. Huge selection and huge seating area the line to get in is never long only on Friday and then it's only 10 to 15 minutes. The Friday seafood buffet is amazing i go almost every Friday, if you have never been you're missing out.

Terrible, bland food and even worse service if you can even call it that. First of all, the buffet was half empty and yet we had to wait 10-15 min in line to even pay and then another 10 min to be seated. Once we got in, we got no service at all once our initial drinks came. It seemed like the waiter had some type of issue with us even though we said nothing to him besides what we wanted to drink. Something was clearly wrong though because he never came back to our table, despite walking by a hundred times during our meal. He walked with his head up but whenever he got close to our table, he would look in the other direction as if to ignore us and continue serving the other tables around us. Is it a crime to be Asian now? WTF. This was very offensive and that's not even considering that we never got refills, napkins or service whatsoever.

The food isn't much better. Everything that I tried was either overcooked or bland except for the fried chicken wings and ice cream which ended up being most of what I ate. Healthy right? The entire Asian section was terrible and I was forced to waste an entire plate of food. How do you over cook broccoli beef or forget to season chow mein so that it tastes like nothing? I just don't get it. Worst buffet experience I've had in Vegas and I've been to some seedy and dirty looking buffets...Will not be back and would not recommend

Fairly good place to eat. Service on drink refills was a bit slow that's why I gave it 4 stars.  Food was good and fresh.  Good selection of food.   A good place to eat if you have kids or a large group of people.  Everyone gets what they want and no waiting.

I went here for Seafood night on 6/30/17. I waited about an hour in line (not the restaurant's fault; it's an extremely popular night!) and was then seated after paying. The waitress (Cherie) promptly welcomed us and took our drink orders, and was clearly working hard in her packed section to keep drinks filled and clear the plates, most of which were filled with crab legs! She was a great server, and appeared much more friendly than some of the others there. As for the food, what an incredible selection of seafood, and other food. Crab legs, cold crab, mussels, clams, baked fish, fried fish, sushi, and more, as well as all the other usual international stations. The price is very reasonable IMO at $26.99/ $24.99 with players card, considering that you can eat all you want, and drinks are included. Definitely a fantastic choice when you feel like a splurge!

Average is the best way to describe this buffet. It's reasonably priced. The service was fine. Of course there was a wide range of choices. The healthy options were actually pretty good. As were the desserts. The biggest disappointment was what they called brisket in the BBQ station. Basically it was awfully similar to eating at Golden Corral.

A mirror image of Red Rock's buffet...which is a good thing..lotsa people here during a military appreciation  night...the food is plentiful and fresh..it's Wok Wednesday  if ya wanna stand in the line, I'm sure you'll eat well. I put together a yummy thanksgiving plate..
Disappointed - not my idea of a Vegas buffet. Poor service and microwave quality food - I guess as the saying goes - you get what you pay for

The food and prices makes up for the long wait time getting in. I definitely recommend this place to everyone. I have been to many buffets in Vegas and this is by far the cheapest. So if you want a Cheap quality Buffet, and don't want to pay the high price of one, this is the spot you're looking for.

The food is mostly dry. I had one tamale and it was horrible I was only able to eat the meat. Some of their food is doughy as though it's not cooked all the way. Their pies are very dry. The ribs were not eatable, they were so dried out I couldn't even chew it. The best part is the ice cream swirl. I wished this place was better. Circus Circus has one of the best buffets. Also our waiter Tony, no personality. I don't like when someone is talking to you without looking at you instead they look over your head. What happened to friendly staff that smile?

Medley Buffet is the name of the Orleans new buffet. It replaces the French Market Buffet which had been the casino's buffet since they first opened some 20 years ago. It's theme matched the casino. I actually liked the French Market Buffet and had been going for years. It had a very casual atmosphere and it was decorative, the Mexican food section had a Mexican theme decor, the Chinese food section had a Chinese theme decor, and so on. It had character. I liked the layout. One big section in the middle for desserts. Matching fruits, salad, and soup sections on each side of the buffet. And a row of everything else stretching across the entire length of the buffet starting. Most of the food wasn't the greatest but their BBQ section had to be one my favorites.

This new buffet is a lot brighter and a lot "fancier" looking than before. The layout is just one long row stretched across the length of the buffet. They have the usual Asian, Italian, BBQ, and Mexican sections with various items changed and even improved. The dessert section is a lot smaller but offered some better items. The soups, salads, and fruits section is ok. There's grilled steak. There's these thick short ribs which was my favorite item. I ate a bunch of them. The BBQ section seemed smaller but they still had the BBQ beef ribs which was good. They have crepes, pho, el pastor tacos, and those Mexican corn on the cob.

Overall it's not bad of a buffet though I've had better in the price range. It was about $20 for regular dinner, non-seafood night.

Food here is average. Ate here many times. This review is a classic "I was mistreated" type of review. 

I showed up 3 min late. My fault no doubt. Along with about 10 others who were turned away. Considering just two days ago I got in line 10 min late I was surprised that they were enforcing the clock so strictly. But "rules are rules."

What I can't handle, though, is being lied to. I was watching hundreds of people in line for a buffet, and they told me that they "didn't have someone who can take my money." (lie) Then I'm told there are "no open tables," when I could see many open tables. (lie #2) Our group is then told that there is a "power issue" (possible lie). I asked, "so what about all those people in line to eat, are you going to make them all leave?" She says "yes." I was floored and said I would like to see that... So she then starts going table to table, but nobody actually leaves.

I know this because at this point I was standing away from the front door looking at my phone deciding where to go for food when hotel security surrounds me ...

Now ... I know that I was late and I know that they weren't going to let me in. I lost, I moved on. I never yelled, I never made threats or swore. I had what I thought was nothing more than a conversation with a restaurant manager. The fact that she resorted to calling security shows that she is out of her depths in a position of leadership. I cannot imagine what she would have done if I truly was a risk. 

I can handle being rejected. But if you are going to obviously lie to me then I have a problem with you insulting my intelligence. Just say, "sir, we don't want to let you in " and be done with it. Telling me you "can't" and then making up of a bunch of made up nonsense is really insulting.

And a manager should learn how to be firm without having to call security. That was downright offensive and embarrassing.

Wow so much better than before. Newly renovated with more food options. Best buffet I went to while here in vegas. Couches to sit on while you wait for your table. Take out a players card and you will get $2 off- it is free to get a card btw. Lots of delicious options. Leave room for dessert for some gelato. Those little baskets they put food in are cute. so good and the price is amazing. Will be visiting more often while in Vegas.

went there for dinner because I like to try different buffet.
food is really not good. just OK. barely edible. food really deserve 2 stars but they made it up with the ice cream selection.
I really like the peanut butter flavor and other flavor. I forgot what.
this buffet price is really cheap so just come in to eat a few items and the ice cream will be worth it.

I wondered why my dad took me here several years ago. Its because its cheap and almost a good competition to Rio's World Buffet. I think the price is $8 per person for lunch. I did not have a Orleans Club Card, but $8 is a deal. The Sahara Hotel has $8.99 Buffet with a Card, but with the Orleans, you probably would save $1 or $2. I remember my total was around $16. Very Good Deal!!

They had Salad, Mexican or Tex-Mex Station, Chinese Station, American, Italian, and their own big Dessert Station. I mainly went to American Station since I always fall in love with Mac N Cheese. I had sandwiches, and bunch of other Americana stuff. They had a lot of food, but I only had three plates. Like my headline says...I am a Big Guy, but I don't eat a lot.

Orleans is away from the strip, but somewhat is small scaled version of the Rio. Orleans has their French Market Buffet and Rio has their World Buffet. If you are on a budget and not wait a long line...go to the Orleans. Its pretty cheap for lunch without a Club Card and food is better than the Sahara Buffet and probably as close to the Rio Buffet without the high price. 

Lunch Ends around 3:30pm. Not sure what time Dinner starts during the weekdays. Very reasonable and not too crowded, but the food is very good and not seem too be mass-produced.

Have Fun here and Keep Yelping!!

This buffet is always good  food is always fresh and hot even between change overs,  but the waitresses and waiters here are lazy sacks of shit at a buffet pretty much all you have to do is bus your tables an refill drinks and they can't do that i am a a huge tipper this is the only place i never tip

I've eaten here twice.  Once for lunch 2 years ago, and once for dinner 2 weeks ago.  I have to say that I really like this buffet.  There's nothing fancy or gourmet about it, but maybe that's what keeps the "down-home" menu consistently good.  Small selection at the salad bar, but the romaine lettuce mix was fresh and they had beets.  My favorite section is the BBQ.  The pork spareribs were baked to a delicious tenderness.  Sauce is served on the side.  Mac n cheese was  bright orange, creamy, and cheesy.  LOVED IT!  Other sides were simple but good.  The sign at the register said $13.99 for dinner but they were charging $16.99 that night (because it was Christmas week?).  We used our $1 off Gold card, so it was a good meal deal.

Buffet located inside Aliente casino. I have been here for breakfast, lunch and dinner. I especially like breakfast here. Great selection of food. I also really like getting down on soups, salad and fresh fruit. The pozole is one of my favorite dishes here. It tastes home made. Very tasty not skimpy on the meat. Big chunks of tender meat.  

Some of the meats can sometimes be on the dry side but it is a buffet. It's still a great value. This is a large restaurant with lots of seating. Both tables and booths. There is plenty of people working here keeping the place clean, neat, and the food stocked. The service here is good. We always get waited on promptly. Drinks served timely and plates cleared from our table. 

Next time you're hungry and can't decide what to have come here and you just may find something you love.

Excellent place for the quality/price/variety of food. The brunch buffet line moved quickly as well. I love the scoop ice cream the old fashion way. I like the option to have mimosas or champagne. The ambiance and decor excellent

Food was very bland and poorly put together. Everything tasted old and not fresh. Weird smells from food lines. Omelette bar was gross. The only reason they are getting 2 stars  is because of the breakfast desert.

Buffett was pretty good. They have seafood. . Mexican. .usa...bbq.. Italian... salads .desserts of many kind like cakes. . Pies. Gelato.. pRices listed online are only if u have a player's card which is free if u don't have one the it's about $6 more

Don't be scared away by the huge line of large people: it moves fast.   Strange concept where you pay at the register and then get in line to be seated for your buffet.  Drinks are free and fast (soda and water that is).  Several buffet stations: the variety is key since each section does not have a huge range of appetizing items, maybe 1-2 things in each section looked reasonably attractive.  No particular dish was special or amazing, just basic level ingredients and expected tastes.  More comfort food/americanized versions of foreign cuisine (this is Vegas after all).  Good way to fill up before a long night or afternoon out wandering the sad streets.

This buffet is located in the Orleans hotel, which is not on the main strip.  My family introduced me to this place because it was a favorite of my grandmother's when she went to Vegas.  There's a free shuttle that takes off from Bill's Gamblin' Hall and brings you to Orleans.  It runs every 15 min from 9am to midnight.  

The food is good!  I recommend going straight for the crawfish and beef ribs.  They are the "signature" items!  The crawfish is boiled in a cajun style broth has great flavor without being too spicy.  The beef is super tender and well seasoned.  The good thing is that because these are very popular items, they're constantly being replenished.  Aside from these two items, everything else was okay.  I sampled the gumbo, mushroom stir fry, and a few of their desserts.  All were good, but I spent most of my time eating crawfish!

At $7.99 for lunch and $13.99 for dinner, this place is one of the best buffet values I've seen.  I will definitely be a returning customer!

I was in vegas for Viva and we stayed at the Orleans.
I went to this buffet on Easter for brunch 
I must say the food was delish the fruit was fresh and the pastries were divine
for a buffet it was good

I was SO pleasantly surprised by the Medley Buffet tonight! Having been in Vegas for a decade, I have become accustomed to mediocre buffets at local casinos, so I was hesitant to try Medley tonight, but gave it a try hoping for yummy seafood (Friday night is Seafood Night). I was not disappointed! The buffet boasted abundant crab legs, a decent sushi selection, and a variety of other foods. My two year old, who usually eats like a bird, asked for second and third helpings (which I was delighted by since I had to pay the child's price for her - the first time I've had to do so at a buffet!). The atmosphere was just the right amount of noisy that no one batted an eyelash when my daughter would get excited about a crab leg or wave her chow mien like a lasso.  I would have liked if they provided traditional she'll crackers for the crab. Also, when I asked if champagne was available to accompany the meal I was told no. I would have loved to enjoy some bubbly alongside my crab. Lastly, I recommend the hot crab over the chilled. I found it to have much more flavor and easier to eat. I will definitely be back for seafood night!

Great Value Buffet at a low price, Lunch time Buffet is just $12 per person although I recommend getting a players card and then swipe in the Machine as you can get a buy 1 get 1 free, but even so at just $12 for lunch the choice is amazing, there is American, BBQ, Pasta, Mongolian, Fish, Gluten Free choice, vegan and Vegetarian  Huge Salad and Desert section,Which includes Sugar Free and Diabetic choice as well! something for every taste!  there is also soup available, the restaurant is clean, the service with a smile, even though the Que to get in was long we was in and sat down within 5 minutes and it was worth it, the food choice is great, its hot and fresh! I we got served By Antonio and kept our pepsi glasses filled, for Brits like me remember they work for tips so a tip of $1-$2 per person is a great way of saying thank you.

This buffet was recently downgraded, prices too, and it is now a far cry from what it used to be.   We could hardly find anything edible at lunch time.  The baked ham was tender but tasteless, and the shredded bbq turkey was okay.  Other than that, most things were inedible.  The "gelato bar" has the foulest tasting stuff you could ever imagine, I think that it might be made with water instead of milk, or maybe with powdered milk.  It tasted like slush, not gelato.  
A better dessert would have been strawberry shortcake since they had a can of "real" whipped cream on the counter, but they brought out a big vat of frozen strawberries that were still frozen!  Not just cold, but frozen in a big block that you'd have to take a pick and shovel to if you wanted strawberries!  
Even the salad bar was skimpy and lacking....usually I can make a good meal of just salad, but not here.  
Garlic bread was very  good if you got it when they first brought it out hot, and lunch was only $7.99 per person,  therefore one star.  If you can survive on garlic bread, ham and shredded turkey, by all means it's a steal.

Located at the Orleans Hotel & Casino in Las Vegas... 15 minutes til closing time and the food was STILL the bomb!!! My friend didn't agree, but I don't care... I'm sure there's better buffet's in Vegas. But they're AREN'T better buffet's in Illinois... So with that, I'm giving these guys 4 stars... The food was fresh even though they were closing... The food tasted great even though they didn't have a great selection... The Chinese was better than anything you get at home. The Italian pasta??? Same thing... A selection of ribs from different regions. And all were good... Round that out with all you can eat Prime Rib??? And I'm happy... The only downside was??? Where was the Cajun fair????? They had crawfish. And my buddy told me they had Gumbo... But I expected Louisiana southern cuisine. And it wasn't there... Oh, did I mention the fried chicken???

As of today, it is the Medley Buffet. A real big step in the wrong direction, IMHO. Whoever was in charge of this remodel was very foolish! Gone is the festive, colorful feel of the old buffet. Welcome to the dreary somber feel of corporate gloom. There are grey walls all over the seating area that separate you from the food and other diners. There is literally nothing to look at. I'll miss the whimsical signs directing you to the various types of food they serve. Still no restroom in the buffet.

I was there for lunch today and found that even though they raised the entry price, I didn't see any roast beef, turkey, shrimp or craw fish like at the old buffet. Perhaps I missed them because the food area is more spread out and there are no signs.

They also eliminated any dedicated line for disabled people which shows me that they don't realize that they have a much older customer base than most casinos. Maybe they just don't care. Remember, I said whoever is in charge was foolish and inconsiderate of customer needs!

Whoever made up the new pricing is also foolish as they post on the website and at door that breakfast is from 8am to 10am and lunch is from 11am to 3 pm. What happens between 10am and 11am? I called and asked and was told that if you come after 10am you will be charged the lunch price ($3 more) BUT you won't get any lunch items until 11am when they start putting it out! Who made this ripoff deal up? Maybe they were rushed to come up with this new ridiculous pricing. They only had 4 long months before they reopened. READ UPDATE BELOW...

To sum up, a cold dreary atmosphere, raised prices but fewer pricey foods, no accommodations  for handicapped people, unnecessary walls all around, still no restrooms in the buffet, and unreasonable high pricing etc., a definite step in the wrong direction for me. I much preferred it the way it used to be!

UPDATE: I went back today to the new buffet to take another look and found that I was given incorrect information yesterday. The reason for lack of pricing between 10am and 11am is that they actually close and stop admitting customers for that hour! They do the same thing from 3pm to 4pm. I'm retired and don't keep track of time anymore. I go to the Orleans to gamble and as soon as I either run out of money or get hungry, I head for the buffet. Now I have to worry if it'll be open since they close twice for two hours a day during the daytime. I guess I'll have to find somewhere else to gamble and eat.

Medley Buffet is located at Aliante Resort and Casino in North Las Vegas

I came I came on Saturday night for Brazilian night and the price was $17.99 for dinner; with a player's card. I've been to my share of buffets through the years in Vegas and I'm a fan of those with a variety.
Medley Buffet has just that a variety of different foods; a medley of them.

They have a various different stations from Asian to Tex Mex to Italian. They have typical buffet items such as fried chicken, pizza and pasta but they also have some unique items such as tamales, chicken siumai and tamales. That night since it was Brazilian night, the place also had plenty of beef items such as steak and pulled pork. Lastly they've got a dessert section that includes a full ice cream bar with featuring ice cream of different flavors such as pecan praline, pistachio, cookies and cream and spumoni and a medley of toppings such as cookie crumbles and sprinkles.

They give a full steak which is nice; but I did notice my "medium well" was more like overcooked. Overall though I did enjoy several things from dinner here. Some of the items I did enjoy that night included their cauliflower soup, rice pilaf and beef tamales, fried plantains and sesame balls. I also was a fan of their desserts. I enjoyed my pecan praline ice cream topped with cookie crumbles. Despite the 47 degree weather that night, I was not going to pass up on ice cream. 

As you can see, I tried a medley of things ;) at Medley Buffet and found this place not to be bad choice when in North Las Vegas.

While working I was talking to a bus driver who I will call "JOE"( because THATS HIS NAME!!) & we were talking "Buffets" & he said I had to try this one. So to show what truly nice people I have encountered thus far in Las Vegas, Joe not only makes a recommendation to this place, BUT gives me a $4 off coupon & meets me on Tropicana Ave to give it to me and drives me there with his wife & daughter as they were on their way to run errands. HOW COOL IS THAT?? (Answer: VERY!!)

 So I ended up paying $5 and change for this AWESOME Buffet using the coupon. And let me tell you now THIS PLACE IS HUGE!! The entire dining area has to be as big as a basketball court if not bigger. And for the size and the crowd on hand, it was a very nice and orderly atmosphere, well lit and pleasantly quiet with no crying babies and no standing up "Peekers" looking over the back of the booth I was sitting in. (I like to feed them string beans!!)

I asked to be seated in a booth and was gladly told to sit wherever I wanted. There are several stations = BBQ, American, Mongolian, Chinese, Mexican, Italian and a HUGE island of deserts.

I made a good attempt to try as many items from as many stations as I could and ended up liking the Chinese station the best that had spring noodles mixed wt vegetables & Beef  that was really fresh and good.

Joe had really pushed the BBQ Beef ribs saying they were the best but the selection the day I went had ALOT of fat on them and I had to pick at them to take it off. And while I'm complaining I might add that the onion rings, fried fish & chicken fried steak had ALOT of breading on them that had me picking at it as well. Other than that though I really cant complain and have to give this place 2 thumbs up.

The Mexican station was extremely good with beef tacos and all the toppings and a spicy shredded chicken that made nice tacos as well. There were other selections such as enchaladas etc and it all looked very good.

The Italian station had speghetti, lasagna, pizza that all looked really good too. I have a sliver of a slice and it was very good and crispy and I tried a couple pcs of eggplant parmesean and it was off the hook good .

There was also peel n eat shrimp wt tartar & cocktail sauce as well as crawfish which looked good and I had one and still cannot see what the draw to these things are as its alot of work for very little pay-off in the way of meat. I chose to stick wt the shrimp & mixed them in wt my Chinese noodles mix & sliced open a couple spring rolls and put them inside. I always "shrimp out" my spring rolls!!

The aforementioned Desert Island had a little of everything = soft serve ice cream, strawberry & whipped cream toppings, scooped Ice Cream, Gellato, Pies, Cakes, Cheesecake, & cobblers. I tried the Coconut Cream Pie and the filling was off the hook (I had 2 pcs and had to stop myself from getting more!!) but the crust was soft and mushy-like and not to my liking at all and I didnt eat it. I also tried some soft serve Vanilla Ice cream  wt whipped cream and the taste of the shortening in the whipped cream came through and more cream & sugar was needed.

The waitstaff seemed nice enough but my Ice Water was'nt refilled, nor was I asked if I needed a refill. I didn,t so it wasnt really a big deal. The girl taking the plates off the table seemed to be working the hardest and I felt bad for her and took my plates up myself several times. I also hid a dollar under my dish within a dish so she would find it and not the waiter as she deserved it more than the waiters did.

Overall I have to recommend this buffet not only for the wide variety and selection, but the quality and good food offered. I only paid $5, but had I paid full price it would have still been worth it.

For the amount of money you pay you think they wouldn't brine the crab making it so salty. Is this a trick to keep patrons from eating so much? 

The salmon was paper thin and unrecognizable as salmon. I was very disappionted by this. 

The oysters looked like they had been sitting out long enough to form an outer crust. 

The garlic clams were good and there was still meat and pizza for those that were dragged along by a seafood eater.

Not my favorite but it's a nice convenient buffet next to my home. Servers are usually friendly unless they're really busy, easy to get overlooked when they only have a single server to a full section. Food itself is decent, though if you're a fan of sushi, steer clear of what they serve here, as for most all you can eat buffet-style sushi when it's not the main food served there. It's always a little stale.

One thing I like most about this buffet, though, is the dessert area. The sugar-free zone is where I hang, and it's actually not terrible! 

Pricewise, the buffet is inexpensive if you have a small party and you have a players card for Aliante casino. Otherwise, it gets pricey.

No comment about the kitchen area since i try not to look past the foods on display. Dining environment is fair. I have nothing horrible to say, but also nothing outstanding to comment on. An average buffet.

Brunch gives you all the breakfast staples:

Corned beef hash = reminds me of dog food, but maybe that's just corned beef hash
Eggs Benedict 
Waffles/pancakes/French toast = really dry
Omelets = dry and the "extras" didn't taste fresh 
Bacon/sausage
Scrambled eggs = Really runny, I could actually slurp it up
Chicken fried steak = super dry, gravy mediocre 
Sweet potato pancake = the one thing that is actually ok, best thing in the buffet
Hash browns = ok, can't screw those up!
Syrup = super thin and runny

Let's be honest here. This is not Caesars Palace but that doesn't mean that it's not a good buffet for the venue you're eating it at.

To start with, understand that this is actually owned by a corporation that owns several different casinos here in town most of them called Coast. For example Gold Coast, Suncoast.

Which means you're going to get simular quality at all of these buffets but the Orleans is actually slightly above the cut of the others.

I'm only going to be talking about the seafood night, because if you pay a few dollars more it's the only night that it makes sense to go.

So, Friday nights are Seafood night. Typically in Las Vegas this is the night that most of the hotels put out Seafood.

It makes sense doesn't it? People get paid on Fridays, Seafood is consumed when people get paid and have extra money, unlike the strip hotels which can jack their prices up and put the food out every day of the week this is how the local hotels and casinos operate for seafood.

Okay, so what are you getting here?

Well, in addition to the regular fare, you're also getting snow crap period The Orleans snow crab is pretty decent. It's not skinny and small and actually quite large compared to other hotels here in town.

It comes served cold but you can also take it over to the Mongolian cooking station and have it heated up for you with different spices which is something that no one else offers.

Word of warning though, if you're like me and you can't eat seafood then you should probably avoid the Mongolian station all together. They literally cross contaminate like crazy which is the only reason I can't give the early and so true 5 star review.

Everything else at the buffet is actually quite good. The food is fresh and turned over on a regular basis.

The dessert bar is actually great they have gelato and lots of different desserts for anybody's tastes. Make room for dessert when you go to this one.

I can only assume that the rest of the week is just like Friday nights but just without Seafood with the exception of shrimp. I highly recommend the Orleans versus the other local hotels here in Las Vegas because the quality is pretty darn good the wait times are low and the service is great.

Great selection! Go for Sunday brunch and they will have one lox and bagels which is one of my favorite things to eat. They also have a great omlet station. I love that they have fruits and vegetables which are as fresh as it can be. I love there Asian section, they make great food there. They normally make lemon chicken, sesame chicken and a chicken dish. They have a great selection in the mexican food part as well as an italian part. If your at the hotel i'd recommend it. You cannot beat the food you will get at that price. 

Go hungry because they do have a great amount of food that they serve. The meat is great whenever they have it out. 

Dessert is awesome! They have everything there.
Disgusting food! Nice new remodeling though . Not worth eating here for the price . $14.99 for brunch per adult . Flies were on the cookies and desserts section . Stale bread. Just gross!

Go for lunch, if want crawfish and beef ribs you'll enjoy this buffet. Desserts were hit and miss, not worth the money for dinner. 

Staff were very friendly but the food was a huge disappointment and this meal was my intro to the Orleans hotel dining...will stick with my old time fav the Spice Market in PH.

Mold on the pie, told the chef he told me it was just burn marks. Never seen burn marks that are green. As we where leaving he was yelling at the dessert lady , and pulling all the pie I was eating. Only thing good about this place was the drinks. Even the prime rib was over cooked and dry . Gross, the shrimp scampi people on here rave about is slimy.

I loved the price for the buffet, they have Italian, Mexican, American. Chinese, BBQ, Mongolian, seafood and dessert with gelato and a few others I missed. The place is a little run down, torn booths and sunk in. Took a while to get my drink, but the waitress was extremely attentive afterwards she explained she had a large party upstairs.

The Mexican food was meh, the taco shells weren't crunchy and it fell apart as I was about to take a bite. Ribs were excellent from the BBQ stand and Mac n cheese was yummy. Seafood was good except I hated the fact that I had to peel my shrimp. 

Dessert station was good, I recommend the gelato and cream puffs. 

I give four stars because of cleanliness, the dessert station was a mess and I seen a lot of different foods mixed with others. 

I encountered a group of tourists with strong body odor (not the hotels fault) but it made me lose my appetite.

Pros: good price for a buffet (even better if you have a rewards card), nice selection of foods, delicious desserts 

Cons: most of the food was subpar due possibly to being reused too many times and/or over cooked, sushi was horrible (cold hard rice)

We were a bit disappointed with our visit. We had heard that Medley was better than the old buffet and we finally had the chance to try it. Honestly if you're not absolutely starving then go somewhere else. We've decided that unless someone is willing to pay for us then we most likely won't be coming back.

Went for the breakfast buffet. We went with 3 people, clearly told the lady 3 people, apparently we got charged for 2 and the staff was getting angry at us for only having been charged for 2. Finally told the lady to charge us for the other person and gave her the money. Could have been handled better. Picked an eggs Benedict.... tasted like windex, made one of the ladies sick, not food poisoning but thinking about it. Sausage was overdone almost burnt. Cake tasted stale. Not good at all. Very dissappointed.

As a carnivore who doesn't eat any starches, the meat selection at a buffet is the most important part to me. I was very excited to see that they offer a "Brazilian Steak" night, and upon walking through the buffet and looking at the choices, immediately rated it 5 stars. But then I tasted the food...

It was all so dry that it was hard to eat. I'm not sure if it was left over then reheated, but it was so dry or just overcooked, but it literally wicked the saliva out of my mouth. So much potential to be an amazing buffet, but executed so poorly.

First off...I'm just going to say this buffet have a pretty great dessert section for a "off the strip" property. So definitely save room for dessert. They got endless flavors of gelato, different kinds of cakes and pastries (some are sugar free as well).

Second...they have a good variety of food items available with a small salad bar, Mexican, Italian, Chinese, and a BBQ station. I'm a simple kind of girl when it comes to buffets. I really don't care for the seafood and all that "fancy smancy" stuff. Just give me the basics of  spaghetti and meatballs, eggrolls, enchiladas, dumplings, BBQ meats and sausages etc etc...you get the idea. For $8.99 per person on a weekday lunch...you can't beat that.

Hands down, best Thanksgiving buffet outside the Las Vegas Strip. Our server, Morgan, gave us extraordinary table service!

We got in line around 12pm and, inspite of how busy the Medley was, we were led to our table around 12:30 :-)

The kitchen staff was on spot! There wasn't any cold dish anywhere, unless of course, it was meant to be cold. The meat dishes were tender and juicy. The veggies were crisp. The salad, fruit and dessert bars were equally good.

I thanked one of the supervising managers, after noting that two of them helped clear and set up tables to keep the incoming guests seated. That's teamwork!

It's no wonder that the Medley is my fave buffet. Highly recommended.

Now get in line before they run out of ham, Turkey, and steak! Not! LOL!

Don't often write bad reviews but, unfortunately it happens.  Buffet has been remodeled, prices went up on average $5.00 but quality suffers. Let's start with the dessert station, most items were fairly bland, the custard tasted like more flour than egg, the ice cream/sorbet/gelato did not have the basic chocolate or coffee flavors not to mention the mint chip i did have was not very good.  The main entrees were over cooked, the fried items were too crunchy/hard (onion rings), fried chicken. The one redeeming item was the chicken gumbo soup.
I won't be giving this place another try for a while needless to say.

This is the second time coming to this buffet and the food was pretty okay; however, I asked about the time this buffet was supposed to close.  The buffet was closed at 0900pm and it was a little bit after that time so I wanted to get some dessert before I left.  I went over to the dessert place and the worker was hollerin' out.."we're closed!!" Then, he proceeds to turn out the light so I walked away very disappointed.  After spending $159...really?  Not sure if it was worth it to come back.

I give this buffet five stars because the price with the member card is affordable, other than the $10/child 2+, and the food is great! This is our usual brunch place to go to when we're in town visiting and it has never failed us, plus the unlimited mimosas aren't too bad either!

I went to French Market Buffet at the Orleans on a Saturday for brunch. It was $15/person and totally NOT worth it. I should have gone to TGIF, which is also located in the Orleans.

The food was sub-par. The only two items that were tasty were the ribs and the gelato (+ for this), both of which you had to ask a server for. There are different food stations, but their themed dishes were not worthy. Customer service was great, but there was still nothing memorable about this location. 

Please save your $$$ and try another buffet.

I honestly gave it 2 stars because it's $21. So if your short on cash and want edible food this is your place. The warmest food we had was the tacos they made fresh and those were room temperature. Pork ribs were bloody and when I brought it to the cooks attention he told me that was smoke, yep cause now smoke runs out of meat, sure!!! The prime rib was cold and tough and this was the "new" piece of meat he was cutting. Manapua was bomb!!! Best thing about the buffet.

We went to the buffet tonite and I have to say it was outstanding! Everything we ate had great flavor and didn't taste bland or overcooked like a lot of food at most buffets. The casino must have changed staff at the buffet because it was excellent! The deserts were great and flavorful also! Finally a buffet that's actually close to us that worth going to!!

Major disappointment.  Lunch in December 2017 was $12.95 without a players club card and the food was completely forgettable - I can't recall a single item, and they only utilized half of the serving stations (not a lot of choice).  I did not get my money's worth.  Now, back in the early 2000's this was a very good "value buffet" which feaured decent food at modest prices. No more.  I still like the Orleans, and their rooms are clean, spacious, and well appointed.  But this newly renovated buffet was a huge disappointment and an insult to what once was the French Market Buffet,
Worth every cent! Crawfish and Prime rib at it's best!
it's a buffet.  good variety of usa, bbq, chinese, seafood, mexican, italian represented.

Beautiful renovation BUT food still the same ..

I love how trendy this buffet looks and the presentation of the foods but it's still NOT good.  

They did change some of the food items like the omelette station and the meat craving station and the desserts(only thing that was good).  

Chinese was probably the worst, than Italian and the soup station.  I was hoping it would be better than before but not.

The food was disgusting and the service is one the worst. We went during lunch time and it was like 7.99 but man, even with the cheap price comes with cheap ass food. The only good thing was the french fries and the soda -.-

So I admit I'm not a regular to come to Vegas but for the past 4 years I've done my best to come to a hotrod car show hosted by "Viva Las Vegas Rockabilly Weekend" and luckily this year was one of them. Medley Buffet is located in The Orleans Hotel and Casino, which by far is my favorite. I love the Southern feel it has and the buffet hours are from 8 to 8. We went on a Saturday so the price was 20 in change, we were a group of 8 and they got us a table quick and our waitress was friendly which is always a plus considering the amount of people there. Well, considering i was wearing a tight 50's dress i admit i did not eat as much as i normally would but I attacked the egg flower soup, roast beef, salads and shrimp for sure!! In fact, I enjoyed the food so much i didn't take pictures of it. ( except for a video i saved in snapchat lol )
This is a great buffet with a clean, very nice atmosphere. The drink servers are very attentive and friendly. All food items labeled accurately. A little pricey, yet I would go here again.

I liked the decors, kinda classy with high ceilings and bright chandeliers. So 3 stars for that.. BUT the cashier was very very rude, impatient and not helpful at all. We were confused as to how many discounts we can get since 2 of my friends were members in the hotel. She was looked like she was getting short with us and ask us to step aside while we figure our things out. It was really rude and to think she was the first person customers will interact with even before paying for the buffet. We were seriously considering eating elsewhere but we had already made it through a very long line to be seated.

The servers were really pleasant. Thank God! 

The food, however, was an entirely different story. Seafood tasted bland, no seasoning whatsoever. The tools to crack the shells were unreliable and often break. Some of the dishes were already cold. 

I'd come back though, just to give it another shot and see how their Steak Menu is like. If it bombs, then I will not come back here again.

Two words. Powdered potatoes. 

The mashed potatoes are powdered. I know this because I nearly choked to death on a powder cluster that wasn't thoroughly mixed in your mashed potatoes of lies. 

I also resent being resented by the carving station people for busting up their conversation because I wanted a sliver of parched turkey. 

Everyone working there just seems despondent.

It was our first time trying Aliante's buffet and we loved it. It tasted a lot fresher then some of the station casinos we've been to, and the quality of the food was mm mm good. My partner and I loved the Asian section! The pork buns and noodles were so yummy! 
Certainly check out this place if you're looking for a station like casino buffet but one with good flavour! Just know the section is a little smaller then say Santa Fe or Red Rock.
If i could give zero stars i would. Waited for an hour to even get to the pay line. Horrible wait for the not so great food.

Friday night seafood buffet is always good! My family and I always go....well, we used to. Last night was probably our last. The buffet manager on duty, Rochelle was RUDE and I did not appreciate the way she spoke to me! I know losing a family as customers won't do any harm, but HER customer service was flat out horrible! 

There were two lines, no signs indicating what or who the lines were for, so we stood in the shorter line. Well after 30 minutes we find out its for the VIP people and get asked to stand in the other line, which is now ridiculously long. Told her it wasn't fair, there's no signs what so ever, she said that's why she was monitoring the lines. So I said, well you weren't monitoring it for the last 30, minutes, and having to stand in another line wasn't fair for us! Then she told me that talking to her like that was the "wrong move". Talking to her like what? Factual? I walked away cuz at that point she pissed me off with that statement. Went back to her asking for a manager or someone else I could speak with to find out my options, cuz I still don't feel this is fair. She said she was the buffet manager. So I told her that as a manager she shouldn't be talking to her customers like that. She went on to tell me she doesn't have to take abuse, and her company was behind her 100% and that she didn't need to serve me and could get me escorted off the property. I agreed with her, and let her know I too work in customer service, but this isn't abuse. Never once did I raise my voice, swear or anything. Yes, I spoke with an attitude, but I feed off of vibes. As a customer, if you are going to treat me that way, don't expect me to talk to you politely. She kept telling me to calm down, and I told her repeatedly that I was calm and all I want to know are what my options if there were any. She gave me a whole uneccessary speech about telling me again she doesn't have to take abuse, that she was trying to help me but I kept attacking her and if I stepped out of line one more time she would call security on me. Even if it was me asking a question, to her i was "coming at her". I didn't want to talk to her to start with, but she refused to get me someone else and i feel she just used her manager power trip on me. 

She finally agreed that we didn't need to stand at the very end. Had she just listened and wasnt so quick to jump into defense mode, this could have been resolved so much faster and much more pleasant.

And the only reason why I stayed, because I didn't want to, not after all that, was because my son wanted to eat crab! If it wasn't so late in the evening, I definitely would have made the drive to somewhere else!
 
Everyone else we came in contact with was very pleasant as always!

One of my favorite places for brunch on the weekends.Only 11 dollars with a players card.Everything is always fresh and there is even an omelet station.Also,all you can drink champaign.Its a good deal

This is the cheapest place in Vegas to eat buffet...but you can see why. 14.99 gets you a bunch of crap food and unlimited champagne. I'd honestly rather pay 20 bucks more and try the Rio buffet instead, which is a whole better deal.  I'd get little foods here and there and take a bite out of everything but i wasn't impressed.
