In fact, all I ended up doing was eating a bunch of bananas.

We went here for the Prime Rib and Crab Legs. They have this special every Saturday night for $21.99 per person. Which I thought was a pretty good deal! 

The buffet was full of people but the line wasn't long at all - how awesome!! The casino is like 25 min away from the strip so that's why it's not crazy busy but it was definitely worth the drive. 

Everything I tried was hot and fresh. I was especially fond of the Pork Bun Baos in the Chinese section. They were so warm and yummy. They had a BYO burger and hot dog station I didn't get to try because I was so stuffed but it was the first time I've seen this at a buffet and it was quite popular with the other guests and looked good to me! 

They served the Crab Legs in baskets, and there was a small line for them. But it went very quickly. One basket per customer at a time and they were VERY serious about this. A woman ahead of me asked for two so she could bring one to her husband and one of the chefs walked with her with the second plate of Crab to her table! But I understand why they are serious about this and it's still AYCE so I didn't mind that I couldn't choose my own pieces or anything like that. They also don't offer any Crab crackers because they slit the shells for you so you just have to crack on the lines. How nice! 

The prime rib was kind of dry and over cooked :( 

The dessert section was kind of small, but I found some decent things to eat. They also have scooped ice cream with a variety of flavors along with the regular ice cream machines. 

The inside of the buffet is nice and everything is displayed well, they kept all the food warm and the surroundings clean. I will definitely return, maybe even on a weekday since it's only $11.99 then.

The new buffet at The Orleans Hotel and Casino was disappointing.  The food wasn't good at all.  The cornbread was dry and tasteless.  The prime rib was fatty and cold.  It is definitely not worth the price.  The service from Robert was excellent.  The poor quality of the food and drink was not his doing.  I remember when this buffet was one of the best around.  Admittedly it was a long time ago, but when you continue to raise the price of a buffet you should not lower the quality of the food.

I came on Easter Sunday, which was the last day of Viva Las Vegas for the Champagne Seafood Brunch, and I was pretty pleased. The line to get in was pretty intense, but it went by fast so didn't wait longer than 20 minutes to get seated. The French Market has all sorts of food including: American, Italian, Mongolian, BBQ, Mexican, Chinese, and Seafood. They have 2 big salad bars and a pretty good dessert section, but seriously, who wastes time with salad at a buffet?! 

The beef ribs and prime rib from the carvers station were pretty good, probably one of my favorite things there on that day. I mostly took my chances with the huge variety of seafood there was to offer. The salmon, the king crab, snow crab, shrimp, craw fish, mussels and clams were all very good. The craw fish is sort of complicated to eat and so are the crab legs, which there was a crazy long line to get, haha. Fine, maybe I'm just dumb and don't know how to eat, but still I was getting impatient with the craw fish and crab legs. It's too much work for not that much meat, haha. 

They had an omelet station where you had omelets made for you after picking out what you want in it. It was whatever, not too impressed, takes too long and isn't the best omelet ever. The whole USA section of the buffet is pretty bland, very typical breakfast foods, but boring and flavorless. and I love breakfast foods, but that was a fail. The deserts looked so awesome, but I just had a little bit of ice cream, didn't want to go into food coma after.

Too bad I was driving home after otherwise I would've taken advantage of the unlimited Champagne and made them fill up my Viva boot for me, haha. I really wanted to eat their usual Sunday night dinner which is rib night, but since it was Easter they had the Seafood Brunch special, oh well maybe next year.

Sometimes you just need to get out of the office with the gang and have some fun! This is a fine...and close....place for it! This is our "Field Trip Friday" lunch spot. We load ourselves into a couple cars, drive over and for $8.99 we bond over a mediocre A-Y-C-E Buffet. No harm in that!

OK, the food kinda mediocre, but there is a LOT of it!
And the deserts are my favorite! Next time maybe I will just eat sugary treats?

Decent, clean and fair qaulity! Large variety of options.

Not like most buffets were they place more sides then main staple items.

My husband and I tagged along to my mom's high school reunion.  They invited us to have dinner at The French Market in The Orleans.  The buffet here is ok.  I had a hard time getting something that I liked.  The only thing that I remembered were crab legs and the soup.  Other then that...everything else was bleh...

Ok buffet. Need a different variety of foods. Same as lunch & dinner.
Children have to pay full price as adults!!! Even a 2 yr. old will be charged adult price, so beware!!

Cheap! 

Would not pay a dime more on this food. It's your run of the mill buffet food with poor cuts of meat.

This is not one of the best places for a buffet, but if you want to save money and go to one for the basics, this is it.  They don't offer fried shrimp, crab legs, etc., but they do have prime rib and roasted chicken. Yay.

The buffet is great for breakfast only, lunch and dinner needs some major improvements the food is horrible I couldn't believe it brought my family of 6 the 3 of them are boys and not 1 of them got for a 2nd plate REALLY DISAPPOINTING

Decided to go to this buffet after many years. When I was a kid, this buffet was the best, but it has gone downhill. When I came for Seafood Night on Saturday, there wasn't lots of people in the buffet. The food quality didn't look so good and the taste of the food was horrible. Not recommended.

This establishment does not even deserve 1 star. What a bad experience me and 14 of my family members experienced today. We will definitely will not be going back EVER! My daughter, husband and I arrived at the buffet first while the rest of the family were still parking there vehicles and helping my younger brother out the vehicle which he is in a wheelchair. Once we got to the cashier we specifically explained that we had a party of 14. We wanted to pay for our entry first while the rest of my family got there. The cashier was nice and told us it was no problem. We payed $55.00 plus 9.95 Tip. She specifically told us " we are seating you in a table while the rest of the family gets here, and once they get here they pay and you guys can all seat together". So we sat down and ate and explained everything to out waiter. The waiter said it was fine just to let her know and that we would have a different waiter. 10 minutes later my family arrives and so they get the table and once we go sit this so called manager named Rafael (Hispanic) tells us that we couldn't and that they had rules we didn't know about. He kept telling us that we couldn't seat together and kept arguing with my husband and older brother when we tried explaining him what the cashier had told us. My husband took him to the cashier so she could explain to him what she had told us and what she charged us for. The cashier told him what once we had explained to him and he yelled at her in front of other costumers that she was wrong for doing that and that she didn't know what she was doing. This so called manager was so wrong in so many levels. He as a manager should have had a different attitude and tried to make the problem better which he did the opposite. I for work in costumer service and know how you should treat your costumers. My husband is an executive chef at the Bellagio and knows that's not how you treat your customers. We kept explaining to him everything in English and kept telling us to speak to him in Spanish which, for myself is an insult as if trying to say that we couldn't speak right English while speaking to him. The waitress was more considerate that she went up to this so called manager and asked him if it was okay if she sat us at another different table by our family members. He kept saying no and arguing with my brother and husband for at least 5 minutes. He eventually said okay and we got to sit at a table next to out family not with our family which we had paid for to begin with. To top it off, he kept walking around the tables my family and I were sitting in laughing at us. I have no words for what we experience today. Such a poor costumer service. Sad.

Nice environment. Plenty of different foods and desserts. My wife and I were taken to a crowded section squeezed in between two other groups. We asked to be moved to another less crowded area. They had lots of sections where nobody was sitting. Anyway, we got seated in a less crowded area.  The roast beef was cold and tough. The rest of the sides- green beans, carrots, mac and cheese were also cold. The desserts tasted old and were a little hard. The strawberry puff was good. Overall, for the price, we were disappointed with the food.

Saturday is Seafood Night, no fried shrimp, no fried fish.  The vegetables were cold and the only thing worth eating were the shaved snow crab legs were good, but cold and the boiled shrimp was not peeled and cold too. 

Desserts were sloppy looking and picked over ---we were there at 7 pm.  Waitress was slow and every time we got up seed to have a big cart in the one path in and out to our table area, which was piled with filthy dishes.  It was kinda disgusting.  

My recommendation is to skip this buffet.

Remodeled and now a very awesome 5 star buffet! It was a good 3.5-4 star buffet before but a lot has improved. 

I enjoyed all the food! 
Salad bar was great. Fresh everything, nice thick dressing. Great tacos and nachos. Good meats and mashed potatoes. Even the French fries and soups were wonderful. 

Decor and seating is pleasing and comfortable. Not to smokey like the rest of the casino. Music is bad but not too loud at least. 

I could dock a star but another server made up for our first server who took on 30 person group and literally just left us and never came back. Not even to say sorry or check in at all. Odd. The seating ladies, most drink servers, and the cashier were very nice. I'll not dock any stars for the one employee because overall it's a good team working. 

I plan on coming back much more often now.

I would not recommend!  Nothing was exceptional at all. Lots of choices but nothing was great. Service was ok. Prime rib was raw.  Mexican food was not good.  Chinese was not good. Desserts were average. Pizza like frozen. Shrimp were tiny and peel and eat.  Workers behind Buffett seamed disinterested in their jobs.

I had probably one of the worst dining experiences I have ever had in my life today at Aliante buffet.  I took my kids to a celebratory dinner on Saturday night and as usual they asked to go to Aliante buffet because they love it.  We showed up at 8:55 and the hostess told me they close at 9 and they start pulling food at 9:30, my kids love it so we decided to eat there.  As soon as we got to the buffet they had started pulling food, and by 9:30 90% of the food was gone.  I asked to speak to a manager and Dan came to talk to me.  He told me that I should have expected to not have all the choices that are usually there because I came in just before close.   He never once apologized or offered to get me the food that I should have been offered.  If you are going to charge me the same amount of money that you charge everyone else you should offer me the same experience that everyone else gets.  I have worked in restaurants for 20 years and offer the same experience to the person that comes in at 6pm, as I do to the person that comes in 5 minutes before close.  I used to go to Aliante buffet about once a month and now will probably never come back.

No, it's not high class buffet like Caesar or Wicked Spoon. But then again, you're comparing $45 to $15. Lines are never to long for the buffet, even during prime dinner time. Most days, there are prime rib that is decent. Succulent meat and taste is there. I also like eating their shrimp with cocktail sauce here. Unlike some other buffets in Vegas, the cocktail shrimp here taste fresh and have that good seafood taste. I do enjoy the simpler American side dishes here. Mac and cheese, baked beans, mashed potatoes, etc. Dessert is nice as well. They have a gelatin bar that they serve you and cheesecake is creamy with a good crust. 

Don't bother with the Chinese food. Maybe I'm super critical because I'm Chinese, but that hot and sour soup is a joke -  taste nothing like it. Egg rolls inside is too soggy.

I give this 3 stars because for $15 and the lack of waiting in line, it's hard to beat in Vegas. As long as you enter knowing full well what you paid, you'll have a good time.

Just give me the beef ribs and prime rib from the carvers station and I'll be happy.  When a family of four can eat there for 20 bucks (with coupon), all you need is to impress me with about 10 dishes that I can rotate on all of my trips.

The Orleans is like the Costco of casinos: not much flash, but plenty of value.  Their buffet is the same to me.  Give me value: great food, low prices, and cleanliness and I'll stick around.  Alcohol prices are super cheap and the waiters are responsive and friendly.  The kiddies love the dessert bar, and I like the constant rotation of the food.  Chalk one up for the little guy.

Love this buffet, get the players club card for the discount.  Very great selection of dinner food items but I have to avoid over eating here just because it's that good!  Pace yourself by trying a little scoop of everything is my advice.

I love the taco meat here, super powerful flavor but not overbearing.  It's one of the first things i get on my plate.  I have to say check out the salad bar it's great and I'm picky eater..  I grab lettuce from the salad bar and head out to the Tex Mex for taco meat and shredded cheese. Go crazy and add black olives or whatever you like.


The desserts here are better than most buffets on the same parr.  I prefer to have the ice cream of I'm going to go for dessert.
It's was a great buffet .. especially when they got remodeled now it sucks they quit serving crab legs I'll take my business elsewhere

The food was really good. Everything was made fresh. The buffet is very clean and spacious. I would definitely come here again. The only thing I would say they could improve on is the variety of foods are available.

This is what I called secondary buffet choice.  It's great value, decent selection and good food.  $7.99 (with a players card) for lunch can't be beat.
I like their fish and chips.   Collar green used to be my go-to vegetable choice, but lately it's very salty so I just stick with salad.  Each salad bar has different selection, so check out both if you want to have salad.  I would skip the Chinese, not even up to Panda Express quality.  My favorite dessert is the walnuts tart.  Ice cream didn't taste like ice cream, more like yogurt or something very artificial.

If you want to know what the color beige tastes like. Eat here.  Nothing good, nothing terrible pretty much bland and dry across the board.  

Sushi option is small and awful.  Breads are dry and hard.  Salad bar is so small with few options.  All the meats taste pretty much the same.  

You can do better for your money at any other buffet in town.

Update:  decided to give them another try since Boyd has taken over the property.

Food was good and fresh.  Options were limited but not lacking.  Will definitely go back now that they have their act together again!

I went here for lunch this afternoon.I had seen photos of the newly renovated buffet and I was curious to see if it looked as good as the photos.I am happy to say that it did.It is one of the most modern,beautiful and aesthetically appealing buffets I have ever been to.The lighting and colors have a really positive feel to them.To use an Asian term,it had a real good Feng Shui,IMHO.The servers were quite good,coming over frequently to remove empty plates and refilling beverages.The dessert selection seemed quite good,although I only availed myself of a couple of items as I am trying to restrict my sugar intake.Having said all of the above,I must say that I wasn't really impressed with the overall quality of the main food items.Don't get me wrong.I'm not saying that I didn't enjoy the meal or that it was industrial sewage like you would get at Circus Circus.It was probably a bit better then than the offerings at the old French Market buffet that the Orleans used to have.It's just that a lot of the dishes just seemed to be lacking in a certain pizzazz.I would not have a problem coming here again for another meal as long as it was discounted like the one I had today.To me,their prices are about $5.00 more per meal then what I would ideally like to pay.But if you do choose to eat here,I doubt that you'll be disappointed.There is such a large selection that you should get a full meal.Just don't expect really incredible food.Of course,you're also not paying a really exorbitant price.Enjoy.

I love, love, love this buffet! The food is fresh, delicious, there's a large variety, and it is very clean! We love Aliante Casino, so the fact they have such a great buffet is a huge bonus. We love their Friday night seafood buffet, my husband loves the crab legs, my daughter loves the salmon, and I love their fish n chips. We even went here for Thanksgiving and were so pleased; classic turkey, stuffing, mashed potatoes, ham, green bean casserole, sweet potatoes, pumpkin pie....just awesome. The service is excellent, fast, friendly, accommodating, and polite. Great salad bar, fresh fruit, American, Asian, Soul Food, Italian, dessert, I can't say enough good things. Try it out if you want to get away from the busy strip and outrageous prices. Enjoy!

The only great thing about the place is the price; it simply can't be beat. But what you pay is what you get.
It was our first meal after arriving to LV so we were pretty starved. Seated right away.
Food was good but not great. Like it lacked zazz. The hot and sour soup sucked (way to sour).
I did enjoy the potato salad, of all things. And I think the mongolian station was the best station because the food was actually flavorful. 

Dessert was the best part! (though i wish they had more fruit options). I got some peach cobbler (my fave dessert) and some honeydew on the side. soooo good. And some hot tea with honey and lemon [on a 103F day haha] to finish my meal.

Not bad, not fabulous. Great price.
Great buffet for the price. Of course you can go to a fancy buffet on the strip but the price will triplicate.

I've eaten here a ton of times. It's ok. You get everything you want. There's American, Asian, Italian, Mexican, and an extensive salad bar. Pretty much your typical local casino buffet. Nothing will stole you as awesome, but it's all edible. Salad bar is loaded. I do like the Mongolian grill. Lots of dessert options including a chocolate fountain.

went today @ 2pm horrible Asian waitress only came by my table once, looked at me crazy when I asked for more napkins. Everything was absolutely cold not even luke-warm. what a shame @ $15.95 , on a Friday just cold fishsticks and hard fries, loads of pizza that no one was touching. the taco meat was hard very dark brown and congealed.     I want my damn money back...Now!

Remodelled Orleans Buffet now called MEDLEY BUFFET. Ox tail melts in your mouth and loved the steamed dumpling. duck was tasteful.  Very modern feel and spacious. Great selection.  Sign up with their players card and you get a different discount

We received 4 free buffet vouchers in the mail from Boyd Gaming so we decided to try this place out on their seafood buffet night. I believe it costs $27.99 for dinner on Fridays. The line was super long and the wait was about 30 minutes. Not too bad considering this is their most popular night. 

The crab and oysters were fresh and plentiful. The food in general is decent. We like to make our own dipping sauce for the crab and bring it since we don't care much for the butter they provide. We basically stack a mountain of crab on a plate and start cracking away. We tried a few other like the spare ribs, smoked sausage, mashed potatoes, corn on the cob, and clam chowder as side helpings to the crab. Nothing stands except for the service which is always attentive and professional.

This buffet is disgusting and not worth $20 a dinner at all! Do not waste your time!!!!! Go anywhere else and it will be better. The food is not fresh, all premade, even the dessert was bad. I mean how do you mess up a brownie?!

Yep, things have changed!  The new design in the buffet area is really hard to understand.  There is a massive hallway in the middle of the dining area that is not used, from what we could see.  The food is now distributed all along the back rather than utilizing cold tables just to the fore of hot service.  It was so convenient.  We both picked two different eggs Benedict for breakfast that were supposedly on steam tables in terrines, which looked warm and savory.  They were both cold and awful.  Neither one of us could eat them.  So wasteful.  Waiting for a table was also long and weary, even though the number of people was about 20.  I wish I could give our once-favorite buffet a good rating.  We've gone to the Orleans for years!

Sat down with my parents and children for breakfast. Seemed like a nice place to eat. Kids ordered milk and as soon as they got it, the 3 and 4 year old started to spit it out saying it tasted funny. I took a swig and sure enough just about gagged. My father being as anal is as he is about serving bad food and causing mass illness in a public place, became concerned and notified the drink server and the waiter who didn't seem too concerned and told us they'd replace theirs with juice. Being the kids lost their appetite from the milk they didn't eat much. Again on the way out my father told the hostess that the milk could make people sick and they should have it replace. Her response in a sweet smiling way explained 'I'll be sure to let security know.' Seriously? How patronizing can you be to customers. Ridiculous!

I think this is the updated, renovated version of the Orleans buffet. For $21 weekday dinner, it is such a good place to eat for the flavors, and the value. I enjoyed the prime rib and bone-in ham. I enjoyed the run raisin sauce, and the various desserts, specially the Bananas Foster. Darn, I forgot to get any of the hand-made crepes. I was just desserted-out. What I think could be improved is the seafood selection. The shrimp scampi was nothing special. But overall, the food, cost, and service is for me the current best value in Vegas.

Basic Vegas buffet that's Popular with some locals I'm guessing mostly because the prices are some of the lowest in town.  They also offer good discount deals for their player's club members. The lines can get long if you come right at the peak of service (like 9am for breakfast; noon for lunch; or 6pm for diner).

They've got the various food stations based on either type of food or region.  BBQ, seafood, Asian, Mexican, Italian, etc. Two salad bar stations and a center desert island with cakes, pastries and ice cream round out the mix. 

The servers are all busy, efficient and make multiple stops by your table to fill drinks and take away plates as you grub your way through your meal session. 

Some of the food is decent, some you'll pass on depending on freshness and others you won't even touch.  That's what keeps a buffet fun and you on your toes.
Not to bad sometimes it's good, other times they don't fill up as fast so some of the food is  dry.

I am not a big buffet fan in general, but I was told the breakfast was great so in I went. The wait to be seated seemed avoidable as there were open 4 seat tables and booths. We were seated and greeted by Nena who took our drink order and we were on our way. Alot of good looking options, 2 omlet bars and a carving station for ham, meatloaf and sausage. Most of the food I tried was great and tasted fresh. I tried the cheese blintsz, a mini waffle, pancake, 3 different sausages, bacon and french toast and I cleaned my plates. I went back an tried their mexican bar, I had a taco some refried beans, a few tornados, guac, chilaquiles and a basket of chips. This is where that one star faded away. The food from the mexican bar had no defining flavors, nothing memorable, everything in a way tasted the same. The sauces were tame and didn't highlight any tastes in any of the foods. The chips in the baskets were chewy.
The service was phenomenal and the majority of the food was fresh tasting and great. Try it out you're bound to find something you like with so many choices.

A-ok. We have eaten here twice in the past few weeks: once for prime rib and crab legs, and tonight for shrimp and steak...which was a bummer, because we came for the crab legs and apparently they just changed it. The steak and shrimp options weren't too bad. If you come, make sure you sign up for the players card, because it gives you a pretty substantial discount. We also had just gotten a flyer in the mail for a buy one get one, which brought our total for five buffets down to $80, which wasn't bad at all. 
The service can be hit or miss-on our crab leg night, our drinks were empty, our table was a mess, and we couldn't even get napkins from anybody. Tonight the service was much better-constant refills and table cleaning and a huge stack of napkins when we sat down. We tend to only do buffets when family are in town, but it's a nice option to have the Aliante to get away from the Strip, and it's a little more updated than the Santa Fe. Overall it wasn't a bad experience and we'll probably be back when we have visitors again.

We came here for dinner and breakfast this time. Both times were satisfying and everything tasted delicious. Dinner was $19.99 but you get $5 off if you're a member (players card). Breakfast was around  $9.00 per person. We really enjoyed it! It's nothing fancy but everything tasted great. We will definitely come back again! And the people that work in the hotel were all very polite.

Let me start by saying I was rather impressed with the quality of the cuisine at the buffet. I'll begin on a positive note before delving into the depths of my irritation with this place. I went twice during my stay. Once for breakfast and once for dinner. The breakfast was one of the best breakfast buffets I have visited in a while and the dinner was pretty top notch as well. There was a good variety of steaks during the Saturday night dinner buffet with a good supporting cast of potatoes, veggies and other buffet staples. The grilled onions and sauteed mushrooms were a nice touch. The problem I have is with the mandatory 18 percent gratuity for a large party. We stayed at the Orleans over a weekend for a family reunion and gathering of friends who had not seen each other in some time. Our party for dinner was approaching 50 bodies and we got there prior to their opeing for dinner and gave plenty of notice ahead of time. We did not just show up and ask for a table for 50. We paid in small groups (immediate families, etc) and were all charged the 18 percent. I can see an 18 percent tip at a restaurant where the waiter or waitress takes your order, fills your drinks, deals with special requests and is attentive to your table. An 18 percent tip at a buffet is over the top to begin with, but outrageous when you consider the drinks were running empty and the waiter was rude and acted as though we were putting him out. The tip was in the $150 range for a lack luster, one-star performance from the waiter. If you have a casino "Club Card", you'll need one card for every two people to get the discount and there was no price break for children. The quality of the food was the saving grace, making this an overall three star rating for me.

The very definition of "A-ok." You get what you pay for at this buffet. But even then, it's still miles ahead of what you'd find at Circus Circus or something. For $12 at lunch time, you can't go wrong with cafeteria-style enchiladas and pasta, and while it isn't as luxurious as Bellagio Buffet or quirky like Wicked Spoon, it gets the job done.

Not quite sure what the reviews are about the prices. We paid $28 a person and the place definitely made money on us. There were some nice choices however the food was simple-cafeteria style taste. I liked the Chinese food however I'd rather just go to Panda Express and save myself a bundle. People all around us had plates piled high with crab legs. We didn't try any since that's not our thing. The hotel is close to our house so we may try other restaurants however not too impressed with this buffet for the money. The device was good however.

On a whim, I ended up spending Easter in Vegas.  In search of an Easter-worthy buffet, we ended up at French Market Buffet in the Orleans.  I anticipated the worst, knowing that buffets can often be filled with steamed scrambled eggs and microwaved ham.  Much to my pleasant surprise (a la the Easter Bunny bringing me a basketball hoop when I was 12 years old), the food was absolutely delicious.  The buffet has food stations for different types of food, and they all have cooks behind them doing it up right.  The food was average priced, but so much better than any of the others I've had in Vegas (even the ones I did like).  Although there was a huge line, it went by surprisingly quickly because they had plenty of tables to seat everyone.  I took a chance on them for Easter, and I will absolutely be back on my next trip out.

I've visited this buffet for regular dinner service, weekend brunch, and holiday specials. For the most part this buffet is a great value with something for everyone, even a picky eater like me.

Highlights are the carving station, desserts, and the made-to-order areas. Everything else is divided by cuisine, with lots of flavor in the Asian dishes.

It can be difficult to get a server's attention for something like drink refills or extra silverware.

Came here lunch time on a weekday. Surprisingly long wait in line (maybe ~20-30min) but the line moved fairly quickly.

Nothing too special about this buffet. There's a lot of different options but beyond that, the flavor does not call for a repeat visit....EXCEPT the beef brisket. That was fantastic and I was so surprised. Juicy, fatty, great flavor and seasoning. A MUST get before you fill up with everything else. Because everything else is standard and not great.

Pros: Selection. Each section has a different theme to it so you can pick and choose what you're feeling. Big dessert and salad islands in the middle, but nothing special about the desserts, just your standard selection. Service is good, they're attentive with clearing plates and getting refills.
And to be fair, at ~$12 for a buffet, this place offers quite a lot, and is worth the costs.

Food is adequate.

The USO sponsors meals for families of deployed soldiers twice a month, once at the Cannery, and once at Aliante's buffet.

I participated last month. I had pizza, pasta, salad, and ice cream.
Everything was average, like you'd expect of a buffet, but still delicious.

The dessert area was awesome, as they had several cakes, pies, and cookies, plus a soft serve machine AND about 12 flavors of ice cream served from behind the counter, to choose from.

I'm not sure I would pay to go back there, unless I was at Aliante for some reason other than this monthly event, but it wasn't half bad. Service was impeccable for as jam packed as it was.
I thought this place was great. Staff is friendly food is good. I went around 1pm and it wasn't too busy which was nice. I'd recommend for your money's worth

French Market Buffet at "The Orleans Hotel"
Overall
4 Stars

Gold medal - BEST Fried Chicken Wings
Silver medal - Great service
Bronze medal - Great price

The name is a bit deceiving.  It is not french food, but a mixture of Mexican, Chinese, Italian, & American.  Lots to choose from!

They have the BEST fried chicken.  It was crispy and juicy!!  I want more!!  They also had like 4 other types of chicken items.  Lots of variety to choose from.

The service is really a hit or miss, but during this last visit......... It was a HIT.  The server was super fast, nice, and attentive.  Every time we were done with our dishes he was there to clean it up.  He came by offering refills without us having to flag him down.  He was great. I even over tipped him.

We went on Saturday during Memorial Day weekend.  They did not increase the price to Holiday pricing, which was nice.  It was still $10.99 for lunch.  If you have a players card you, +1 guest are $1 off each.  $9.99 for a HUGE buffet selection is not bad at all!

HAPPY OVEREATING!!

The quality of food has declined over the years, and it may be due to Aliante departing from Station Casinos. Who knows, but it remains an affordable dining option at this property and in the surrounding area. 

There's a "medley" of offerings that you could find at most buffets. The difference here is that the food didn't look appetizing, specifically the wilted lettuce at the salad bars. I stuck to eating the "Asian" food, which has familiar offerings like beef with broccoli, chow mein, lemon chicken, egg rolls, and pork belly. Not bad. 

The dessert section isn't exciting. It consists of donuts, slices of assorted fruit and cream pies, cookies, brownies, and ice cream. Sugar-free options are also available.


Sundays lure in the crowds and are one of their busiest days. Anticipate waiting in line for over a half-hour, especially if there's only ONE person working at the register. A discount is offered to customers with Aliante players club cards. This is beneficial if you want to a save few extra bucks.

This buffet is currently being remodeled. A temporary buffet is open 8am-2pm. The food is banquet style. Not hot or fresh. Beef ribs cold and dry. Waited 30 minutes for an omelet on wedesday. Not much selection. Very unorganized. Not happy at all.

I had the worst experience at the French Market Buffet, the waitress (Judy) told our table to "shut up and listen so I don't repeat myself" then she said the drinks they carry.  I responded by asking her if she was in a bad mood? She said no why!! Then I said because you're being very rude to us.  She stated I'm not being rude and said she will get someone else to serve us.  Then I followed her and she was talking to the hostess Ana and they both were laughing, so I approached both of them and said I don't think it's funny.  Ana responded and said "oh we are not laughing at you", I then said I needed to speak to management.   I got to speak to the supervisor who had me and my friend write a report.  We then were approached by the manager (Rhonda Turner) who I feel was very professional in handling such situation.  I also want to state that the waiter they sent (Felipe) was very attentive and super polite.  Kudos to them both!!! 
I can't believe the bad service we received here and won't be returning.  I still left a tip because Felipe gave us good service the remaining of the time.  
One star as we waited 40 minutes for our drinks and the terrible experience from the first waitress Judy!!!!

I couldn't pass up this $7.77 buffet special for locals inside the Orleans Casino.  It is 1/2 of the regular price of their evening buffet and they had prime rib too.  I haven't been to this buffet for a long long time, so this was the perfect opportunity to rediscover this buffet.  I was impressed by the selection of hot food items.  The prime rib, though, was on the dry side (overcooked).  My wife really enjoyed the jambalaya and pulled bbq pork with fried onions pizza.  I know it sounds pretty weird to me but she said it tasted pretty good.  I, on the other hand enjoyed the crayfish,  Their sushi was freshly made which was nice, compared to other local buffets around town which served day old and dried out sushi.  I would definitely go back for this price.  Okay, maybe not for a couple of week, since I ate way too much in one sitting.

The first thing you should notice is the price and for this one, you know you are going to have a baaaaaad time. I went on a Saturday for brunch. 

Service was quick and efficient so no complaints there. Now getting food is where the ordeal begins because the tongs were on fire! Seriously, trying to pick up food with 100 degree tongs is not fun. 

The fried chicken was decent. The pancakes, waffles, and French toast were very hard. The bacon was overflowing so that's a plus.

My wife on the other hand did not enjoy anything she tried which was breakfast potatoes, roast beef and sushi. Why would she try the sushi ? Smh

If you are hungover and staying at Aliante then maybe this is the place to go, other than that it's a pass.

We came here to eat the Sunday Brunch and it didn't disappoint.  The line was not that long and the guy working the desk allowed us to go get a Players card and come back to the front of the line.  You get a dollar off just cause you have a players card.  The Sunday Brunch was from 8:00 am - 3:00 pm and it was only $16.99.  Free Champagne was Served to Guests throughout the meal.  The Buffet restaurant was packed and the price was worth every PENNY!


On the buffet line going from right to left he French Market Buffet had many different dishes to choose from.  I had to get two dishes, a plate of meat like i was on the atkins diet and one plate of everything else. They had Italian, Mongolian, Barbecue, American, Seafood, Mexican and Chinese food as well as an huge dessert bar with plenty of desserts to choose from.  They had some delicious bbq pork ribs and yummy smoked ribs.  The Smoked Ribs to me was the highlight of the meal.  The bacon was nice and crispy.   My lady had sushi and she hit the huge salad bar that they offered.  She also got her some sushi which she truly enjoyed.


Overall, One of the best buffets I have ever been too. I would have gave them a five.  My only complaint was that the Crawfish and jambalaya that they offered didn't taste like back home.  Need a little bit more salt but I will Definitely be visiting this casino and its buffet again in the future.

Just awful.   We've been eating here for years and it just keeps getting worse and worse.  Nothing new, nothing different, just poorer and poorer quality food.  From the beef that can't be chewed, to the ham with no flavor, to the dried-out turkey and the watery so-called gelato.....everything is barely even edible these days.   Had a great breakfast/brunch at the Sunset Station in Henderson and we're going to start staying there in the future as the food prices are reasonable and the quality is much much better.  Too bad, because Orleans used to have one of the better buffets.
New Buffett at the Orleans. Newly remodeled and branded. It was a good solid Buffet experience.

Please note that this buffet has been remodeled so be careful of older reviews. 

I was pretty impressed with this buffet, honestly. I went for lunch on a Saturday since we happened to be here. Line was fairly long but kept moving quickly. Be mindful that lunch ends at 3:30 but they stop ringing people up at 3:00. 

The place has a very nice variety of food, especially for a frequent buffet lover like myself. They had some odd noodle dishes, fresh pork tacos, a noodle station.  They also had the requisite omelet station and three pans - which means the line moves pretty quickly. I felt like overall the food was pretty fresh and wasn't sitting out. 

I wouldn't go out of my way for this buffet, but if you're already at the Orleans it's worth a visit.

Disappointed in the quality and selection of food during our lunch visit.  The roast beef was tough and did not have much flavor.  I knew it was going to be tough watching the server cut it.  Then, he did not even trim the fat away.  The turkey was really tender and good but the dressing seemed old and stale.  The corn on the cob looked old and did not have much taste.  It did not seem that there was an effort to keep the food fresh and hot.  Service was not anything special.  Really disappointed.  Don't think that we will return

How do I even start? 

Line was lonng, considering it was Labor Day and they had wrestlers in town.

Here, some workers just looked Unhappy with their job. It was packed and it was noticeable on their face at their frustration, especially with some cooks in the back. When a customer tried to make small talk and ask about the food the cook just gave him a nasty glare and shrugged. I don't expect the cooks to be all jolly, but it just felt since they aren't acknowledging guests then how can I expect them to make tasty quality food if they don't give a f$!k?! Plus, our waiter needed an attitude adjustment. I asked for sprite and she rolled her eyes. 

Honestly, I only enjoyed the spring rolls and salad bar. I took a leap of faith with the passionfruit "gelato" (It looks like the gelato melts and they just refreeze it). 

I was disappointed in the fried rice *sad face* and their sub sandwhich. The bread tasted rubbery and very dry while the fried rice was REALLY PLAIN. I felt like whoever prepared the fried rice did NOT know what they were doing. Now I understand why it was barely touched. 

If I were to come back I would visit the BBQ spot. The guy on that side seemed very attentive and the food looked DELISH. 

But I will returning when I have an appetite for that side.

3.4

I've had better food and the same quality of food for way more money in Vegas buffets.  What this place supplies is reasonable food at a price point less than many of the other buffets around.  I went for their steak and crab Wednesday, $15,99 less a dollar discount for being a guest at the hotel.  The crab legs were spindly and the steak was a bit tough but cooked to the medium I asked for.  The swordfish wasn't bad and I noticed several folks with whole plates of crawfish.  Many of the folks seemed to be locals and although I had no wait at 5:00 by the time I was done the place was full and a long line had formed.  They do not rush the diners in the restaurant.  There were plenty of food choices.  I gave up after 4 plates, the last of which was desert.  Because of the number of people everything I tried was still hot or cold as needed.  The vanilla soft serve had given up so I had chocolate ice cream with my peach cobbler.  The service was really quick and I noticed those folks requiring bar service got their drinks quickly.  My one big complaint was my plates got cleared while I was getting another and my service, complete with whatever was on them, was set on the table rather than waiting for me to get back and transfer them to my new plate so I would get a separate plate to put them on on the first trip.  

For the price this was an excellent value.

It's a remodeled French Market Buffet. The decode is modern with open theme, but I think it lack personality. I guess everyone uses the same designer. Palm's new 24 Cafe has similar decor. I have the seafood buffet. They raised the price by about $3/person without raising the food quality. The food selection is the same, but the quality becomes a little worse. For example, the crab legs are much smaller than before. 
The worse part is the service. Our server is Loiter.  She never refilled our drinks. She just cleaned out the dishes. She can walked up to me and asked was everything ok when my glass in front of me was empty. Could you just open your eyes and see we need refills? My friend and I stayed to have some girly talks. Our server just walked past at least 5 times without making eye contact or refilling our drinks. She probably trying to chase us away, so she can rest. 
Anyway, I won't recommend this place. It's over price with so so food and bad services.

THIS PLACE IS AWESOME!!!
Kaori is the best waitress I'm here right now for brunch and so far I have had so much champagne, for 2 people I paid 23 and some change!!! All you can drink mimosas sat and sun 9-3 pm!!!! The food is delicious I'm drunk lol!!! I'll be back tomorrow FORSURE lol.

Just because you are staying at this hotel, it doesn't mean you should eat here. We were tired from traveling and wanted somewhere to eat that was close and convenient. Food is bland and nothing out of the ordinary as far as your common buffet. Not worth $18.

It was Sunday and we didn't want Champagne brunch.  So, this buffet offered a regular breakfast buffet for less $$.  We happily dined here for our breakfast!  

The food was decent.  The selection was pretty good for breakfast, they served the usual breakfast items but they also had Italian, Chinese, Seafood selections as well.  It was good!

My favorite buffet in vegas, every time I come to vegas I make sure to stop by here. The food is really great and the prices arent too bad, especially for a buffet in vegas. Plus the dessert section is amazing.

It was super busy when we went....it was Sunday Brunch.  It did take us a while to get a table for 4.  
--TONS of food options.....but I would stay away from the Chinese menu on the Buffet.  Lacked flavor. 
--Salad bar was adequate....more veggie options would have been good. Ranch dressing was pretty good......Probably the best thing on the buffet was the Potato Latkes.....so much better than the breakfast potatoes.   None of us tried the seafood so can't say if it was good or not.  Our guests raved about the pizza and taco bar.....but I think the actual breakfast was the best.  We had coupons so the price was good.....I would return....maybe not for Wok Wednesdays tho

This buffet has a good selection. The problem is that they don't have enough people eating here. Every time I'm in there is no line and over half empty tables. This creates a good issue. The food doesn't turn quick enough so it gets old and dead. What you need to do is eat within an hour of the meal starting time so all the food is fresh and just put out.

Boy, was I surprised when I walked by and saw this completely remodeled buffet.  I've been staying at the Orleans for Vegas trips for the past 15 years.  I've had the old French Market Buffet more times than I can count and it has always been this drab depressing place with horrible food.  Well, all that has changed.  The Medley Buffet is all new and modernized!

I came for week day dinner and it was $18.99 with players club card.  They have extended the buffet line and there are so many more choices that look much more appetizing and inviting.  The food is overall much improved.  I really liked their smoked pork spare ribs, the braised oxtail, and the menudo.  The old New Orleans items are still there, so rest assured you can still get chicken and sausage gumbo as well as red beans and rice.  The gumbo seems less spicy than it used to be, but nothing a little Tabasco can't fix.  I also really liked the al pastor tacos with the meat actually being cut from the rotating spit.

They also serve crawfish, although when we went they were frozen crawfish from last season.  They were gigantic in size and tasted quite good for being frozen.  They were cooked well enough that you could still take the first ring off and pinch the tail to get the meat to come out all at once.  I hope as crawfish season picks up, they switch over to the live stuff.  It's happened in the past at French Market Buffet, so no reason it can't happen at the upgraded Medley Buffet.

Some items have not changed.  The hushpuppies and fried catfish are pretty dry.  The pizzas look anemic and greasy.  The desserts, while upgraded, are still stuff that's brought in instead of being made in-house.

The staff seem to have more of a spring in their steps and even the clientele seems upgraded.  No longer is this buffet just full of old locals eating for free after earning 200 points.  It felt like I was eating at M Resort.

With this new upgrade, Orleans leapfrogged many local buffets and even many strip buffets.  I'd say the order goes Bacchanal at Caesars, then Studio B at M Resort, then Medley Buffet in a tie with Feast Buffet at Red Rock, then Wynn, Bellagio, and the 3rd tier stuff at the Harrah's resorts.

Tonight my brother in law wanted to celebrate his birthday at the buffet. We were a party a 14 people as my sister in law got in earlier to save a table for us the girl at the register said that she would charge the gratitude tip of 15% so everyone could sit together. Everything was explained clearly but when we all got there the maneger named Rafael was being rude from the time we were paying to the time to sitting us. we paid over 200 dallaras close to $300  and we waited a long time as he said they didn't have a table for us and he didn't want to have someone put tables together for us he was arguing and being rude to my  husband and brother in law he has bad customer service and he was being racist. We had to sit in 3 different tables Evan thou we pain the 15% gratitude. The the receptionist Said paying the 15% gratitude is for us to be able to sit together and it didn't happen. We had the worst experience ever altho our waiter was being nice and the receptionist was being nice 2 it was almost as if she was afraid of him 2. They should lower his position he shouldn't be a maneger or he should go to costumer service classes because he is rude and he argues and he fallows you to keep arguing and while we were eating he keeps passing by with a smirk on his face like laughing at us. If that man is still there I don't recommend going to eat there at all.......

Went here tonight for the Saturday night BBQ Buffet. About $24 including tax and drink. So not bad on the wallet. Buffet overall was just OK. Not really a BBQ buffet as claimed but they did have a good variety of different ribs and some sausage. But no other true BBQ meats. For example when I think of BBQ I think of brisket, pulled pork, BBQ hot link, Yams, Sweet tea and banana pudding. Which they had none of.  I was actually happily surprised by the Craw fish they were huge. The rest of the buffet was just OK and As far as desserts they were terrible very cheap and very little quality.

For a buffet which I normally don't go to buffets hardly at all in the city of many buffets.  The food was absolutely great for a buffet but the food and the selection of food could not make up for the lack of attention by staff from getting drinks to being friendly at the checkout. I don't care what it was we were made to feel like it was asking far too much of them to do anything we ask for a refill on one soda one time and then before we left I asked for a to go cup for tea because I don't drink with my meals at all hardly we don't have to go cups and you can't take a markup on to the floor of the casino. Also I took four times of requesting Tabasco sauce for some of the meal before we got it and then it was like we were troubling the staff to actually help so rather than leave a tip like we had done on the credit card. So we returned to the checkout stand and retracted the tip from it. This is one of those places that make me feel that even though it's free to go eat there because of comped me almost due to gaming play I refused to that pretty much means the Aliante casino not get any of my business thank you very much and have a good day.

I would give this a 3.5 actually because of the outstanding remodel and much improvement in food quality ! Here's what I liked. There was more salad variety, like seafood, edamame, cucumber. The hit items like Asian and Mexican fare look more fresh and appetizing  .We also noticed more of a variety in desserts as well. My favorites, oxtail soup , edamame salad, and Mexican corn !  Very very good !  layout is more spacious without the stations in the middle for cold items like it was before. What I couldn't understand was the Caesar salad station placed far away from the others and the breakfast was still being served at 1230pm. I feel like they were just there to fill space . Otherwise,  I still suggest you check it out !

This is one of the most shittiest place for buffets on a Saturday night which is prime rib and shrimp the shrimp sucks the prime rib sucks they are such a ripoff my daughter just made five years old and she had to pay $18.99! When you look on their website it's a $17.99 for the prime rib shrimp Buffet but it's actually $18.99 when you come here and if you don't have a card it's $22.99 They don't even have everything thats labeled up there on the glass.. the place Crazy Buffet is 10 times better than this Buffet here at this hotel. All I can say is they've lost a customer I WILL NEVER BE BACK TO THIS SHITTY BUFFET!!!!!!!!!
Best buffet for all you can eat crab legs on Friday nights. The selection of other foods is also pretty good.  Will come back again.

Tuesday dinner buffet is Hawaiian night with the roasted pig----the meat was soft and juicy and the skin was crispy. The other dinner entres include American, Asian, Mexican,  & Italian. I would recommend this buffet if you happen to be in the area. Seafood night on Fridays offer all you can  eat snow crab legs.

Medley Buffet, big deal. You serve the same style of food as any other buffet.  Boyd Gaming bought you years ago from Station Casinos. This might explain why you still look like the buffet at Red Rock Casino and Spa.

Where is the originality? Give people a reason to drive to to North Las Vegas.

I don't love Vegas for its gambling or partying, well I do  but mainly for its FOOD!!! 
Every time I come to Vegas I must try a new buffet or restaurant. And this time it wasn't the  exception.  So, I gave this place a try. They literally deserve 3 stars. Everything, including ambiance is MEH. Idk if we were here on a bad day but their employees  seem barely alive to say the least. They have a variety of food, which I gave everything a try and it wasn't horrible but it wasn't good. Definitely not recommending this place, unless you don't care much for your food.

ORLEANS:  The French Market Buffet is located in the Orleans and I love it. 
It has a ton of options for a very affordable price. Not to mention, it's all-you-can-eat!  

VARIETY:  The variety of food available is very diverse. Great for picky eaters, I guess, because of range of food is almost ridiculous! Dinner buffet was my fave; breakfast was a close second. 

Here's a general idea of the dinner spread:
-Fresh and cooked seafood: crab, shrimp, clams, crawfish, sushi, you name it.
-Chinese: stir fry station, noodles, spring rolls, etc.
-American: ribs, steak, etc.
-Mexican: burritos and such
-Several different pastas
-Soup
-Salad bar 
-Dessert bar with a gelato case!

SWEETS:  The desert bar/station will satisfy any sweeth tooth!  Diabetic and all!  I'm so happy to say that they have a whole sugar-free dessert section for all you health nuts and diabetics.  I like to eat and sample sugar-free desserts every now and then, and these desserts are scrumptious.  This buffet dessert station may quite possibly have the best tasting sugar-free banana cream pie I have ever tasted! It tasted better than many regular banana cream pies I've tried! 

VERDICT:  This buffet is definitely a go!  (Who could turn down such a tasty and affordable buffet??!) 
No doubt I will be back for more of that delish sugar-free banana cream pie and that amazing spread.  :)

Haven't been to the Orleans dinner buffet in quite a while...went there tonight, a Monday, for their prime rib featured buffet.  Guess the prices have recently been raised, with my club card, it still cost me $16.50.

Prime rib was dry (I tried it 2 or 3 times--the au jus didn't help...recovering from over eating while I type this), the rest of the selections were truly average and unremarkable.

Compared to other LAS buffets on a Monday night, there are much better (a) values and (b) quality to be had.

Very disappointed, unlikely I'll return to the Orleans feeding frenzy in the future.

Didn't use to be like this...

For a southern style buffet, this place sucks...everything is flavorless unless it has sauce. What I did like about this place was that they had individual sections for each ethnic foods.  Still didn't do much for taste.  Even their freshly cut ribs were terrible (not to mention their dry roast beef)....$18 down the drain...had 2 plates and bailed cause I couldn't see stuffing myself with flavorless food.

Very good selection, and good tasting. Healthy choices too at almost every station. My daughter says to avoid the canolis. The pizza was actually very good. Be sure to watch their close times (lunch ends at 3), but better value for lunch over dinner.

The worst buffet I have ever tried in Las Vegas yet! Everything was dried out and I went there on a Friday during a dinner rush, so everything should be fresh. There is no reason for the food to be dried out or way overcooked. The stuffing was a huge disappointment for me and that is one of my favorite foods. I did not enjoy a single between the Chinese, Italian, and American options. I will not go back.

I'm not a very picky eater because I don't enjoy cooking.  For me, the effort (grocery shopping, cleaning, prepping, chopping, stirring, frying, etc.) and time is not worth it - especially if it doesn't turn out well.  I'm so exhausted from my Graveyard Shift job, that sometimes I'll skip a meal because I'd rather sleep.  That's why I truly appreciate anything anyone cooks.  I understand the work that went into combining ingredients to create a meal.

With this in mind, I especially enjoy Senior Days at the Orleans Casino.  It used to be on Tuesdays, but now it is Wednesday.  After collecting 50 points on your B Connected Players Card, you earn a free breakfast or lunch buffet.  After 100 points, you get a free dinner buffet.  I believe I earned both a lunch and a dinner buffet!

I have been to pricier, higher quality buffets like the Wicked Spoon at the Cosmopolitan, but for the price (free), I can find good enough food at the French Market Buffet. 

For example - the dessert section... the fluffy cheesecake; and the strawberry torte.  I wish the torte's crust was on the lemon meringue pie!  I try to eat things that I don't normally make, such as the bread pudding, chocolate cream pie, and the gelato.  Those are pretty good.  Remember to get a plastic spoon from the dispenser!

The Italian section was okay - there was pizza, pasta, garlic bread, and lasagna.  Nothing really outstanding.  The pizza crust was on the thicker, softer side.

The BBQ area was interesting with its collard greens, yams, black eyed peas, hush puppies, ribs, and fried okra.  I had a well-done rib and enjoyed the crispy edges!  

The Asian foods were adequate: spring rolls, Hot & Sour Soup, Egg Drop Soup, crab sushi, and shrimp tempura sushi...  The noodles loooked spooky, so I just had one for good luck. Some dishes looked sad and overcooked, like they had been there a while... 

The salad bar looked fresh.  The fruits (cantaloupe, honeydew, and watermelon) were relatively sweet.  The peel and eat cocktail shrimp moves here at dinnertime so the crawfish can take its place at the Seafood station.  Dinner buffet includes Prime Rib at the carving station.  Breakfast buffet includes an omelette station.  

I skipped over the Mexican section because by that time, I was full.  I had a bite of macaroni and cheese for my niece, but it was bland.  

The service is quick and efficient.  The atmospere is energetic with many people moving here & there.  It's like a variety show!  The coffee refills are often.  Raspberry iced tea is available.

The long line to get in moves well.  There are many, many chairs and tables for singles and large groups.  It's just a basic buffet for everyone of all age groups to fill up.  The variety and value are noteworthy!

When the Orleans was still fairly new in the 90's I can remember my family and I mean my ENTIRE family would come to eat here because of our aunts who gambled received fairly good comps. However, those days are obviously in the past and I seedom see myself going into this Casino. Recently came here on a week day for lunch costing $8.99. This was a reception for event I attended prior, making it free for all of us! I was at the same buffet 2 years ago and remember it being not that good. Contrary to belief, this time around it was better. The Korean style ribs was decent, not the best, but definitely edible. The BBQ section also had pretty tasty selections. I tried the pasta with alfredo sauce, which had a nice texture and a flavorful garlic taste. I had tirimisu for dessert and I enjoyed that as well. Overrall, "good enough." I don't think I would pay money to eat at this buffet, but the food was good and didn't make me sick.

First of all, bad news for you crawfish fanatics - they have a notice saying they won't be serving them for the foreseeable future. 

I stay at the Orleans a lot because of the gambling and because I get comped (although I'm not exactly a whale - more like a minnow). So I often eat here. This trip I discovered Anton's Secret to Buffeting: try having a meal more like you would in a regular restaurant, that is by courses, or by themes. Usually I sample a bit of everything to make sure I don't miss anything good, but really, this isn't the only time I'm ever going to eat here, so why not be a little more discriminating? 

For example, on this visit I had dinner here twice. The first night I did it strictly Mexican. It was not bad but not memorable - maybe the double tequila had something to do with that. On the second night, I had a full course meal: a seafood appetizer - shrimp and clams, a salad, and an entre of sliced-to-order roast beef with vegetables (although I did sneak  in a yummy rib). And pecan pie for dessert (ok - I also had some bread pudding - but how can you go to Las Vegas and not have bread pudding?). All was certainly as good as your average restaurant, but a lot cheaper.

WORST BUFFET EVER!!!!

Seafood lovers beware! Oysters and clams on the half shell were dried out and tasted so bad that I had to spit it out. YUCK! Prime rib is dry that Au Jus did even moisten the meat which leads me to believe that they didn't allow the meat to rest before slicing allowing all the natural juices to run out.

Hot snowcrab legs were iffy at best, over steamed making the flesh mushy. 

Only the desserts were considered acceptable so that means the pastry chef is better at his/her craft than the head chef.

I am never EVER going back.

Second time coming here. The selection is decent for the amazing price. Less than $9 if paying cash. Everything I sample was good. Coffee is good too. Friendly staff as well. This is now my go to plave for breakfast while I am in town. Recommend.
Much improvement since the renovation in food and atmosphere. However, of course, prices have gone up to help pay for the cost of the renovation.

Saturday night, so nothing special on the menu.  We've been here before, several times; just seemed like the selection wasn't quite as good as before.  No specific raves or complaints.  Or maybe I was just tired.

So I was visiting the family for the holidays.I use to frequent the buffet at the Orleans and it was a good deal. I took my 7 year old daughter who eats like a bird. I went up to pay full price is charged for children ,that's ridiculous! I ponied up $30 for 1 and a quarter of us ok i bit the bullet and paid. So i guess the buffet was recently renovated great, too bad the choices and quality of food went way down. They use to have babyback ribs now they put out the cheap country style that are all fat. I tried some roastbeef,baked chicken nothing was great.We got in right before lunch closed so thought we could get something edible on the dinner .We waited a short while got up served ourselves and came back to a cleared table . A worker came up with attitude and said i would have to pay the extra $17 a head to have what's on the dinner menu. Unbelievable these greedy bastards no way that's worth $32 .They made it seem like I was a criminal stealing food,can't believe they kick people out .fuck this place now!

i'm not a buffet person....and am very snobby about what i eat.  so with that said, i wasn't really able to find much that i would actually eat here.  

although i'm glad the french market buffet's conquistadors invaded a crawfish colony and massacred all its inhabitants, and probably kept some alive for breeding purposes to feed us gluttonous vegas patrons...because all you can eat crawfish made me feel like i ate my money's worth.

Met some friends here for dinner tonight and most things were done OK for a buffet.  However, two things caught my eye.  1)  Perogies larger than 2 raviolis combined and sitting in tomato sauce; and 2) Stuffed cabbage with a sweet raisin sauce.  Who on Earth ever added these tender morsels to the lineup? Certainly not a Top Chef contestant.  I didn't try either of these, but one member of our party tried the stuffed cabbage, but didn't know what it was.  He remarked as to how sweet it was.

I did try some of the red cabbage and that had been sugared too!  It doesn't need to be that way.  The rest of the things I tried were good especially, to my surprise, the Osso Buco.

We met friends here for dinner partly because we'd never been in the place since it opened several years ago.

While no longer a Station Casino, the buffet maintained some of the Red Rock Casino's layout and some of the items were identical to the buffet at Red Rock.  Probably the same supplier.

We were seated promptly.  The area to get your food is quite large and makes getting around people fairly easy.  I was most pleased with the pulled pork at the BBQ section.  The pork buns in the Asian section were good and they have a nice selection of gelato. The rest of the desserts were a bit lacking.

Refills of drinks and coffee at the end of the meal was very efficient.  I may be back when I'm looking for something different especially when I found out that Tuesday night, they have lechon.

Have ate here regularly when I stay at The Orleans.  A typical Vegas style buffet with five culinary stations including Italian, Mexican, Chinese, Mongolian BBQ, and Southwest BBQ. There is also two carving stations with the usual prime rib, ham, turkey or beef brisket.  Large salad bar with a few soup of the day options.  And desserts include many sugar free cakes and pies, gelato and cookies.  Good price for decent quality food.
Nice place to dinner with the family! The crawfish was awesome! The creps are a must!!!

Located inside the Orleans casino, the only reason I went was because I had a free comp. Asian, mexican, american, mongolian bbq are some of the varities of food available.

The quality and turn over of the buffets was so bad that I doubt I would go back even if I have another free comp. The best thing about dining here was that I got lucky at the craps table after dinner.

Worst customer service ever. The cashier was great but the server and supervisor was clueless. We received a comp and with that we were supposed to get (4) souvenir glasses. We told the waiter and he was so stupid that he gave it to another table. We heard the other table say "oh why do we get this?" So, at the end of our dinner we asked for our souvenir glasses and he said, oh no you don't get it. He was asking for the receipt that he took. He tried to argue and got his supervisor who was also clueless, so we had to go to cashier. Needless to say, we got our souvenir glasses. They just didn't seem to care. Also, we left our sun glasses by accident on the table and guess what....when we returned they said they couldn't find them. Hmmmm I wonder why? I know they stole them!!! I guess they needed it more
Hometown Buffet a la Vegas. Pretty standard ordinary sub par food. It is $15 for Sunday which is pricey so definitely I wouldn't go back. I had ham, blintzes and cold shrimp with sauce.

They have improved over the years.  They are actually  one of my favorite places now.  The price is right and the food is good.  Sometimes the lines are super long so dont go when they initially open.

Whoever tweaked the recipes or cooking techniques at Medley...well done! 

The fam decided last minute to go to brunch at Medley before going to the movies yesterday at 1130 am and the line was long. 30mins later we were led to our table and Richard, one of my favorite servers brought our mimosas and champagnes. He kept it flowing while we were there so hubby was one happy customer..ha!

Everything I tried was really good. The roast beef was exceptionally tender, juicy and pink just the way I like it, their ribs were falling off the bone, fried mochies were yummy, the pork buns had more meat in them than usual and what's in that eggplant dish? Holy cow! It was so good I wished I had a waterproof/grease proof purse so I could dump a whole wokful of eggplant goodness in it. I am more of a menudo girl but their pozole was pretty good too. The guys at the omelette station on the Mexican side are always cool and friendly no matter how busy they get as well. The fried plantains are always good too. 

Between Red Rock's Feast Buffet and Aliante's Medley, I'll choose Medley any day.

If you have a coupon, this is one of the best deals in N. Las Vegas for sure.  We had 2 BOGOs from the LVA and had lunch for 4 for eleven bucks.  This buffet is not the Wynn of Caeser's but in my opinion it measures up to all of the other 3* and 4* buffets on the strip.  Meats were excellent and my wife enjoyed their little neck clams.  Very large selection with no lines, isn't that a breath of fresh air.  The Bananas Foster Gelato/Ice Cream may be the best I've ever had, worth the trip alone.  

I also like the clean air and relaxed vibe of the Aliante.   Customer service was outstanding at the buffet and throughout the casino!

Wow!  After the remodel of this buffet late last year, I give it a nudge to a 4 star rating!

Look, I realize these buffets in Vegas are par for the course...so I go with what the buffet is doing to improve themselves, to make it a better experience.  With the newly named Medley Buffet at The Orleans, they seem to have gone all-out with a total makeover!  The old buffet is unnoticeable - new walls, new stations, new decor, new seating, new carpet...new everything!  Their buffet was due for a nice change, and it seems to be all the better for visitors new & old to Vegas.  I think many would be pleased with its new looks!

I'm not really gonna complain about the food either!  No, it's not really competing with the likes of Bacchanal or Wynn or Cosmo when it comes to really high-end buffets...but it gives many of the local player buffets a run for their money!  We went on their most expensive meal night (Friday's Steak & Shrimp is $25.99 per person) and had many selections to eat:

-Prime Rib
-Al Pastor Tacos
-BBQ Beef Ribs
-Shrimp & Pork Shumai
-NY Steak
-Assorted Meat & Cheese Platter
-Kalbi Ribs
-Fish & Chips
-Crepes

Overall, mostly good!  Some of the items were on the overdone side, like the NY steak.  Some were not flavored the way I prefer, like the Kalbi ribs.  The BBQ beef ribs are tasty but they do tend to get stuck in your teeth & get very messy!  The crepes were not my favorite - batter is a bit too thick and more pancake like.  But I give them an A for effort on those.

The station selections were varied and there are more offerings than ever before.  Choices people, choices!  So while you may not like everything you try, there must be something you can agree with!

For me, the best selection they had that night was a HUGE pot of Oxtails they brought out!  We Asians know!  The minute I saw those glistening oxtails I knew I had something special.  Right after I got my large bowl (OK 3 large bowls), all my Asian peeps followed suit.  One little Chinese lady actually came to our table and asked exactly where those oxtails were on the service line!  Popular to say the least!

Great experience at the all-new Medley Buffet with my family!  Good eats with good company always makes for a good time!

Don't forget your FREE B Connected players card when you visit the buffet, discounts galore depending on your player level.  

We'll be back Medley Buffet!

On Veterans Day, we knew just about every buffet (especially Station Casinos) would be packed to the brim with folks!  Especially our deserving veterans, who all got to eat for FREE at a number of local buffets!  If I was a vet, I would have been livin' it up all day at the buffet...comped meals for breakfast, lunch, & dinner!  Eating = 100x better than gambling.

We decided to go to the farthest local buffet we could think of that may have a tinier crowd that day.  What a trek just to go to the Medley Buffet at Aliante!  Driving there alone on 215 makes it seem like you're going to another city.

The line at the Medley Buffet was hardly any different!  Even at a late lunch the line was still near full, lots of vets wearing their military hats or shirts, ready to eat with their IDs out!  It was a glorious site to behold - these folks fought for our freedom...and were now fighting beside us for the next open spot at the buffet!  Really it was a madhouse.  I can only imagine what the other more central buffets were doing.  Frickin' crazy.  Took us about 30 minutes to get to the front of the line, then a small wait for a table.  Luckily there were only 3 of us in our party so we didn't have to wait long.  Many tables had large families on them, all celebrating with at least 1 vet on them.  Man, Daddy how I miss you so!  Wish you were with us on this day to help celebrate what you did for the good ol' U S of A.  #armyvet

The lines for food at the buffet were constantly flowing with folks in and out.  I overheard one of the sous chefs who had been there since 5 AM prepping, that by the end of breakfast they had served over 1000 people already!  That in itself is a battle.  And it was only lunch time!

It was good to see vets enjoying time with their grateful families, but I do have to knock some stars for the quality of food at the Medley Buffet.  Come on guys, vets coming in, how about you up the ante, eh?  Put on that extra burner to give not just quantity, but some extra lovin' quality!  A lot of the food on the lines were short on TLC.  Some of it looked like it was made in a rush sloppily to satisfy hungry patrons.  Some of it just sat under the heat lamp too long (hello fish fillets) and took a beating.  And what is up with the Asian station?  It's like a half-hearted attempt to put some sorry looking stir-fry out.  Just mediocre.

For the most part I stayed away from the buffet stations that were getting the least attention by eaters - the Asian & the Italian.  Most of the foods there just looked like it sat too long, wasn't changed out in a timely manner.  Marinara sauce got a slight crust over the top?  PASS.

Majority of what I chose to eat came from the American station and the Mexican station.  Food seemed the freshest there because of the high foot traffic.  Things I like the most that day were the turkey (I got me an entire LEG), and the tacos with carnitas.  Those tacos were pretty tasty, I had like 8 of them!  For some reason I also grabbed a chicken nugget from the food line, and unfortunately the ones from McDonald's (even Wendy's) are better.

I passed on a lot of the other options available, desserts didn't appeal to me, nor did their salad bar.  Their BBQ station was a pass for me too, even though I thought about a 'fresh' grilled cheeseburger.  But as I watched one being made, why grill-maestro, why did you not put the buns on the grill with a pat of butter?  That is crucial for a great burger!  Ugh.

Service was good, and our server was very friendly even though she had a billion tables that day.  She fell behind on our drinks but made sure to apologize when she did come around for refills.  No knock on her for being super busy.  A vet takes precedence over my needs just about any day of the week.

Nicest thing I can say about the Medley Buffet at Aliante was the price.  Even for Veterans Day, price for entry was only $8.99 for lunch with the Aliante players card.  If you didn't have the card it was only $1 more.  Wallet friendly for sure.    

Will we be back?  Probably, but it may take some convincing or a BOGO FREE coupon to lure me back to Aliante.  In my opinion, it was much better when Aliante was still owned by Station Casinos and this used to be a Feast Buffet.  On the upside though, the slot machines may now be looser now than when Station Casinos was the owner, I won our buffet money back with the $7 I had leftover in my pocket!  Breaking even can sometimes be the greatest thing.

**Don't forget kids - VETERANS are one of the main reasons you & I can rant & rave on YELP today!!  #freedom  **

Voted Best Buffet in Las Vegas... I see that advertising for everywhere in Vegas... Who decides what is the Best of Anything???

In this case, regardless of the billboards, I do. I believe this to be the Best Buffet in Vegas. I have eaten at several including the Rio and Bellagio. 

The French Market Buffet at the Orleans is a much better value than the others. On Friday's it is higher than other days, but being Catholic I appreciate that almost everything they serve at all the stations is seafood. 

For under $20 on Friday, I piled high plates with crab and shrimp. Had civeche, shrimp fajitas, fish, sushi, clam strips, oysters, a smorgasbord of seafood. Everything was delicious. 

There are also a ton of desserts to choose from.

First and last time in!
I've never had burnt crab legs before. Waited in line for an hour only to be told they were closing at 9:00pm. If we hadn't paid by then we wouldn't get in. At 8:53pm I paid for our buffet. Still didn't get seated until after 9:00. Then we were told that the food was being pulled at 9:30. 
Ok fine, we will grab a couple plates of what we want. 
At 9:40 we were told we needed to hurry up and finish because they were closing soon. Ok fine, I understand. The problem was in the delivery! The manager on duty telling the tables they needed to "hurry up" was ver rude and completely unprofessional. 10-15 minutes later she came back around and told us that and I quote " It really is time for you to leave now. We are closed and you need to leave this room now". 
Could not believe I was being spoken down to like that.
Food was mediocre at best. My crab was BURNT. Black and charred. Oysters were gritty like they weren't rinsed off enough before prepared. Mashed potatoes tasted like the instant stuff. 
Our server was nice and took good care of us.

Came here for Saturday brunch, only $10.99 and they have a little bit of everything, I strongly recommend. Their hotel is always nice and clean and their machines are on the looser size. Over all this place is worth an early morning trip or early afternoon and a nice place to play, their movie theater and food court is nice too.
Service there sucks and the food is mediocre at best I wasn't expecting greatness just decent food.  Save yo dollas and go to some place else.
