Excellent buffet for the price!  They have all sort of different foods to choose from, and not the long over crowded buffet like the ones on the strip.  Also sign up for there free B-Connect card and you get a discount on the buffet.  Well worth the trip and price.

Since they've done the redesign it seems their food menu was also redesigned. The selection has decreased but the quality has increased. We've gone several times four different meals and I can now say I'm happy with their breakfast! Someone finally learned how to cook scrambled eggs!! Salad bar is decent but it seems like they took out a lot of the other salad types to choose from. Steak options are good but they're always overcooked. I would suggest making them medium-rare and then grill a little longer for those who want thoroughly cooked meat, I prefer medium, the Mister likes medium rare - unfortunately we don't get that option here, it's either well-done or well-done. Dessert area is definitely lacking options, and flavor. Seems to be easier to get in these days though, as we haven't waited more than 10 minutes in line. It still could use a little more improvement in food quality/quantity, but a definite step up from where it was!
Went for lunch, very over priced for food out of a box.  Alfredo sauce tastes like milk. The black beans so old they were hard. Staff excellent at ignoring customers. Horrible experience.

Medley buffet has been one of my go to buffets, I've been here for lunch and dinner but this is the first time I've done breakfast. Early in the morning night too many people, i was able to get my food rather quickly. I had a variety of food but the one thing i really enjoyed was the country fried stake. I don't know what i was expecting but i was somewhat disappointed with the variety, and the quality of food that was available for breakfast.

Overall not a bad experience but not the greatest either.
Great breakfast! Love the cooked to order eggs, unlimited bacon, yummmmmmm bacon!!!! Always very clean and staff is super friendly.

This is, by far, my favorite buffet in all of Vegas Valley. There are a lot of things I really enjoy and the taste and temperature is very consistent. The shrimp scampi is a must if you aren't allergic to shrimp. The prime rib isn't the best, but it is still pretty yummy. Also, there is SUSHI. Which is actually fresh tasting and delicious. They only offer a few different rolls, but it is better quality sushi than you would expect.

The vegetable sides are really where this buffet stands out, in my opinion. Especially the roasted potatoes by the BBQ section, the Lyonnais potatoes in the Frenchy section, and the greens beans all the way down at the end in Italian/Asian.

It reminds me of back home in Texas. And I don't say that about much. The only thing lacking, which I would have expected to see in a New Orleans-themed place, was rolls of some kind. They had fantastic corn bread, but no good yeast rolls like you get down South.

Came here cuz my roommate and I had comps and wanted to try some place we hadn't been before. We heard some good things about this buffet and as a Boyd loyal player we decided to try this buffet , all I have to say was WOW! This place has totally stepped up their game !!! There was a huge variety of food from many different cultures , I was impressed by the many many carving stations and live action cooking stations , such as create your own pho, the made to order crepes and tacos !! The Chile verde is the bomb and if I get comps again heading here for that alone , it was that good !! Actually many of their pork dishes were great !! Also for the gluten free crowd the table menus give you a play by play of your gluten free options , I did post a pic !! All in all we left with a full belly and a happy disposition !! Only reason for 4 stars is that service was a little spotty starting out but our server did eventually come around and was there when we needed refills or a clean table !!

Just made it before the end of breakfast at 10am. $7.99pp with the players card was a great, especially when paying for 8. Great selection and everything was well prepared. Good selection of American and Mexican. Even had good menudo.  They started bringing lunch out at 1030, so the big eaters in our group ate two meals in one sitting. Great value.

This review is based on lunch dining - I would've never though to go here, but it was a work stop, so here goes my review. 

It's $7.99 for lunch and it's quick, its food and whare more would you expect given those two things.  It doesn't compare to many of the strip buffets in terms of the quality of food, but I don't think it tries to.  

There is quite a large variety of options organized by cuisine.  I had a few things from the american and chinese section and a salad.  I did see pizza, pasta, potatos, fried chicken, meatloaf, mac-n-cheese, a mexican spread of tortillas and taco shells with the fixin's, and salmon that was actually pretty tasty!  There are quite a few dessert options to go with the many food options and there is hard scoop ice cream and I am a sucker for hard scoop ice cream!  The soft serve machine stuff doesn't cut it.  The coconut cream pie was probably the best tasting thing I had during my trip there, definitely recommend it. 

Btw, THERE IS NO ROMAINE - it's an iceberg lettuce kind of place, but that sums it up.  That should be the title of this review. :)

A solid 3+.

We came on a seafood night (Friday) and it was packed.  The hostess/waitress was very helpful.

Plenty of shrimp, crab, and crawfish.

Liked their dessert; plenty dishes to choose from.  Price was reasonable.  $32 for dinner and on a holiday weekend.

If your points are paying for the meal then it's worth it but i wouldn't pay out of pocket. Good place to bring kids to fill up on whatever they need. You won't find the best cut of meat here. They do have a good asian and seafood station. They have a good breakfast selection in the AM. The waiters were good at bringing the drinks and getting plates off the table.

Mediocre food. You get $1 off up to two buffets with one player card. The prime rib was super rare, pork loin was dry. Peel and eat shrimp were good, but too much work. Desserts were pretty good, loved the chocolate cake and various gelatos. Service was basic, the table was dirty and server took forever to clear our stacked plates.

Good food, friendly staff don't see something you like? Ask!!, they"ll make it for you! Or at lest they did for me. 
Didn't really do the all to you can eat just ate once and it's great for it's price. 
Came here 2 weekends in a row for the Viva rockabilly fest. Wasn't disappointing with the food ever. Really cheap and worth for what you get.

Mediocre at best. The crab legs were over salted, and the oysters were questionable: both grey and dry. The pork ribs were tough, the salmon was over cooked and dry, and the watermelon tasteless. Sad to say it, but the best thing I had was the butterfly fried shrimp, and those probably came out of a box in the freezer. For the price, save some cash and go to Krazy Buffet. At $30 a head, color me unimpressed.

Cheap ($14.95 dinner) and good enough!  Everyone lived and had no emergencies eating here! :)

Didn't have to wait very long, once we paid we were seated right away and SUPER close to the food.  It was great!  Service was excellent!  Food was hot and from the amount of people there was a good turn of fresh food.  Nice layout too - spacious and  no rude people.  Keep Calm Get Buffet On! :)  

My favorite was the crab legs, crawdads, peel-n-eat shrimp, when given the right cut the baby back ribs were excellent and beef ribs were pretty cool too.  I had tiny bits of everything and didn't feel like those Wall-E floaty people!  Dessert was alright.  I did like the coffee ice cream.  Pumpkin - not so much. 

I'd go back.

I really wanted to try a buffet while in Vegas. It was New Year's Eve, so we wanted to avoid the madness of the strip until that night. We were staying fairly close to the Orleans Casino and decided to give this place a try. Many buffets off-strip didn't seem to have great reviews, and this place seemed decent while remaining reasonable priced. I don't want to spend tons of money, as I can't eat enough to properly take advantage of a buffet.

We were quite happy with the offerings at this buffet. After paying, we were seated at a table and received excellent service for drink refills and bussing. I started with some BBQ, trying the pork links, biscuit and gravy, and jerk chicken. I also tried some french fries and fish filet from the seafood section. From an American food section, I had mac and cheese. From the Asian section, I had sweet and sour chicken, potstickers, egg rolls, and lo mein. I also had a salad from the salad bar and gelato, a mini pecan pie, and a mini piece of chocolate cake for dessert. There was another Asian-inspired section and a Mexican section as well, although I didn't try those.

I liked everything that I had, with the exception of the mac and cheese. It was dry and flavorless, although others in my group seemed to like it. The biscuit for the biscuit and gravy was extremely dry, but the gravy softened it, in addition to being tasty. The Asian foods were typical, Americanized offerings but had good flavor. Everything available looked appetizing, even if it wasn't my cup of tea. The salad bar was small, but I enjoyed the balsamic vinegarette and the topping options. The balsamic and oil and vinegar were the only dressing options that weren't a fattier, mayo-based option.

I wish I could have eaten more, but there was simply wasn't enough time for us to linger to have more helpings. If you're in the area and looking for a good buffet, I don't think you'll be disappointed.

First time staying. And not too bad.

Pros: Room service is excellent. They go above and beyond to ensure food is delivered fresh, hot and to your specs. Lessie is the best! So ask for her by name! Tried both dinner, a Cobb salad and a cup of soup and breakfast, both were delicious. 

The rooms are clean! The staff does a very good job in restocking supplies, and ensuring the rooms are not only tidy but actually clean! That is a big deal it seems anymore, so bravo to the housekeeping staff.

There is a small arcade room near the movie theatre which is fun, not big but fun. 

The buffet is not to bad! The staff ensured we got a military discount without us even asking which was super nice. The scoped iced cream is a nice touch. And service was fast. 

I love the full service Starbucks! And the location is fantastic especially if you need to get to Nellis AFB and Creech AFB. 

Cons: The lights on the phones in the room. There are screens in the phones and are suppose to shut off and dim at night but ours lite up like the strip off and on all night. There was also some blinking green light under the desk that went off periodically as well. So, after doing damage control aka: taking towels and our clothes to cover all the lights up, we finally got an undisturbed nights sleep.

But the reading lights are nice as well as the picture lights that you can turn off and on.

I secretly wish all hotels would start upgrading mattresses to foam mattresses like a Casper.  The spring coils don't offer much super and the pillows are also too sloppy. It takes two to equal the support of one pillow.  Hint. Hint. Boyd.



We wish this was not a smoking casino. And there was a poker room.

Went to the breakfast buffet around 10am. There were only five people in line ahead of myself and my guest and we were seated quickly. I got the usual: bacon, scrambled eggs, and ham. My guest had eggs Benedict and granola and fruit-- didn't like the fruit or the terrible tasting Benedict. The bacon was very salty. The ham was a little salty, and the eggs were just ok. Service was ok. I will probably go back for dinner sometime. But the breakfast is not the best. I remember it being better, but not this day. The price was good with a players discount, came to $15 for two.
Great buffet for the price!  We ate here twice in the 4 days we were here.

Came to the Orleans Hotel with a roommate who scored free tickets to the Bill Maher show (He was hilarious)... decided on the buffet since the line wasn't long and none of the other restaurant options there seems interesting.

Being a native Las Vegan who was born here. I have not eaten at the Orleans Buffet since 1998 when I was 16.

That being said I was actually surprised by it.... the salad bar had nice crisp lettuce as well as all of the other options for your salad looking and tasting fresh and crisp as well. the salad plates were stone cold too which was a plus!

Of the options they had on the buffet line I didn't try any of the Mexican or Italian selections, I stuck mostly to the seafood area (They had a sign out that said due to unforeseen circumstances they would not have any craw fish, when I asked, the response was that they wouldn't have any for another week.) but the peel and eat shrimp were nice and plump and easy to get into and the Seafood Newburg and Cioppino were surprisingly good. 

The beef ribs were disappointing however as was the cut of prime rib. I also didn't like the Salisbury style steak that they had with a mushroom gravy, I went in at it with a fork thinking it'd cut right through it however the fork bounced back and almost took my eye out.

not much for seafood selection and as I said before the Mexican/Italian section didn't have anything that looked appetizing, the Mongolian section had SUSHI though which is kinda strange however the rice was pretty good and the fillings were decent for basic buffet sushi. 

TIP!: MAKE SURE YOU GET YOUR B-CONNECT CARD BEFORE PAYING!! (The regular price of the buffet is 14.95 without that card however it drops down to 9.99 after you get the card. 1 B-CONNECT card is good for two people to enter and the 5-10 minutes you'll use getting it is worth saving 5 bucks per person.

Overall it was not terribly bad however it wasn't amazingly good, but it'll make a turd.

This was our plan B when plan A was a bust (we checked out the menu at the oyster bar and the cafe, but majority ruled)- the McMullen's irish bar across the street was jam-packed, and there was a radio station there too (should've known it would be a hot spot since St. Paddy's fell on a weekend this year). (We'd been here years ago, but I think that it was seafood night.)

Since I had the baby, my system has gotten a little sensitive to certain dishes so I went the safe route and stuck to a few choice items: shrimp scampi- didn't really taste like it was supposed to but eatable (didn't get seconds), chicken gumbo (good considering the averageness of the buffet as a whole), peel 'n eat shrimp- who can mess this up, right?, mussels- a tad overdone but eatable, green beans- surpsingly a crispness to it, and not soggy, prime rib- good, once you cut out all the fatty parts (and there was a lot of it). There were salads, mexican, seafood, carving stations, asian including a mongolian feature, and pasta. 

I still find that some people get a little crazy when it comes to food, and that there will always be an impatient person right next to you or someone who wants to create their own line when there is already a clearly defined line started. The majority of the diners were good, except there were a couple kids playing and when there is a big crowd, that type of horseplay is not appropriate period.

An average Las Vegas casino buffet is the best way I can put this place, not the worst, not the best, just right smack-dab in the middle. To tell you the truth, the desserts ARE better than the food selections- there were No-Sugar selections as well, in addition to the pies- pumpkin and pecan, cakes- red velvet cake, slice of rolls- lemon or raspberry, cookies, macaroons, plus ice cream and gellato- about 9 flavors like cookies 'n cream, coffee (delish!!!), watermelon sorbet. Just steer clear of items like cake slices that were the obvious leftovers. I made the mistake of grabbing a red velvet slice, against my better judgement, and had to take off the entire side because it had hardened a bit- eww.

There was a lot of refilling of dishes going on by the workers, which meant there were a bunch of customers here. It was a good crowd for a saturday night. It wasn't too noisy, since our baby got to nap a bit. I also noticed a Hand Sanitizer station in between food stations, which you don't see a lot in a typical Vegas buffet. The drink server was good except she kept missing asking one person in our party. 

FYI- get the card so you don't feel like you just wasted your money; it's a few dollars cheaper when you "get connected." $12.99 for saturday dinner.

I actually didn't finish anything that I attempted to eat. This Buffett had a little of everything which in the beginning was promising. I tried the enchiladas, bad choice bland and cold. Tried the egg rolls, took one bite and was done yuck. Tried the fried okra one of my favs. Tasted like it had been in the freezer along time before it was cooked. Tried the roast chicken and one bite was enough. Then I thought let's try desert, that can be bad. Have you ever had warm coconut cream pie? I have now.

Great service and delicious food! 
In other countries, they charge a fee if you leave too much food 
It wouldn't be a bad idea to start charging people because some of them waste to much food

If I could give the FMB 3.5 stars I would. However, because I think when it comes to buffets they are about as good as you can get in  regards to bang for your buck. The French Market Buffet along with the Garden Buffet at South Point are my two go to buffets for the price, especially when eating with the family. I will clarify though, we RARELY eat the buffet because it is not always worth it when you aren't meat eaters. That being said - the French Market provides more veggie options than many other higher priced buffets at similar casinos, and they have a lot more seasonal fresh fruit than some strip buffets. 
We happened to go for dinner on Saturday after seeing a movie. It was about  6pm, there was no line, and we paid about $30 (including tip) which is about the same as we'd pay at another restaurant. I usually stick to Chinese and Mexican with the addition of fruit and veggies, and this night was no different. Everything seemed pretty fresh,  except for some roasted potatoes. The fruit (mostly melons) was fresh and juicy. As always the desserts were good.I think the secret to buffets is as Anton mentions - eat in courses. That is definitely the way.  What you really must know about this buffet, and any of the non-strip buffets is that the food is not the best you'd find, but not bad at all. Don't expect the best Vegas chef's but you will get a meal here that rivals the restaurants in this and other local casinos. 
On this particular occasion our service sucked, but that really was the worst we'd ever had at the this buffet. Since we don't eat the buffets often, it probably won't be until we have family in town to go back, but they are always satisfied, and so are we.

This is the buffet option in the Orleans Casino.  We had lunch there with a reunion group and were well served in a separate room.   The food options were extensive, if not terribly exciting....other than the dessert bar which was nearly overwhelming in variety of cakes, pies, fruit, gelato and even no-sugar-added caramel gelato.  Other reviewers note the different ethnic cuisine bars, but the Mongolian area offered bacon, eggs and other breakfast items at 11 am. 
 Price was under $10 with the free "B-card" offered by the hotel/casino chain (available on the casino floor.)   Slightly higher in the evening, but prime rib is included.   (BTW prime ribs seems to the the mascot meat in LV)  Considerably better and nicer ambiance than the usual Golden Corral or other buffet at a very reasonable price

Came for the LECHON on Tuesdays make sure you get a players card for your discount. The review is only for lechon. As soon as we turned into the parking lot we could smell the lechon! Our windows were rolled up our mouths we already watering before we took our seat belts off! 
The lechon was delicious! We arrived around 7 there was a short line to pay for the buffet, and a short line for the pig, they even had mang Thomas the Filipino dipping sauce the pig was nice a moist and the skin exactly how it should be crunchy!

Poor customer service.  We went there to get the Buffett and no one was there to greet you , when someone did come up they were like we're closed and walked away. Another worked came out from the back and stated they are closing at 8 pm Mon to Thursday now.   No notice on that either
Cost considered, this place is a great bang for your buck.  Food tastes good,  surprisingly the coffee is high quality.

Not as good of some of the high end buffets in Vegas, but the price and food are decent. You get to sample various different types of cuisine (American, Chinese, Italian, Japanese, Creole/Soul, etc.), and although it's not the best, you will eat well. My favorite was the desert bar which had so many options, it was hard to make a decision. The desert bar even serves Gelato hand scooped by a server : ) 

 One thing that turned me off was seeing children put their fingers in the chocolate fountain, while their parents were standing right there! 
 If you are in search of an off "The Strip" buffet on a budget, this is your answer. Just don't eat from the chocolate fountain ; )

This is not your grandmother's buffet!  We went on a very crowded Friday night to the all you can eat snow crab leg and seafood buffet!  Surprisingly, we were seated quickly. I was impressed with the fresh and tasty food.  They even had great sushi.  The variety of food was amazing, everything seafood you could ever want!  And they still had some staples like mac & cheese and hot dogs for the kids.  The desserts were delicious and very appealing!  Highly recommend this buffet!

This is one of my favorite buffet restaurant so far. Some of people in front is friendly , other is not. Most waitress is good and friendly. We have to wait less than 10 minutes for the seat. It's not too bad. The food is okay. I like the crawfish here. Others are normal, nothing is special. $26 for special on Friday. For me, dinner is better than breakfast.

The first thing to know is that this buffet is super cheap -- which is awesome. I've tried just about every hotel's buffet and sub-$15 blows my mind. Food is separated by types of cuisine and they actually have a seafood section with piles of shrimp. Quality is okay, you basically get what you pay for.

There's also endless gelato. Some foods I liked included the ribs, potatoes, roast chicken, shrimp, and pastas. 

This is the kind of buffet you take someone who isn't a picky eater or someone who you don't like too much but eats a lot -- or both. Great place if you're forced to pick up the tab.
For the price this is a good buffet.  Everybody is friendly and the overall quality is good. They have several stations so the selection is good for enough to make my family happy.

You will find a couple items you like here, but overall, this is only a buffet I would  go to if I was staying at the hotel and did not feel like heading out to a better one because it's pretty basic.  I found a couple items I enjoyed, namely this Hawaiian shredded pork dish.  But the salad bar is sad, no bread to speak of.  For the price, it's not bad, but it is worth spending more to experience better quality and selection.  Would have gotten a 2, but I recall they surprised me with a pretty good dessert item at the end.

I stayed at the Orleans for several days this past weekend and the French Market Buffet was a staple of my diet while here. Hey, I'm Chinese (or at least half)- you say "all you can eat" and I'm runnin'!

The breakfast is economical at about $7.50 (okay, I don't remember exactly, but it was more than $7 but less than $8). Compare that to a menu breakfast at Denny's or the like only you can come back for seconds!

Saturday night was my favorite night because they featured prime rib! They have two stations, one for medium rare and one for medium well. The rare is juicy and buttery! Mmmmm!! For seconds I went for assorted jumbalaya, seafood and crawfish which are regular dishes.

I was getting pretty full and felt it was time for dessert. I got up and came back with another helping of rare prime rib!

I think I'm going to be eating a bag of salad everyday for lunch for the next week or so....
Want crab for Easter? lol don't come here. Each leg was cut into 1/4s. I don't know if they're trying to save money, but don't overcharge the buffet for a "Crab special" and then pull that crap.
Great foods specially the crab legs, the price is reasonable, if you go there on Friday you gets 5 bucks off the buffet.

Decent buffet for the price.  Crawfish, shrimp, deserts could use improvement. Wait staff was very good.  Line took 30 min to get in with empty tables inside. Salads, shrimp and meats were all very good as well. The Oyster Bar in The Orleans is fantastic.

Rarely eat at buffets but we were seeing movie so seemed a good place for lunch. The wait to get in was awful. We could see plenty of empty tables and people leaving but they did not have enough staff. Food was so-so. Key lime pie and their gelato very good. Wouldn't do it again.

I am sorry to give two star to Buffet, food is really not so good, dishes are cold, food is blend and without flavor . Desert bar is much better, they deserve four stars at least. On the other hand costumer service is flawless . They truly deserve five star.  I had some issues with a food, they took care everything in very professional way. Security took my report very seriously, buser( Tony)  was on the point, server nice and manager Ana sweetest person I ever met in my life. Thank you for taking care me and give me feeling that I am special guest not just number. Hopefully next time food is going to be better and warmer but I wish service stay always so good and nice.

this is a cheaper version of bellagio, if you ask me.  The food is good, and though their dessert selection is average, it definitely exceeds my expectations based on their price.  Though i dont like it, my parents always get plates and plates of craw fish...no thanks.  i like the variety and especially the price.  were were lucky enough to grab a bunch of $5 coupons and ended up paying $8 for the meal per person....but yeah..if youre on a budget, and want to eat at a buffet, skip the rio because this is the place to go.  one of my favs!

We visited Medley Buffet while staying at The Orleans Resort and Casino in Las Vegas. We were given a Buy 1 Get 1 Comp on our gaming cards. This buffet runs $21 p/p & $32 p/p on Sunday's. John said it must be good. Let's try it. This buffet represented all ethnic cuisines. I know the stations took up a 1/2 mile. Not making this up. Full Salad Bar, Asian, Hawaiian, Italian, Mexican, American, Japanese and so forth. All had a menu option. The dessert bar was topped with fresh baked cookies, pies, cake slices and ice cream. I can see why they charge so much. The servers were attentive and helpful. They asked us about our stay and genuinely wanted to wait on us.  We will visit again soon.

Arrived at 9.45am for the breakfast buffet only to be told by the hostess that the food would be pulled at 10.30am and everyone had to vacate the restaurant before 11am.  Turns out over 50% of the food was yanked by 10.10am and many containers of food were already empty.

The food is inline with Station casino food. Plenty to choose from but not many healthy options, lots of fake/toxic food additives/flavors and you won't remember eating it a couple of hours later.

Surprisingly, the coffee was exceptionally good.

Our Server Elsa was top knotch. We poached her as our original Server Peggy couldn't be bothered showing up for 15 minutes and the place was not busy.

As far as buffets go in Vegas, who rules the roost? Not Medley Buffet at Aliante, but for those living in the North/Northwest side of town - it will do.

My husband, myself, and my brother trekked here on Christmas Day for dinner. We arrived at about 1:30 PM, which I think was the "sweet spot" because there was only a few others in line ahead of us, and when we were seated, there were no other patrons around us. However, as we got through our meal it got crowded real fast.

This buffet offers the "norm" - meat carving station (props on the very succulent and juicy turkey, probably my fave of everything), and the prime rib was nothing to turn your nose up at. The ham though fell flat and dry. Other "traditional offerings" included stuffing, mashed potatoes, gravy, green bean casserole.

Other sections of the buffet include: Asian, Mexican, and Desserts. It's not the greatest selection, nor is it the worst.

Aliante has been broken away from Stations Casinos for a couple years, so don't expect to be able to use your Station Card to get a discount here, you have to sign up to Aliante's players club. However, since it was Christmas, the kind cashier charged my family the players club price anyway. Per usual this is a good deal taking about $3-$4 off the norm price.

I was happy to not have to cook or clean dishes after a big meal. Only downside is, we have no leftovers! Oh well.
For $12 for 2 people price wasn't bad but the food was bland.  Breakfast buffet is better.

Our waitress was attentive and kept our drinks  filled  and table clear of dirty dishes. Brunch Buffett was the typical stations with breakfast, international stations, carving station and omelette made to order. I was surprised at the freshness of the fried chicken. It was still moist and skin crunchy. The carving station was a disappointment. To save time they precarved some of the meat so it looked dry and unappealing.  Had to wait for the attendant to ask for a fresh slice.  Wife loved the ice cream selections and the soft serve. It wasnt top tier like the strip but for what i paid it was good.

Can't say much about lunch but definitely come here for breakfast.
My friends and I came here for lunch and was not impressed but received a $2 off coupon for breakfast. So the next morning we came and ate breakfast at about $4 a person. Only in Vegas can you find prices like these for the food you get. The breakfast is a fat kid's dream come true complete with pancakes, waffles, desserts, you name it. 
By the way if you go a little later say around 10:15 you get to start off eating breakfast and end the meal with a little bit of lunch (spoken like a true fatass).
When we got there breakfast was being served but they changed everything into the lunch menu not too long later.

This place makes losing money in Vegas worthwhile. And this is why I love Vegas. People think I come here to gamble but I secretly come because of the food.

We were in Vegas for Thanksgiving and looking for a reasonably priced buffet with good food.  We were close to the Orleans so we went to their French Market Buffet. After a 40 min wait (not bad for Thanksgiving at 1pm) we got a table and it was really, really good for the most part.  

The traditional Thanksgiving fare was not that great.  I didn't like the way they did the yams at all.  My husband thought the dressing was ok but I didn't.  The turkey breast was delicious but the dark meat was pressed in a loaf and slice, my husband didn't like it much.  

However the other food was awesome!  Seafood Newburg, Jambalaya, Crab Stuffed Salmon from the seafood section.  Hubby had a plate of Mongolian BBQ that he loved.  The Steak with Peppers from the Asian area was faboo, tender and delicious!  There was also some Veal Osso Bucco.  It was new to me but really good.  

The dessert area was also wonderful with a LOT of variety.  Strawberry Shortcake and Cheesecake were our favs.

This is my favorite buffet in Vegas.  Cheap, No Lines and all you can eat Crawfish.  Has almost the same selection of food as the Rio Buffet and you'll never find a line here.  The desserts are delicious too, plenty of southern favorites.  But yeah I cant say enough about the all you can eat crawfish.  You pile a plate full of crayfish, clean them, eat them, and go back for more.  So remember this place if your in Vegas and its lunch time and you dont want to wait in a long line to eat.  Oh yeah did I say they had crayfish?

The best spot for getting your grub in vegas, especially if your on a budget. Can't complain, all you can eat crawfish + only $11 for dinner. This isn't some fancy fusion bellagio $50 buffet, this is just good simple affordable food. Been here many times with family, many of the locals go here too. Compared to the price of other buffets, can't complain, service is always average and better. When you spent all your cash on clubs, crap tables, and your drunk off your a$$ this hits the spot.

Every Christmas season a club my husband belongs to, which shall remain nameless to protect the dorky, has their Holiday "party" at a different buffet.  I say "party" because this group eats and runs.  Luckily, we were at a separate table with two couples who stayed a while, so it was a pleasant experience. This year's buffet was at French Market at Orleans.  I was dragged, kicking and screaming.  I'm not a fan of buffets unless they're 5 Star Yelp quality, otherwise why bother?  I don't particularly like stuffing my face just because the food's there.  

We went on Friday night, which is Seafood night.  I like seafood, but don't love it, so right there my review has to lose a star - or two.  I waited patiently by the crab legs while the Great Unfed loaded up their plates to overflowing, then took my two crab legs.  I promptly gave myself a deep puncture wound trying to wrestle the crabmeat out of the shell.  I DON'T LIKE TO WORK FOR MY FOOD!!  I was happy to discover that the crab wasn't as briny as the last time I tried it, but it wasn't full of flavor, either.  I don't do oysters, so I skipped that part, and the peel-it shrimp wasn't anything to write home about.  I did like the baked salmon and the osso bucco.

The desserts were typical - looked great, tasted not so, except for one chocolate-covered thingy that had a decent chocolate mousse inside.  And the soft-serve ice cream is ice cream, not froyo at some other buffets.  That was pretty good.  I don't like pie, but I'll give this buffet a 3 .1415.

I really liked this buffet inside the Orleans Casino. I like that they have a huge variety, large seating, good prices, and good schedule. Next time we're there I want to try their Sunday Brunch. So if you're staying at the Orleans, the Buffet is a MUST.

Me , my cousin and sister in law came here to eat brunch during the brief time I was able to pull them away from the strip. The buffet was like all the others with an Asian, Barbecue, Italian and dessert station. Some of the things that stood out was at their salad bar they served grilled veggies. They had asparagus and grilled zucchini. The taste was nice and sweet. 

They also serve southern food like grits , and Jambalaya. I tried the grits because I remember liking them so much when I ate some at Rosemary's restaurant but it wasn't quite the same. I did have fried scallops and mini crab cakes which were really good with a spritz of lemon. I also had chicken fried steak but it tasted plain to me because I usually eat it with a side of honey mustard. It's different ... but it tastes good! Unfortunately they had no honey mustard salad dressing. 

My second plate I thought I 'd try their chocolate waffles. If you like soft waffles don't eat these they had the consistency of toast. I also grabbed some scallop mixture they had cradled in a shell it's not as tasty as the ones at Asia buffet. I would pass these up.I also tried a cheese blintze but I could only take a bite the cheese inside was all crumbly. 

My dessert plate was my favorite because they had this almond crumb cake that had drizzled raspberry sauce in it. They used to serve this at Red Rock casino but I haven't seen it there in a while. It was so good with tea,. They also had Tiramisu cups which were really tasty the cake part wasn't too wet it was just right! 

The most amazing part of the meal was my cousin saying this was her favorite Las Vegas Buffet . I wasn't sure I heard her right but she said this was by far her favorite. I was like ...uh okay. I'm just happy she liked it so it was a win..win situation!

For $13.99 is OK for a buffet. The food was decent but everything tasted too salty even the fried catfish(?). The best part of this buffet is the crawfish. You can get a huge plate of them unlike some other buffets. A pound or two of them is worth the price. Service was slow but we ordered extra drinks early and they accommodated that with out trouble.

We ended up at the Medley Buffet inside The Orleans because we were uninterested in the food court options they had. We had been here several years ago, and were not particularly amazed with the food-and even had a sushi food poisoning incident. However, with the recent remodel of the buffet, it seems they have really improved!The selection isn't huge, but is still pretty decent, so you are sure to find something you'll enjoy. 

It was really refreshing to see that hey had completely renovated the buffet, from the decor, the flooring, the chandeliers, everything appeared clean and looked beautiful! When we were here a couple years ago, the decor was very dated but we were happy to see that the place had really opened up, was bright, and overall a major improvement from our last visit. 

We had no problems with the service, all of the waiters were extremely friendly, and we were checked on numerous times. Our waiters were quick to bring us refills and clear plates off our table. She also made me custom iced coffee (not on the menu!) which was so nice of her.  

The food quality-having been to numerous AYCE buffets in Vegas has really improved since our visit years back. On this particular visit this past weekend, there were two standout dishes for me: the pesto tortellini, and the al pastor tacos! Pesto tortellini is one of my all time favorite Italian dishes, so to see it as one of the dishes in the Italian section was a big surprise, and it did not disappoint! The pasta was creamy, the cheese-stuffed tortellini was sooo delicious, and the pesto was not overwhelming, and tasted fresh! The al pastor tacos were such a pleasant surprise!! We are Southern California natives so everyone in my party was super excited, and they were DELICIOUS. The quality of meat was fantastic, and the salsa gave an amazing kick. We also saw the al pastor being cooked traditionally on the stick, and carved fresh-so amazing! They also renovated their dessert bar, and I'm so happy that they added gelato- my AYCE Vegas buffet trips are not complete without it! 

So happy with the remodel and improvements! I would recommend this buffet to anyone as they are really beginning to stack up to the higher end buffets located on the strip. Their selection is smaller but very unique. Very happy with the service and left very satisfied!

I will make sure to never return to this buffet again. After the way our group was treated by Nickey I was disgusted. She was very rude and came off argumentative from the beginning. Hopefully someone from management will see this and help her to change her attitude.
One of the better buffets in Vegas. Price is very good. Sign up for there rewards card and save money. They also send coupons in the mail.

employees are always nice, but went last week on a Saturday brunch (not thinking) and it was 17$ a person even with our members card, there was nothing special about the food, nothing new, same stuff, same taste as going on a wed. afternoon and paying less. way overpriced sat

Our first time back since they remodeled the buffet. Don't believe any poor reviews this place is fabulous. The food was great and their are so many choices. The facility is new fresh and sleek. 
The shrimp was excellent as was the prime rib and New York strip steak. They had craw fish which every one loved. So many choices you can't go wrong. 
The desert area was great. Ice cream ,sherbet and gelato. Cakes pies cookies and more. The staff is excellent but get their early because the line is long

The remodel is the best thing to happen to this place. Since the remodel the place has looked more modern. The food has followed with the remodel with the quality of food going up. The food is now superior quality then other Vegas buffers around the same price. I would highly recommend this Medley Buffet.

Hubby and I have visited this buffet twice now in the past few days. Once for lunch and once for dinner (the Tuesday night Pig Roast). Both buffets seemed to have the exact same selection except for adding the pig roast for dinner. I believe lunch was $9.99 and dinner was just a few dollars more. But if you get a rewards card, you get. Couple bucks off. I feel the quality and selection were pretty great for the price! I particularly enjoyed the taco station where I could load up on guac and sour cream. Hubby seemed to really enjoy all the Asian food. And mom loved the selection of ice cream - both soft serve and scooped were available with a bunch of fun toppings. 

Service on both visits were pleasant and attentive. I know we'll be back!

I had never been to the Orleans.  But my parents were in town and I agreed to meet them out in Vegas for Christmas.  Since they were staying there, we thought it would be great to try a different buffet.  They usually stay at the California and we always eat at the Main Street Station buffet.  The French Market is good...very good.

What I really like is the variety!  I tried a little of almost everything, but of the stuff that I like.  Yes, I managed to do three plates and a couple desserts.  The staff is very friendly which is great!  The woman who took care of us even joked around with me.

She: I forgot your mom's tea bags...they are on my station, can you go and get them?
Me: Oh, okay...(as I start getting up)
She: I'm just playing....I'll be right back

I was actually going to go and get them!

I wouldn't say that this buffet just knocked me off my feet (I have yet to find that one), but the food offerings are fresh, tasty, and plentiful.  I would definitely eat here again!

Came here at 9am for the breakfast buffet on a Monday morning. The line looked long but it moved very fast.

The buffet has all the breakfast basics: eggs, bacon, sausage, etc. The price was fair at $8.99, but you get a discount depending on level of players card.

Highlights: 
1) The Omelet guy- he was making five at a time. There was hardly any wait time. In addition, the ingredients are laid out like a Mongolian BBQ station. I liked being able to choose how meaty I wanted my omelet. I piled up bacon, sausage, mushrooms, spinach, and had him top it with jack cheese. 

2) One of the trays had spam. Being Asian, this was a plus for me since I had it with fried rice.

Minus one star because the server took a while for the drinks and rarely checked on us. Other than that, it was a great value for the price.

Whoever says this place has good food has obviously had their taste buds surgically removed or ones that are accustomed to the creations Chef Boyardee and Hot Pockets. 

Your options are:

*Pasta 
*Mexican (The guacamole is made from a powdered mix)
*USA (Proof that Americans don't eat anything original)
*Chinese (Hello, MSG)
*Salad Bar (Wilted lettuce leaves and sopping mayo bean/pasta salads)
*Seafood (Cocktail shrimp, crawfish, and tuna doused in cream sauce)
*Carcass (All the dried up meat carcass you desire)
*Diabetes (All the "ice cream" you want, and grocery store cakes you can shove down)
*Slops 

Our server was incredibly sweet despite his sh*thole occupation of hauling away plates of half-eaten "food" and was prompt in delivering drinks.  But honestly, you're better off people-watching here than actually consuming anything.

The ratio of walkers to wheelchairs here is rather high.  That's not say that I'm against either.  Just that, I felt as if I was visiting my grandparents in their assisted-living home's restaurant.  

The lasagna tasted like the best Chef Boy-Ar-Dee's I've ever had.  

The cheese enchiladas were great until you tried the second one and realized that it's almost all sauce and the enchilada themselves have no true shape.  Rather, it's just a coagulated gelatinous glob of cheese and something that tries to be a sauce of some sort.  

The shrimp are small and have all of their little shrimp feet intact.  If you enjoy using your napkin to often wipe the taste of the sad misery of the ocean floor off your fingers, this place is for you.

The top portion of the bread pudding tastes like bread pudding.  About a half inch down, though, it turns to jelly.  Jelly fused with a raisin or two.  Be sure to add lots of the vanilla sauce to mask the true flavor of this delicacy.

All of this for nearly $40.  

Next time, I'll just skip a meal and weep quietly in darkness - that actually sounds like it might leave a better taste in my mouth.

I don't typically do buffets...but this one did it right!!! Everything was prepared well with quality ingredients. The service was fast and friendly.  The price was nominal for what you got..I think it it was like $13 for dinner...I would DEFINITELY go back if I wasn't sure what I was craving and needed a quick bite to eat!

Breakfast food is my fav, and I come here for it. They have all the fixins and more. Never had a problem or bad food when I came here. It's a nice little local spot. $6 for all u can eat breakfast with players card. I'd come here every morning if I could.

Food was mediocre at best. No way I'd ever go here to spend $45 on my wife and I again. I'd sooner go to Golden Corral or just about any other restaurant in Las Vegas. The fried chicken was dry and difficult to chew. The best desert was the ice cream, although the lady behind the counter was pretty rude. Their saving grace was that their steak was cooked pretty well but was bland and they had no A1 and the sauces they did have were disgusting. Especially their honey bourbon barbecue sauce tasted like it was 90% alcohol. I'm not usually a picky person but if I'm going to spend $22.50 a person the food has to be better than that.

Lunch was $10.99 and includes a beverage. After 3:00 they start packing up the food and my waitress was busy cleaning and stopped bringing drinks, so it's best to get there before 2:00. The food was great, the price was alright.

This buffet has great ambiance and friendly staff and server! Came in for lunch.

Food are organized by category ( BBQ, Italian, Asian, American, TexMex, Desserts, and Pastries)

Breakdown for each category:

BBQ: their cornbread and hushpuppies were really delicious! Their collard greens were too salty for me to enjoy.

Asian: They served wonton chips, Pork buns (has a soft bread and right amount of pork filling), sesame balls (little hard but the purple filling taste like any other sesame ball), Tofu (love the sauce!), and brocolli stir fry.

Italian: must try the cheese raviolli! (Especially the sauce!! Load up on it!), the pizzas were average, the alfredo was creamy and just right!

American: had baked yams, baked potatoes, waffles, chicken among others. Didnt get try this section.

Texmex: they served taquitos, tacos (which you can customize!), posoles (yum!!), and their rice has exactly the right amount of flavor! Not salty but very flavorful! 

Desserts & Pastries: had many different pies such as coconut creme pie with coconut shavings on top, blueberry pie (it tastes okay, not sweet which I prefer!), and lemon pie among others. They also served donuts, donut holes, danish (had a black filling--not sure what it was but it wasnt the best, it could have used more filling),  creme puffs, mini desserts like chocolate mousse with a graham bottom layer and strawberry mousse), peach and apple cobbler, and this one pudding next to the cobbler that taste very delicious, its mushy but really good!  Had different flavors of ice creams too! Not just the typical vanilla, chocolate, and strawberry.

Overall, I loved this place! Finished my meal with s black tea!
Can't make this sh$$ up. What else do I need to say...? Just look at the picture and laugh with me

2.5 is a more appropriate rating.  We haven't visited this buffet in a number of years due to past quality/turnover issues, but we decided to give another try after I won two free buffets.  Most of the buffet employees were dressed in Halloween garb and they seemed to be in a particularly cheery mood.  Also, the buffet was very busy which no doubt had a positive impact on turnover.  I had my usual huevos rancheros, fruit and OJ.  The quality and variety of the food was a notch above those at both the South Point, Sunset Staion, Aliante and Gold Coast on this trip.

This is what my mom and I like to call the budget buffet.

Cheap to chow...and the food is relatively tasty.  

The food isn't of the same quality as let's say the buffet at the MGM, but the price is about half.  The food here isn't as bland and tasteless as many other buffets either.  I would eat here before eating at RIO again!

I am giving it 3 stars for the food and selection, plus a bonus star for the price.
Our server was Chow.  l loved his service if I could give him 10 stars I would  I will be coming back.  His manager was Ana.  Thank you both wonderful job.

Decent prime rib buffet for the price. Food quality is better than some of the other buffets in this price range. The place was very busy around 8 pm on a weeknight. Oddly, I really liked the sushi - shrimp tempura and various CA rolls. And the prime rib was good too. Southern food was good - collard greens, black-eye peas, etc. Salad bar wasn't the best - iceburg lettuce mix and not many toppers. Large variety of desserts but none were great.  

Server was great - very attentive and friendly.

My only complaint is that the hosts took a long time to seat people and did not prioritize those in the handicap line. And they were not super friendly.

Recent upgrade ( place looks nice ) with usual consequence of price hike and less people. We came because of our 2 for 1 coupon. Great selections for those who love Asian food ( which I do ). Their brisket was tender but the flavor was bland- needs some salt and some spice. Love the omelette station btw. Cashier told us they stopped their seafood night because of lack of guests and our server told us they have been cutting servers hours because of lack of business. Are we coming back? Not without a 2 for 1 coupon. I told our server South Point has the best food out of all our local casinos and only costs $10. I bet if they charge $10-11, they would see more traffic. Not everything is about the ambience, buffet is all about food and price.

I don't honestly see what all the hype is about this place. I went after seeing numerous reviews in the past few weeks about how great this place is, how great the food is, how excellent the service is... 

The best part of the buffet... new york strip steak, onion rings and some beef lasagna. 

Other than that the food was mediocre at best, the desserts were kinda junky tasting and dry, and the service was very slow/rude. Our server was quite ornery and took almost 10 minutes to get steak knives for us after being asked. Never showed up with A1 sauce either. (She told us after the 10 mins and bringing back 1 knife... not 2...that she couldn't find any steak sauce.) 

The guy who was supposed to be carving the chicken/prime rib at the station wandered off for over 5 minutes, and there was quite a few people standing there waiting for service behind me... I was about ready to cut the bloody meat myself for everyone else who was waiting.

So while the three foods I listed earlier were worth 5 stars (The new york steak is only on thursday) the rest of the service and food was only worth 1 or less. 

Tragic...

This place is decent for a buffet, it's your typical buffet. The Aliante Hotel is right around the corner from family. We went here for their Saturday Steak Dinner (the day after xmas) and the next day for their breakfast. 

Saturday was about $18.95 normally or about $15.95 with a players card. One players card works for up to 4 people. Sunday's breakfast was about $8 normally or $5.95 with a players card. You cannot beat the price, but again you aren't paying for anything spectacular. 

Saturday had lots of meat. I don't eat meat, but there were options for me. The best part was their dessert. Delicious bananas foster ice cream and pies. Their mexican station was pretty good, as was their Asian. 

Sunday they had an omelet bar and all the sides. They also had donuts! 

I wouldn't drive out here JUST for the buffet, but if you're local and in the area you can't beat the price or the variety of food.

Was a regular before this up grade?  Now they have it looking more upscale but very limited for handicap access. Most accessible tables are to the far end from the food.  Getting around the tables in wheelchairs is difficult.  The lack of signage means diners wandering around to see what is where.  This must increase the dining time per patron considerably.  The food on my two visits was fair at best. Many items over cooked, dry and hard. A definite step down from the old buffet in all regards. Management was seen to be non receptive to a patrons complaint I observed and was borderline rude to her.  The upside is the table servers who really have to hustle.

Yikes! The Orleans Casino and Boyd spent 4.5 million dollars completely renovating the buffet, changing the name, layout and everything. I was super excited when I got a coupon for 2 free buffets and couldn't wait to give their new buffet a try.

Lets just say I'm glad I didn't pay for this. 

On my first plate I tried their cheese enchilada (because how in the heck can you mess that up), rice and a few pieces of sushi. The sushi was inedible, falling apart, dry and fishy. The enchilada was over-cooked, falling apart and to say it was salty would be understating the salinity of this abomination. The rice, surprisingly crunchy.

I had literally one bite of everything and ditched the plate. I thought for sure our server was going to kick me out or something for throwing out an entire plate of food, but thankfully he didn't say anything.

Round 2: I tried the steak, a salad, some chow mein, and cheese ravioli with marinara. 

So I ended up eating the salad for dinner (the rest was inedible). 

Dessert was bland. Also, like every other casino in Vegas, they have those cute little desserts in the clear cups, and small tarts.... unlike other casinos, they put these tarts behind glass and you have to ask for the ones you want. So weird... you just know they're going to shame you if you ask to try 3 or 4 different tarts.

One guy reviewed the Aliante's buffet and said that if you wanted to know what the color beige tastes like you should eat there. EXACTLY! If you want to know what the color beige tastes like-- this is your jam. I would have been really upset had I actually paid the $43 for 2 buffets. 

Pros: The place is gorgeous, new, and modern.
Cons: The food is terrible.

Instead of charging you based upon a child's age, they charge you based upon a child's height (42 inches and under are free).  Join the "B Connected" club and save $2.00 on your meal.  Ok, on to the review:

This place is great!  I dined with my wife and two children here for breakfast.  They have all the standard stuff: eggs, bacon, hash browns, pancakes, waffles, etc.  The cool thing is they have two omelette bars, which really helps the lines move, and ensures you get one, if you really want one. 

The Mexican breakfast section was REALLY good.  I could eat the Chile Verde all day (which is probably why they put a two hour time limit on buffet purchases).

The wait staff was very courteous.  You don't get drinks at a drink station or anything, they bring you all the drinks you want/need.

By booking a room at the Orleans, I got a $20 dining credit, which I used to pay for our group's breakfast.  Since one of my children was under 42 inches, and by joining the "B Connected" club, I only paid a few bucks for our breakfast!!!!!  This brought back memories of the "old days", when buffets were SUPER cheap in this town.

Went during lunch time. Wait was long to pay, and then another long wait to be seated. Food was average, there are better buffets to choose from if you are willing to pay a couple of extra bucks.  For the price, you get what you pay for.  Waitress was friendly.
Great deal and great food. Especially breakfast. Its not the fanciest place. But i come here everytime i'm in LV.

Went to the newly renovated Medley Buffet November 21, 2017 for lunch. We have been coming here for years and the buffet was renovated very nice, was really impressed. That's the GOOD news, now the BAD news.  The food didn't meet our expectations from past years.  My friend got food poisoning eating the spoiled shrimp cocktail and was sick for five days, it messed up our entire trip. He was the only one in our party that ate shrimp and I remember him commenting the shrimp wasn't firm and was soft. Hope they get their act together and improve on their food preparation and their menu.
The buffet has plenty of choices and options of food to choose from. Me and my son come here almost every week. The waitress and waiters are very nice and helpful.

Looking through yelp someone posted a picture of the prices which is not current. Today we went for brunch and with the B connected card it's actually $16.99 instead of $13.99. Regular price is 21.99. The b connected card applies for 2 guests so since there were 3 of us 2 of us ate for $16.99 and the third person was $21.99.
Asked for a high chair for my toddler (didn't have to pay for) they brought a highchair that was filthy with old food glued to it. So disgusting. Requested another highchair which was clean.
Food: was OK I was disappointed but my husband enjoyed it.  A lot of variety especially in the desserts section it was overwhelming but out of the 4 desserts that we sampled the pecan bar was the best. Overall food lacked flavor not worth the $ go elsewhere.

The new remodel is absolutely stunning! The whole feel of the buffet is completely different. You feel as if you are in a hotel on the strip. The decor is absolutely beautiful and the colors that were chose were perfect. The food was organized perfectly as someone would order a meal. Salads,deli meat, cubes cheeses , fruit and bread all beautifully arranged in the far left corner with the food selection flowing into American BBQ,Chinese,Italian ect. The food was excellent. I usually don't eat everything I get on my plate from buffets as it's mostly trial and error but I finished everything I chose. The prime rib was cooked perfectly and was no where near dry. The pasta station was incredible. The El Pastor tacos were to die for. Dessert was was good, the normal ice cream and pies. The service was outstanding! Our server was very polite and our drinks were never empty. Out plates were taken as soon as we finished. I have to say I really enjoyed the new atmosphere and attitude that the entire place gives off. We will be visiting again soon :)

The food is  good but average. Nothing that separates from the other station casinos making the price a little too much. Seating is a bit unorganized as well. I think the communication needed is a bit over bearing at high volume times.
Came here on January 15 for Sunday brunch with my family. Good price for all you can eat &my parents enjoyed drinking champagne with their meal. Definitely will come back worth the money.

I would say FMB is in between  3.5 - 4 stars ~ 
We came here on a Sunday after much debate on what we wanted to eat and decided a buffet was perfect for a couple indecisive minds haha The price was $12.99 (with a player's card) for Sunday brunch which includes AYCD champagne~ The line moved super fast so we were happy about that and we both agreed that the food quality had improved from the last time we were here.. 
I really enjoyed the crawfish, prime rib, salmon filet, hot & sour soup, smoked salmon & cheese cubes.. My man couldn't get enough of the mustard hush puppy crab cakes things HAHA 

The server was nice & let us know she was leaving. She also made sure we had all the drinks we needed before she left! 
Nothing fancy here but you really can't beat the price and the food was actually good! 


HOT TIP: Get a Player's Card!!! Price with * is with a Player's Card discount ;]]] 

_Monday-Thursday
Breakfast: 8:00am-10:00am  $6.99* ($7.99)  
Lunch: 11:00am-3:00pm       $7.99* ($8.99)  
Dinner: 4:00pm-9:00pm * Featuring Prime Rib & Shrimp Scampi $12.99*($15.99)  
_Friday
Breakfast: 8:00am-10:00am  $6.99* ($7.99)  
Lunch: 11:00am-3:00pm       $7.99* ($8.99)  
Dinner: 4:00pm-9:00pm * Featuring Prime Rib & Snow Crab   $15.99* ($20.99)  
_Saturday
Breakfast: 8:00am-10:00am * Featuring Champagne  $7.99* ($8.99)  
Lunch: 11:00am-3:00pm * Featuring Champagne       $8.99* ($9.99)  
Dinner: 4:00pm-9:00pm * Featuring Prime Rib & Snow Crab  $15.99* ($20.99)  
_Sunday
Brunch: 8:00am-3:00pm * Featuring Champagne  $11.99* ($13.99)  
Dinner: 4:00pm-9:00pm * Featuring Prime Rib & Shrimp Scampi  $12.99* ($15.99)

The food was passable, but nothing extraordinary.  The salad bar is small, the selections at the other themed areas are strange... like why are there BBQ ribs on the Asian section when there are already 2 different kinds of ribs at the BBQ section, and look over here at the USA section... more ribs.  Ilike ribs well enough, but I was almost afraid to go to the Italian section for fear of seeing BBQ Rib Pizza.

The dessert bar is okay.  None of the pastries were phenomenal, the cheesecake was heavy and not at all creamy, and the blueberry topping on it had the consistency of drywall spackle.

Our drink-getter was pretty awesome, though.  She did a great job.

The best thing I can say about this buffet is that the lines are short and it's better than the buffet at a lot of the hotels on the strip, expecially those at the castle and pyramid... names omitted to keep from hurting King Arthur's and Pharaoh's feelings.

Comfort food buffet at it's best along with super nice people working there.  It's a smaller buffet compared to those on the strip, but they had enough choices to make it worthwhile.  The price point is perfect.  

One fun item they had for lunch was hamburgers and hotdogs!  What a fun addition!  They also still have gelato, which is rare as so many buffet's went with the less expensive soft serve.

You definitely get your money's worth here. It's clean, spacious, and there are a lot of great offerings. We were there for breakfast, and there was an omelette station, waffles, fresh fruits, blintzes, traditional breakfast meats, and also a mexican station. 

I think all the Boyd properties have some great buffets, but this one is hands down a favorite. Definitely worth a short drive from the strip.

For an off the strip buffet that only does breakfast & lunch I'd say it's good value for the money. The offerings are certainly less diverse than at other buffets in town, but what do you expect for $12. The staff was friendly and my water glass stayed mostly full. What higher praise could be given.

Come on a Thursday to try their dinner buffet, they have a huge dessert island, all different kinds of ice cream, cakes and pies, the food is pretty basic, has Italian, which has pasta and pizza, chinese has spring roll, chow fun, fried rice, american has fried chicken, ham, pork spareribs, slider, mexican has tacos, enchiladas, seafood has fried cat fish, crawdad, fried tilapia, the mongolian section, you can cook your choice of food and vegetables on a hot iron griddle, and for the meat lovers, they have roast beef and smoke spareribs, and don't forget to get the shrimp cocktail from the salute bar too....service is on par, the place is huge, so it is pretty roomy, you won't feel it is too crowded....overall it is okay, nothing special, for the price, it is a lot better than the strip casino buffet..

When I first arrived I was excited to see a long line to get in for breakfast. I  came here with a Meet up Group  of around nine of us for Thursday morning breakfast. It was my first time here. My friends had been last week and stated they had some issues but were going to give it another try.
When I sat down The staff was terrible about getting our drink orders . They weren't friendly at all about Refills. I was really surprised because my experience since being in Vegas has been pretty friendly service.

The food was not cooked well at all. The Scrambled eggs looked RAW and the Sausage was burnt. The eggs benedict wasn't appealing at all.

Overall they had decent variety but bad quality service and very poor quality food. For the money its not a BAD breakfast if you're staying at the hotel but I wouldn't go out of my way to come here for food otherwise.

Disgusting food and LOUD!!! Went to this dump on a Saturday at Noon. The chicken was dry, the salad was crappy looking...cheap iceberg crap, The beef ribs had no meat on them, the roast beef was juicy but was like chewing leather... I could only eat 2 bites. Some of the trays containing meats were empty. Without a doubt the crappiest buffet experience I have ever endured. What a joke..... you mean to tell me that on a Saturday, you can't supply fresh food when there's literally 200 plus people eating? You can't afford to put some romaine lettuce into the salad choice? What's sad is this poop hole is owned by Boyd gaming and they run the Suncoast Casino buffet which is decent. I will NEVER be back to this crap joint again.......What a waste of $20 for 2. Should have gone to the Texas station for a buffet.

I'm not a fan of buffets. Trays of food being 'tampered' with freaks me out! I haven't been to a buffet in ages -- at least not the last 3 times we've been to Vegas, but this time, I had a craving for peel and eat shrimp. I don't eat much else at a buffet, so I said let's go to the Orleans for their buffet since it's really cheap and I know they have peel and eat shrimp.

OK so the pricing was super cheap -- it's $7.49 for lunch -- and it includes non-alcoholic beverages. There were the usual bbq stuff, Mexican stuff, Chinese stuff, Italian stuff, and an attempt at Mongolian bbq, which was rather dismal. 

I had about a pound and of a half of shrimp, a few slivers of bacon, 3 corn on the cob, a swirl of vanilla ice cream with crushed peanuts, 3 glasses of iced tea and I was done. I remembered last time they had these fantastic cookies, but there wasn't a cookie in sight. On top of that they have added a gelato station, but all the desserts were handed out, you couldn't help yourself to them.

For me, this buffet suffices because I don't really eat much at a buffet. Usually, I'll eat peel and eat shrimp, smoked salmon or trout, and lamb chops if they have them. What's the point of paying 20 bucks when that's all I eat? 

The buffet at the Orleans is fine by me. It has the shrimp, and I'm happy to pay $7.50 for it! I must say I remember there to be more selections so I have to deduct a star for this visit. However, I didn't feel ripped off and I was content when I stood up to leave.

PS: If you are my kind of buffet eater -- check out my review of the buffet at Palace Station -- I thought it was better than this one and for almost the same price!

Came here at the suggestion of a friend for AYCE crawfish... secretly I'm a crawfish junky and after learning about this place, I don't think I'll ever go back to the Hot N' Juicy or Boiling Crab ever again!

The downside to it being a buffet is that they have to cater to the masses, so definitely no extra garlicky or extra spicy options available. However, find a willing cook and give them a tip and I'm sure you can get it flavored how you'd like. 

Their crawfish looks like it was on steroids with how big they were and I had to stop after 3 huge piled high plates of just crawfish alone! My friends and I were THOSE people that would basically pile up a lot of crawfish on our plates to the point where other people behind is would give us the stink eye... excuse it, it's an AYCE, don't get your knickers in a twist, they will replenish it haha. I even had to give my friends the side eye and sh1t talking at the table because they emptied out the pan when they went before me haha.

Their barbecue station was amazing. The pork and beef ribs were fall of the bone tender. 

Their made to order crepes were decent. I mean, yes they don't have the crepe pan to ensure it's a thin crepe, but the filling of fresh pineapple and blueberries made up for it.  Here's a tip: Tip your cooks who do a made to order anything in a buffet. Even a $1 is better than nothing. They were down to the last 2 crepes and the cook serviced me first because he knew I tipped him over the other person who was plain rude and didn't give them anything. It's kind of an unspoken rule seeing as you know, they're serving you something fresh and not just something in a pan that's been sitting in their warmer in the back. 

Seeing as this trip was all about the crawfish, I didn't really try anything else. That'll be for the next visit. But definitely one of the better buffets in town that's off the strip.

my favorite buffet in  the city. i use to go all the time on saturday night when it was steak and shrimp scampi night. make sure you get the players card. it cost around 17. well worth it the food is amazing and the selection is just great.

The Medley buffet inside the Aliante Casino has got to be one of my favorite locals buffets. The prices are reasonable, the service has always been really good and friendly, and the food is good! 

I had dinner on a Sunday night and there were many good choices, I would have liked to see beef ribs instead of pork but never the less a good selection. 

Don't expect to see gourmet, but do expect to have a good dinner at a reasonable price, and very clean buffet.

I have been here 10+ times. The restaurant is located inside the Orleans casino that is a smoking lounge.

Cheap buffet, average quality. Large selection. There is no item at this joint that makes me crave for. I came here just to load up on fiber and protein between business dealings. 

Service is always good. Discounts for members of Boyd gaming.

One of the best value buffets in Vegas!

Not on the strip, so it's not so crowded, and I've eaten here twice without ever having to wait in line.

Good variety too - for lunch and dinner, they categorize the food: USA, Italian, Chinese, Mexican, Seafood, Mongolian, BBQ, and a huge dessert section in the middle.

A lot of the food is pretty decent, though I didn't think the ribs were that great. The shrimp cocktails were fresh, and I liked the Mexican and Seafood sections the most.

The dessert section also had no-sugar desserts!

Super cheap, we came here for lunch on a Friday and it was only $10/person, without any kind of membership or anything.

It's not the Bellagio or anything but French Market Buffet at the Orleans offers great value in terms of quality and variety!

Don't come here until they are done with renovations! Currently the buffet is located in a temporary location until renovations are complete. The selection is much smaller & not quality food. Normally this is a great spot, but not right now

5 stars for:  price (amazingly low), selection (even french fries, which are rare for buffets!), and quality foods.  Both times we've been here, waitstaff has been below par, but we didn't seem to mind.  Seriously, with a player's card, the price for lunch was $9.99 a person.  For a local's casino, thus buffet blew away Red Rock and Suncoasts.
Boy do you get your money's worth here. Great pricing and service gets you seated quickly. And the seafood buffet rivals those on the strip but at half the cost. A great hidden gem in Las Vegas.

Can never go wrong at this off the strip buffet. Great price. Food is actually pretty good and tasty. Wok Wednesday are so good!!  Haven't tried the Hawaiian pork night yet, but I'm sure it's not bad. We went there for thanksgiving, Mother's Day and steak/shrimp night with a bunch of people and was great tasting. Kids enjoyed!

Pretty decent food I mean I went for lunch buffet and had some discount coupons so got it all for a five spot. Can't beat that I am sure it was the same food offered on their dinner menu but just at the reduced rate. I sure was hungry the day I was here too. I put away some food and kept smiling. I liked the BBQ ribs here, Prime Rib and fried shrimp.

I've been here now for breakfast and for lunch, and I gotta admit, they were pretty good.  Not every item was great or anything, but over all I definitely enjoyed both meals. This place is DEFINITELY better then suncoast buffet. That place went down hill YEARS ago and is gross.

I will definitely be back to this place and just fyi, not only did this buffet have a crowd of people, so did the casino area too.  So people are comin here for a reason. ;-)

Great place to eat for breakfast, lunch, & dinner buffet. Close to home too! Plus the service is good. Simple choices for that buffet fix. After the buffet I hit up the slot machines & win that big money yadada?! Lol...

While waiting to watch a transformers 3, me and my fiancee was hit by a hungry monster. So we decided to take the later show and fill our tummy with some monster food. 

The wait wasnt that long and they have some special for $13 perperson at 4 pm everyday except wednesday and friday I guess. All and all the food was considerably yummy although I only like a very few items. 

Service are ok and I dont even bother to get myself a second serving. A-ok for moi!

Eating here will make you sick.  I eat here once a month and I always eat so much food I leave feeling sick, but still have a gelato cone in my hand.
The food is good, the just changed the price structure so breakfast and lunch are $1 more and dinner is $1 less.  I usually only go here because I have free offers or 2 for 1.  The dinner is now $22 on Friday for crab night, so even with a 2-1 is more expensive then many dinners you can get.  You will always leave full, but you will also get full at a stations at half the price.

Medley (formerly Feast Buffet) gets a 4 because of these top 5 reasons:

1. Lunch is a measly $10.99 with players card
2. Automatic gratuity is a modest 10% for large parties (up it to 20% 'cause the server was great)
3. Service is very good (refills on drinks came without asking)
4. Food selection is decent and food quality is good.
5. NO WAIT!


Carving station featured roast beef, ham and roasted turkey.  The roast beef and ham were tender and juicy and better than I expected. 

Salad selection: 3 types of salad (spinach, ice berg lettuce, mixed greens.  No honey mustard dressing - if that is your favorite, sorry not available. 

Dessert station was average although I did like the better than average gelato bar flavors. 

The layout is very similar to Red Rock.  Iced tea is brewed.  In general it's a good value for some comfort food.

Good food. Good service. And reasonable price.

Nancy was a great server. Didnt bug too much but got us what we needed. Their meat selection is great. And for dessert I had some ice cream. Love their pistachio one. 

Also if you have the players card, you get a dollar off. We checked what promotion they had going on with the players card on their kiosk..and got a 2 for 1 entry.

Wife and I in Las Vegas for several days and  the Medley buffet at Aliante was one of the best values.  Good food at reasonable prices, just sign up for players card to get discounted price.  As comparison.the buffet at Red Rock sucked and buffet at Planet Hollywood was twice the cost and not as good so Medley is good value.

This is a little pricey but when you have 2 for 1 it not that bad. But the food is worth the price it is great!! Love it!!! We went yesterday 1st time we been since they re-did it, and we WILL be back it was simply great!!! Love the selections of food and the taste was great!!!!!

First time trying out this buffet at New Orleans Casino. Coming here on friday night for seafood buffet. This is surprisingly good and beyond my expectation. It is inexpensive as well for $27.99 per person. A lot of crab legs from both areas for hot and cold. They got the raw oysters, shrimps, big mussels, whole fish, prime rib and full rack of beef short ribs. Love the beef short ribs. It was so juicy and so good.
Absolutely a very good quality of foods. I'll definitely be back next time soon whenever I were in Vegas.

Buffets in Vegas are pricey on the strip and I get it. This one is close to home and still satisfies. 

Tuesdays, Fridays or Saturdays are our favorite days to go. On Tuesday, they actually roast whole pigs for Hawaiian night and T loves crispy pata! The chefs cut up perfectly sized squares for you to pick from. There is all purpose sauce for dipping too. And I know it must be pretty legit because it gets packed and the line gets long real quick. So take note and allow yourself to have an early dinner, then go walk it off around Discovery Park.

Friday and Saturday is prime rib and seafood night aka crab legs aka me trying not to panic the entire time in fear for our son's life (shellfish allergy). These are not my favorite nights because of the aforementioned, but he has never had any problems here which is a testament to how clean they keep it. The oysters are never good, the sushi is so-so, but the crab legs are real decent as is their prime rib. I only get the prime rib when they have the real horseradish and not the creamy one. They've only been out once though. Not bad out of the dozens of times we've been before.

In addition to the main attractions, they have great BBQ (I'm a fan of the ribs), roast turkey and a very nice salad bar area. Chicken fingers, hot dogs, fries and burgers are found over by the BBQ and are always good (according to the fry/hot dog/burger critic). Oddly enough, their pozole is very good as well. I don't partake in the desserts here because there is nothing to accommodate me accept for fruit, and that's always fresh, but they have a fairly wide selection of ice cream/toppings, cookies, cakes and pies. They even had a sugar free section.

I appreciate there is such a decent buffet a few minutes away from my house and that it's very reasonably priced. Don't forget your players card and monthly coupons for Buy 1 get 1 free!!

In a word...edible. Since Stations left...it's gone downhill. Even so, still light years better than Cannery on Craig Rd...which is HORRIBLE!! We're really lacking any really good places to eat in the Northwest part of town!

Came here during Mother's day.  Cost was about $19-20.  They served Mexican, Chinese, sushi, dessert (cake and ice cream), breakfast, salad/veggies, and seafood.  Drinks served were soda, coffee, and champagne.  Overall, the food was just okay.

Great buffet especially for the price! We went to breakfast buffet for $7.99 with club card. OJ was good and great omelet bar. Several folks making omelets. We will be back! Short breakfast hours though M- Saturday (8-10am)

Breakfast buffet costs only $8.99 per person with a Players' Club card.  Including drink, this is a deal!
