The food tastes good and there is plenty of variety:  omelettes, chocolate waffles, doughnuts, cereal, fruit, sausage, and much more.  If you come near the end of breakfast hours you can get the best of both worlds when they switch to lunch fare, including seafood, BBQ, Mongolian, and more.  My friends also loved the AYCE seafood dinner buffet -- the cost is a little bit more, maybe $15, but they quickly ate more than that in crab legs, mussels, clams, and shrimp.

Come early in the morning to avoid any lines.  This represents superior value compared to the Courtyard Cafe, which is also in the Orleans, though that Cafe is 24 hours.  There an entree plus drink could easily cost you $12 or more.

This is our go-to buffet for a seafood crab night where we don't end up paying an arm and a leg.  Its not a high end strip buffet but its decent for the price.  Every Fridays between 4pm-9pm you're looking at spending 28.99 per person.  Go early because the line can get really long.  We went at 8pm and still waited 30 minutes before we got seated.  

If you're like us and you love crab, you have two options here, steam and frozen.  You can also ask them to stir fry the crab at the Mongolian station in a yummy asian blend sauce.  Also, the oysters are awesome.  Especially if you can get them right when they first bring out a new bucket.  Freshness!

The buffet is split up into sections, Mexican, Chinese, Italian, Salad Bar, Seafood, small Hawaiian/Japanese section, and of course dessert.  One thing I can not get over is their fondue station.  Ladies and gentlemen there is a chocolate fountain.  Yes, I just said it.  Running waterfall of chocolate with a spread of marshmallows, pineapple, bread, strawberries, and a few other items you can submerge into the brown gooeyness.  Awesome goodness.

It's better than ever now that they renovated 
Food is way better and tastier 
Opens till 8pm
Prices are $20ish depending on the day 
Friday's are steak and ribs night! Super delish 
Sunday's seafood it's a little more on those days 
I always come for the crawfish!! 
Because it's so bombbbbb here 
This is the only place that I know that steams the crawfish without seasoning it and it's the best ever!!! It's so fresh and doesn't smell 

My sissy always make her own sauce for the crawfish and it's our dipping sauce so when we come we strictly come for just the crawfish! 
It's my heaven 

Everything else is pretty yummy! 
This place is very worth it, prices are awesome and food is pretty tasty

I enjoy the food especially on Tuesday nights. The one star is for the ridiculous pricing they have for kids. I understand $9.99 per kid up to a certain age. BUT for them to charge that amount for a 2 year old?! Come on Aliante! That is a pretty absurd price for a toddler.

It's not fair to compare Medley Buffet to the Buffet at Bellagio, the buffet at Wynn or Bacchanal Buffet because this place is pretty cheap for a buffet.

$11.99 for breakfast Mon-Sat
$14.99 for lunch Mon-Sat
$20.99 for dinner Sun-Tues 4 pm-8 pm) and Wed, Thurs & Sat(4 pm-9 pm)

Located at the Orleans Hotel & Casino, The Medley Buffet has create your own omelette station, basic breakfast stations (egg, sausage, bacon, pancake, waffle, etc), Chinese stations, Mexican stations, donuts, ham & sausage station and assorted pastries.

I was excited to see donuts, sweet potato pancake, menudo & beef fried steak.

3 stars!! 

Medley Buffet is almost yummylicious!!

The new buffet name is Medley. For me to consider going back, they need to change their tune.

It seems like everything that was fine with the old buffet, they decided to go with the opposite on the new one.

From the way they get you in there to the fact there's no signs for at least half the items to the bland food, this is an utter disaster.

I hope they can get their act together soon because there'll be no one coming back if they keep this up.

This place is AWESOME! The price is right and the quality and variety of food here is great.  They have different stations with different types of food from Italian, Asian, American, to Mexican.  Their desserts are decent.  There was this special where you pay $22 for all day buffet privileges.  I would have done that if I weren't already all burnt out on buffets during my trip to Vegas.  It's a smokin' deal!  If you're staying at the Orleans, take advantage of this hidden gem in your hotel.  It blew away the other buffet I went to on the strip.

Best Price in Las Vegas for lunch Buffet.

I love eating at an all you can eat buffet.

I think this place is very good. I just come here to eat and save some money on my trip to vegas.

They have a wide variety of food to choose from.

They even have mongolian grill.

Is just 1.5 miles off the strip.

The dining area is clean and the staff are friendly.  We visited the location during lunch time which is $12 for adult.  The food overall is okay.  The hamburgers and fries section is standard along with corn on the cob.  The Chinese food section had dumplings, white rice, fried rice, lo mein, Asian ribs, beef with barcoli, and tofu.  The fried rice and lo mein wasn't fresh or hot which was surprising since we just got there when they opened for lunch at 11:00 AM.  They also have an Italian  food section with cheese and pepperoni pizzas, ritoni and traditional spaghetti with either tomato or spicy sausage sauces.  All were hot and very good.  They also had roasted turkey and roast beef wich was freshly cut by a server along with your choice of side dishes, i.e. mac and cheese, mashed potatoes with your choice of gravey, etc.   There is also a Mexican good section to make your own tacos and burritos.  Lastly, there is a vast dessert section which will lure you into a new diet plan.  Overall, everything was good, but they can make improvements.  Food can be kept warmer.  Our server only came once to give us our drinks, but she never came back thus the reason why I didn't leave a tip.

On weekdays a lunch at Medley Buffet is only $8.99. I had a BOGO coupon so lunch for two with drinks came to $9.72 - not too shabby. Unless you come on a night where there is a special dining theme (Hawaiian, Seafood), the available food options are always the same and typical of other Station Casinos. I always find myself hovering over the Italian and Mexican cuisine. For this occasion, I loaded up on Cheese Ravioli with some type of cream based sauce, garlic bread sticks, and a Caesar salad. On my second trip, I tried to do Mexican but was disappointed that they didn't have refried beans (they had black beans instead, but who wants to eat that healthy nonsense?). For dessert, I had two scoops of mint chocolate ice cream. One plus is that at Medley, the ice cream tastes like ice cream and not that gross watered down stuff. 

Bottom Line: the majority of the food is strictly mediocre, but for the price, you can't complain because you get to stuff your face on a dime.

Mediocre. We went to Hawaiian pig night which is Tuesday night. It was later in the evening around 8 (they close at 9) and there was still a good amount of pig left but it was really dry.....the chicken long rice was not chicken long rice. I expected poke but there wasn't any...the spam fried rice was bland...I was disappointed with the offering. Whoever is in charge should be ashamed. This buffet should and could be good maybe need some competition because some of their food prep just looks lazy; the chicken long rice, spinach luau, and the fact that they had the sauce bottles for the pig just laying out their are good examples. The positives were the teriyaki meatballs and the teriyaki pork chops. Who ever is making the teriyaki stuff should get promoted. And of course the desserts were the usual good stuff. Love their pistachio ice cream. 2.5 stars

So, this was once Feast Buffet.  I'm glad there's nothing that really changed though except for the name. As I've written in my Feast Review that I could no longer find, the best time to go is when they serve whatever food you like.  There's seafood night which I'm not too concerned about since I'm allergic to shellfish, and then, there's Lechon Tuesday!

My buddy, Lawrence M was excited when I told him they have lechon. So, off we went!  We weren't sure what time they close so, we felt bad when we got there 3 minutes before they close.  We had a plan B in mind and were ready to march to a different place to eat but they allowed starving gym rats like us to go ahead and stuff our faces.  It really pays to be polite and kind! The hostesses, our server and foo station attendants were nice eventhough we got there so late. So yeah, they close at 9pm.

Dinner for us was only about $12 with military discount on Veterans Day.  Normally, it's about $12/person and you get a discount with a player's card. That's really cheap! I'll say this again, lechon can be expensive because not a lot of places have it. You have to be in-the-know where to get lechon and normally, you have to pre-order it and buy the whole pig for abput $200 depending on the size of the pig. Anthony Bourdain dubs this succulent pig with crispy skin THE BEST PIG he's ever had. So, even if you paid full price for the buffet, you definitely get your money's worth. Get this, they even have Mang Tomas lechon sauce.

They have the typical buffet fare such as prime rib, turkey, BBQ ribs, salads, pizza, pasta, potatoes, veggies, Chinese food, Mexican food, pies, cakes, cookies, ice cream, etc. Since we got there so late, the soft serve was liquid - but I didn't care, I just want the taste. The lady behind the counter kept telling me that it's liquid. But I like ice cream soup. The only thing was the coffee ice cream had ice particles. The other flavor I got was fine. The lady behind the ice cream and pie counter was sweet and funny.

Items on my plates:
Lechon - absolutely great! Skin was crispy - finding crispy skin requires great skill. 5/5

Chicken Fajitas - a bit dry. 2/5

Steamed BBQ Pork Buns - most buffet places that serve these are awful - too doughy, too dry. These were quite good for a buffet place. 4/5

Sesame Balls - they're tinier than the ones you'll find at Chinese restaurants but this isn't a Chinese restaurant. These have red bean inside. 4/5

Fried Plantains - I love fried bananas! Some bananas were soft, some were firmer. I pefer the softer ones as they tend to be sweeter. 4/5

Meatballs - these were pretty good. Either that or I was just very hungry after working out. They're not dry and they're quite tasty. 3.5/5

Prime Rib - juicy, medium-rare slice of beef. Mmmmm...3.5/5

Turkey - I was expecting a very dry piece of turkey because it's closing time and it probably has been sitting under a heating lamp forever. I was pleasantly surprised that it was juicy. 4/5

French Fries - I was so happy to see they have fries. I love fries! Warm, crispy fried potaoes. Add a little bit of salt and I'm happy. 4/5

Kielbasa - I've been good at avoiding cured meats lately but Lawrence gave me his sausage. Since it was already on my plate, I had to try it. Maybe, I'm not used to salt anymore but it was pretty salty. 3/5

This is my favourite buffet in town, it's reasonably priced and has a great selection.....doesn't matter what time of day you come, there's always a big selection with cooking stations cooking to order.  The staff are all good and very attentive

I liked the price and the food wasn't bad either. The salad bar is small in comparison to many other buffets but who goes to a buffet and eats a salad?  Right? 

They have a BBQ area, stir fry and make your own pasta stations, a Mexican food area and pizza and pastas. Oh and then there's dessert. I think they may actually have more dessert than food options. Soft serve, cakes and pies, gelato and sorbets and my dad's favorite: the bread pudding. 

I enjoyed the breakfast buffet with the omelet station and crisp bacon!  

The waitstaff that brought your beverages and took away your dirty plates were really nice and prompt with our drinks. 

I had to minus a star because of the cashiers. On one occasion the cashier was rude and charged us incorrectly even after we told her numerous times how many people were in our party. She was downright sassy commenting on other people being served near us "oh there's another one, must a full mood out tonight".

I usually had a good meal here, but not last night for the prime rib and crab night. The crab was over cooked and the prime rib resembled some sort of dog food that comes out of a can. Not only was this expensive trip a waste of my time, but on top of it, I got food poisoning. I'm not talking about a slight upset stomach either- these are full blown flu-like symptoms. I have a fairly strong stomach, as I have ate bad MREs. Well, this buffet broke the barrier. Will never go back.
Worst buffet I have ever experienced in my life.   Nothing was edible.  Everything was old and dry.   Terrible location.   Prison food is an upgrade, I suggest you try that first.
Garbage!!! Same old crap guys. Don't be fooled in business we call it old lady wearing new dress. Same odor same food and textures.  Unimpressed!!

We'll I was expecting a way better buffet than before with the remodel. A bit disappointed with the food. The buffet looks more modern and better lighting. Only huge change was the look and the price. As expected to pay for the remodel the price has gone up a bit. Used to love buffets proceed under $20 for dinner. I think the new leader in town is the new Palms AYCE buffet. 

The quality of food hasn't changed much compared to before. Ya it's expanded a bit but the only huge change I saw was a crepe station and a pho station which I didn't care for. The only big change I saw was the dessert station which improved a lot with higher end desserts like creme brule. They always had a gelato station. 

My always favorite thing was to go there to eat the BBQ beef ribs which they still serve for dinner only. They also had prime rib but was very low quality of meat and tough. Who would've thought prime rib would be tough. 

The Chinese section was decent the lo mein was good. Now sushi no matter what buffet you go to in Vegas is a must void food. They make it ahead of time and refrigerate it and you can tell the rice isn't made right. Anyways any buffet you go to sushi and pizza are a must avoid period unless you like crap food.

I honestly would only go here if I wanted all you eat beef ribs and gelato. For cheaper price I'd rather go to palms buffet way better quality. Even tho less quantity.

They also has a Al pastor station that looked decent.

The dinner price with players card was $20.57 you saved $2 with card. This is during week day.

we came for champagne brunch. $12.99 with my players card... not too shabby. 

the menu items were diverse and bountiful. i was quite suprised, considering the "classic" stature of the hotel, how fresh and varied the food was. granted it was $3 champagne, it was still a great deal. 

they offered all kinds of different cuisine. mexican, italian, american, asian, a good sized salad/grilled veggie bar and a huge dessert bar. they also had an omelet station. the sections had typical items, enchiladas, pastas, bbq, cornbeef hash, shrimp, mussels, ham, roast beef,, corn on the cob, kung pao beef and most anything you can think of. each section was very well tended and replenished. the areas were clean and all the food looked delicious. the champagne lady came around frequently too. 

for the price and selection, this was an extremely awesome champagne brunch buffet.

The food here is "okay."  Ate here for breakfast and dinner and they definitely carry some items over from one meal to the other.  For example, the breakfast fruit (cantaloupe, honeydew, watermelon) will turn into a fruit salad for the dinner menu.

The menu offerings do not vary day after day.   Shrimp cocktail and crawdads are very popular as people take them by the platefuls back to their seats.  Most of the items I had were slightly warm at best, including the soups. 

There are 2 salad bars that have different toppings and salad dressings.  The soups are the same on both sides though.  

Best part of the meal is the gelato bar for lunch/dinner.  They offer about 8 different varieties including: mango, mint chocolate chip, lemon, raspberry , caramel, white chocolate, vanilla, etc...

Slightly disappointed that this place lacks any FRENCH food.  (French salad dressing doesn't count!)  After all, this is the French Market buffet, a crepe station or hot/fresh benets would be nice.

This was my first Vegas lunch buffet during my trip and it was ok. My aunt had a coupon from the casino of Buy1 Get1Free. It was about $10 for the 2 of us. I thought the layout was gorgeous and huge!! The waitress was attentive, nice, polite, and friendly.

There was a lot of food to choose from like an Southern style to Asian. There is also a nice salad bar in the middle alone. The food tasted ok overall. I tired some waffles and they were dried out. We were here about 11:30am. So I guess it was leftover from breakfast.

The desert bar had a wide variety too. I got pistachio ice-cream. I thought overall this place was and I wouldn't recommend making a drive all the way from the strip. If you are close and want to try it out or the casino, then give it a shot. If not, pass on this to get a better buffet. I'm glad we had the coupon because I wasn't too impress with this place.
They have gotba New York steak, short beef ribs, Chinese duck, little red lobsters, French crepes (on cooking station), roast beef on the regular dinner night which is really worth the price

I'll keep it short. Crawfish (fresh) and Beef Ribs (fall off the bone goodness). YUM! And for less than $10/person for lunch? That's a steal!

oh, and desserts were great too :)

I arrived a minute or two before they opened at 8am on a Saturday and waited about 7 minutes in line which isn't too bad. 

The cost is only $9.99 (11 something with Tax) - which is actually a great price - not all of the food on the breakfast buffet is good but there are some hidden gems 

DOs - bacon - it's extra crispy !
        - tater tots - cannot screw these up!
        - hash browns - crisp not soggy
        - multi-grain waffle w/strawberry sauce
        - pancakes - not super awesome but probably IHOP quality 
       - omelette bar - customize just ask for less oil so it isn't saturated. 

DO NOTS - eggs Benedict - disastrous 
                 - standard eggs - just bad 
            
 Service is very friendly. The person assigned to my table came back frequently to check my coffee and water to see if I needed more and took my plates away. 

Coffee is a go!

I only rank this 3 stars BC I've hit just about every buffet in Vegas and even with the $9.99 cost this one isn't rated up super high... But if you are staying at the Orleans you can get an omelette, waffle, pancakes, hash browns, toast, juice w coffee for around 11 bucks and if you got all that a joint it would cost like $30 so it's more of a bargain spot than one you would enjoy the food a lot!

So they closed it down and remolded. Bringing the buffet up to par with most of the other casino properties.  It has a modern vibe, with muted earthen tones, browns, grays and golds. 

They spread the buffet line from one end to the other without the middle salad bar. One cool feature I really enjoyed was the middle of the line a made to order crepe station with fresh fruit. My husband kicked it a notch and made himself a bowl of ice cream topped off with fresh bananas and banana foster sauce he then added to his crepe! 

The salad end if facing the line is on the left, everything was fresh and the staff kept it that way while we where there. I even saw them change out the rolls with fresh ones! The opposite end is the desserts and the strawberry sorbet was way too good! Cleaned the palate.

There where several soups, it was seafood night so there where two gumbos. Sushi was decent for a buffet. I wasn't a fan of the warm crab legs, they seemed to be a bit over cooked, but I loved the fish taco. The filet was crispy and love the combination slaw with it. There is cold crab legs, oysters, muscles and clams as well as the peel and eat shrimp and crawfish!

It's been improved for sure. Clean, servers keeping up with refills and the line monitored for freshness! Friday night, seafood night. You gotta try it.

Good buffet, some cool Louisiana-inspired options, along with the usual salad bar, meat options and dessert bar. I like the custom crepes, which I had loaded with Nutella and chocolate chips. 

Options a bit on the thin side compared to other buffets (the one at Cosmopolitan being my favorite), but really a first-world problems sort of complaint, as there were plenty of choices I enjoyed.

I dined in on friday night when they were serving seafood night. The selection was great as it had snow crab, dung. crab, crayfishes (huge!), shrimp, & raw oysters. The feasting night gave me food coma but that's when you know they did a good job!. Services was good as our server kept checking in on us and clearing out our plates ASAP. This wouldn't replace my favorite buffet spot at the Bellagio but it's up to par! Will return when in vegas.

BLUF: If you for some reason just absolutely have to go to a buffet, then at least go on a night they have specials.

The service was good, people were very friendly.

The food was mediocre at best. Bland and tough, some of the meat had clearly been sitting under the heat lamps for far too long. The selection was ok, but nothing really unique. It's a buffet, so I didn't expect much and it still was underwhelming.

If you still want to try this place, at least pick a night where they have specials that you like (prime rib, crab legs, pig, something).

This place is awesome! We came here about an hour and a half towards closing (we had no idea) and they didn't rush us to finish up. The buffet line moves swiftly and there's so many options to choose from. They have a salad bar and a dessert bar as well!! The wait staff are efficient in clearing plates and refilling drinks and they're friendly. Believe me, I'm from Hawaii and you'll be amazed at how appreciative I was that the workers were so friendly. Most people don't acknowledge you when you say thank you to them, but they always returned it. 

Anyways, there is a section that's smacked in the middle of the buffet where you can build your own pasta!! They'll cook it right in front of you. It's a mini show and I enjoyed it as much as I loved the pasta!! So fresh. So delicious. Always remember to tip the chef a dollar because trust me, the portion is PLENTY and it's sooo ono. The line gets a bit long, but the chefs move quickly. 

Dessert Bar: you can get ice cream in a bowl. However, if you CANNOT finish your ice cream... you're allowed to ask for a cone for your ice cream and you're ALLOWED to take it out of the restaurant!! How cool is that?! Lol if I wasn't so full, I woulda taken an ice cream cone to-go! Lol they also have so much flavors to choose from. Mix the flavors, you'll be amazed at how yummy some flavors taste, mixed. Haha

The atmosphere of the restaurant is very pleasant. Noise level isn't too loud. We were dressed casually so don't be too concerned about dressing up. Although it is a nice place. So I definitely felt underdressed. Use whatever you feel comfortable wearing. Lastly, just a few stores down, there's a Starbucks!!! That is ALWAYS a bonus in my book. Lol


10/10, I'm definitely coming back when I go to Vegas next year!

This is hard, for value I'd easily give this 4 stars plus (at 17.99 the food is excellent), great variety, and it's really really good. 

But, it's not Caesar's, but hey it's less than half the price. I think Caesar's and Orleans would be my 1/2 go tos in that order. You should try both. 

I'd rate it at 3 1/2 stars.

Yelps 365 Review Challenge 2014 - Los Angeles #65 - #365

Don't expect 5 star quality, it's more like 4 star quality with 2 star pricing. I'd honestly rate the Luxor and Excalibur buffets a 1 - 2 stars. The food here is not the greatest compared to the strip buffets but it gets the job done. 

What i liked about the buffet was the prime rib, crab legs, cocktail shrimp, and the crawfish (New Orleans Style). They also had different sections of food, like;

-American
-Italian
-Seafood 
-Mexican
-BBQ
-Cooking Stations
-Dessert 

I would come back to save some extra money if I'm ever in town to save some money from the strip buffets and restaurants. Anything to save a buck from the tourist trap areas.

Really more of a 3.5, but I digress.

So, let's say your family gambles at The Orleans so much that they get dining comps from them all the time, right? Since that describes my family to a T, lately, we've been going here about once per month thanks to comps that allow us to eat here for basically free. 

Is it the best buffet in town? Not quite, but it ranks pretty high up there among locals places at least. As a matter of fact, the Feast Buffets at the Stations are the only ones that give this joint a run for it's money. 

There are numerous Creole, Cajun and other southern-style touches scattered throughout. Most notable is the fact that it's probably the only buffet in town that serves crayfish. And eight times out of ten, gumbo is included as one of the daily soup options. Everything else is pretty standard fare, but most of it is done fairly well. The chicken wings in particular are always tender, well-seasoned and tend to fall right off the bone. 

One major gripe I have about this place is how certain things aren't seasoned up to par. The last time I came I tried to do some makeshift Hoppin' John with black eyed peas and smoked sausage and it just ended up tasting like a bland, soggy mess. Another one is that desserts tend to be pretty hit and miss. The ribs are also tough as nails but I've found that to be true of ribs at literally EVERY buffet so that's just a universal complaint right there.

They also have a "Mongolian" section which is probably the most useless section to have in a buffet ever. Other than that though, you do get your money's worth here. Especially if you're able to eat her for essentially free. *Wink Wink*

The Final Verdict

Pros:
Generous comp provided by The Orleans.
One of the better locals casino buffets.
Wide variety of cajun and creole delicacies available.
Diverse selection of seafood as well. 
Usually friendly service.
Probably one of the fastest moving lines for a buffet I've ever seen.

Cons:
Occasionally a little deficient in the seasoning department.
Sometimes great desserts, sometimes not. 
Decor in dire need of updating.

Huh?:
Why is there a Mongolian section? Like, for real?

Suggestions:
Replace that Mongolian section with either 1. A crepe making station or 2. A full-fledged Cajun/Creole/Soul Food section. Also, beignets in the dessert section! That way the theme comes full circle!

Return factor: 10/10. We're probably going to get another comp in the mail anyway.

You kind of have to go to a buffet while you're in Vegas, right? This one has a fantastic selection at a reasonable price: italian, mexican, asian, cajun, fried things, meat stuff, soups, salad, and an especially impressive dessert variety: ice cream, cakes, pies, danishes, all kinds of stuff! I went at breakfast, so they had breakfast things too like waffles, omeletes, and pancakes. The dishes were hit or miss quality wise, as generally to be expected at a buffet, but the majority of it was quite good, and the beauty of a buffet is that you can try all kinds of stuff and eat more of what you like! I think my favorite dishes were the shrimp/cheese enchilada, churros, mashed potatoes, crabcakes, and apple crumble. And convenient if you're staying in the hotel!
Food is decent enough, not worth the price but. will try other places before i hit this one again

The date of this review is December 25, 2016.

This French Market Buffet is located inside the Orleans Hotel and Casino. It is on Tropicana Avenue and it is a little distance from Las Vegas Blvd. (The Strip). They offer very reasonably priced food with great taste! 

On Tuesday, December 20, 2016, we had lunch. On Wednesday, December 21, 2016 and Thursday, December 22, 2016 we had dinner. Each time we have been at the French Market Buffet there was a large selection of buffet items.

They offer several types of food, Italian (pasta, pizza, etc.), Mexican (enchiladas, salsa, beans, etc.) Chinese (sweet and sour, fried rice, egg rolls, etc.), American (turkey, chicken, biscuit, gravy, etc.), Mongolian (stir fried noodles, etc.), Seafood (crawfish, shrimp, etc. (sorry, no crab legs!)), and BBQ (Prime rib roast, BBQ beef ribs, boiled corn, etc.) A standard salad bar and a dessert bar (cakes, ice cream, pies, cheesecake, etc.) are also provided.

The chefs are very cordial and accommodating. We asked the BBQ chef for two generous prime rib roast meat to be grilled on the BBQ. He gladly obliged and served us.

The lunch is $11.99 and the dinner is $18.99, each very much worth the price. My wife and I both enjoyed our meals.

Ugh, the crab legs were either very salty or bland with no happy medium and in my view were over cooked and old. The crab meat would crumble and had no taste. Everything else was just so. The entire buffet was mediocre at best and I would not be back.

Everything we ate was either over-salted or bland.  Enchiladas, eggplant Parmesan, Chinese spicy shrimp, steamed pollack, stuffing, all way too salty. Crawfish, egg drop soup, hot and sour soup, egg rolls all bland, no flavor at all. Everything else didn't really look appetizing. The ribs were tough to eat. The Chinese ribs, too dry. Chicken gumbo was ok. They had Cajun style offerings like fried catfish and hush puppies, but it looked like it had been sitting there for too long, so I avoided it. The only thing that tasted great was their prime rib and mashed potatoes. Dessert selection was nice. They had gelato and sorbet as well as soft serve. Lots of cakes and pies, but didn't try. They have a chocolate fountain where you can dip fruit and cream puff in. Kids loved that part. Our meal was a decent value only for the prime rib. Our waiter Manny did a great job at taking care of us.
Their quality has gotten better and this is a run of the mill average buffet. Neither good nor bad, and they often have coupons that come in the mail.

What a disappointment! What was once one of the best values in LV considering the price and fairly unique southern food has changed to an ordinary buffet you can find in other casinos. The remodel was nice but the food got much worse although the price went up by $3+. I visited the buffet for breakfast and lunch (decided not to bother for dinner). The southern food has virtually disappeared and only a few of the dishes previously served from the French Market buffet are there. It also seems the executive chef has changed because the food tastes worse for a lot of the dishes. And the shrimp...my gosh, I told management 3x that the shrimp was old/bad/spoiled and 3x they kept changing the shrimp and it was still bad. I'm sure many people got sick that day. Also, they serve menudo for breakfast but not for lunch? If you're looking for a vestige from the French Market go elsewhere, you won't find it at Medley anymore. Sadly, I will pass on this buffet which is one of the reasons why I go to the Orleans in the first place as it was once one of my favorite buffets to go to.

We go to a buffet at least once a week and our current favorite is the Suncoast. Today we were nearby the Orleans so we decided to eat here for lunch. There was no wait on a Saturday after 1:00 pm. We were pleasantly surprised to find both pork ribs and beef ribs. The beef ribs were great but the pork ribs had a strange aftertaste. I loved the Italian broccoli and the onion soup (minus the cheese and croutons). The Chinese section had well prepared baby bok choy that was not overcooked like at other buffets. What was especially nice was the chart defining the gluten free choices and the dessert section which included a selection of gluten free options. The only picky thing was that the hand cleaners were hard to find and one was broken. $12.99 with players card is a bargain slightly off strip. Btw, it was less smoky than usual.

A couple friends were in town and they were staying at the New Orleans. We were going to head to that other restaurant that serves mainly seafood, and I'm allergic.  And the story gets written err typed from there...

No line, walked straight to the cashier, and in...that had to have been record time for a buffet line! Lunch was on my friend so I don't even know how much it came out to nor did I bother to read how much. Probably wasnt interested as I could forsee myself never coming back anyway.

There are buffets you may try and know...just know...once you have your plate in hand and start doing the slow zombie walk as your eyes wait for something from the warmers to jump out at you...and nothing doesn't. So you forcefully tell yourself, just get something. And I did...

Everything aside from salads because I swear you almost can't go wrong with salads unless the dressing is gross or the salads are wilted...and buffets never screw up on salads...regressing here, okay...everything I had was bland, boring, and dry. That was me trying a dish from every country they offered. I even had a simple rye grilled cheese sandwich or something like that...and THAT was bland, boring, and dry. What the?! Service was typical of a buffet one so no comment. As long as we got our drinks refilled without asking, good enough.

So before I make this long and repetitive, unless you get your food comped here, or you don't want to leave the casino...then by all means. However, if you are coming here from elsewhere looking to eat at a buffet, I won't say DONT...but uhh....you know there are a lot of good places to eat out here.

It is kid friendly (but if you don't want the smoke smell since you do have to go through the casino then not so kid friendly) and stroller friendly.

Enjoy!

3.5 to 4+  Stars, maybe more.  Depending on if your Fav's here that buffet day.  Been here many times over the years. Lunch today awesome Beef Ribs, Brisket. Oxtail Stew. See my picture.

Ribs, yam, corn bread, blackeye peas, polish sausage.

I know. Its not a on strip buffet
What would I know???

Been to Wicked Spoon Buffet twice at Aria or Comospolitin. Took hour to walk there in Casino. Waited 3 hours to be seated.

Been to Paris Casino Buffet, Old Aladdin Buf. Been to Wynn Buffet. 
Been to Red Rock Casino Buffets three times. 
Been to many other buffets.

So here We are. In Old Orleans Casino's Buffet.
Orleans Casino is the Locals Favorite. Every night it seems the Casino's gambling is PACKED!!!!

Kids would love to ATE Here. Lol.
Dessert Stations here mind blowing. A buffet in itself. Kids Delish Heaven. Yummiest. Me...I'll need about 5 dessert Trips 

HAHA. It seems empty at the Rio Casino for gambling.


Read Yelp Elite's Rex M.'s review. For Foodie's Impression from the Heart.


 Every, Every, Every Trip to Vegas we will MUST eat here at the Orleans French Mkt Buffet least once. If for Nothing Else than to satisfy my huge Dessert Craving here
Best value for a quality buffet. Champagne is included at the Sunday Brunch. Renovated and reopened on Sept 13 2017 with its new name, Medley Buffet, and contemporary decor.

3.45872 Stars.  This is by far the BEST of the ghetto (ahem) excuse me....economical casino buffets in town.  We get coupons here every once in a while and the champagne brunches and steak/seafood nights are decent but this is pretty much a place I would only go maybe every 3 months at best.  The BBQ station is probably my favorite.

Worth coming for breakfast if you can get it comped or deeply discounted. It's kind of annoying that they close the whole thing down between breakfast and lunch, but I'm not a huge buffet person, so this might be standard now. I think you need to be selective about what day/ meal you come here for, as some offerings are better than others. We came on a Friday and got here at 11, so we had to wait until noon for lunch.  They put bell peppers in everything and I'm allergic to them, so that limited what I could have. The barbeque brisket was a little tough, next time I'll try the ham. There will still a few breakfast offerings, but for the most part it was pretty meh. Couldn't find toast or even plain sliced bread, they had rolls to go with our omelettes. The server (I think his name was Alex) was very good though, so extra star for him.

Went here for my wife's Christmas party on the weekend.  Although they had a large selection of food, nothing here looked particularly appealing;  though, it probably didn't help that I wasn't feeling very well before I came here.  The food overall probably rated a two, but the service by the staff very attentive to everyone so the service was great, bumping the rating up a star.
There are better deals in other hotels/casino but this one is convenient and you can't ruin breakfast after all. Service is good, fruits are fresh and the breakfast buffet adequate.

You have to know what to go for here. If you fill yourself up with their bland pseudo-Italian/Mexican/Asian offerings you will be disappointed.

On the other hand, endless crayfish and beef ribs? Yes please.

There is also a wide selection of desserts.

Did I hear someone say ALL YOU CAN EAT PRIME RIB?!?!?!?! Yup Yup! You did!

This buffet is located inside the New Orleans casino. The price is a bit expensive (over $13) but if you sign up for a free B-connect membership, your meal admission is only $9.99! Need I repeat it? All You Can Eat Prime Rib for only $9.99!

I have to say the quality of the selections there is pretty good, considering how much you pay for your meal. I was pleasantly surprised at the Chinese section, since the stir-fried vegetables and eggplant dish was pretty delicious. Usually, in my experience, I usually avoid the Asian section when I go to buffets (except for sushi) since the food ends up tasting like Panda Express.

But other than that, I really did enjoy the dessert! They had ice cream flavors ranging from Vanilla, Coffee, Mango, and Peach. Also there were sorbet flavors such as Passion Fruit (My fav! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!), Lemon (another hit!), and Watermelon.

I definitely recommend this place, especially if you sign up for your B-connect membership before lining up at the buffet. It's worth it. You save AND you get to eat happily. :D

This place is awesome if you are able to take down a lot of food. If I were able to post pictures, I would post one of the many pictures we took of 21 plates of empty crawfish shells on our table :D It was not a one man job, it took 3 guys and 1 girl. 

I didn't just eat the crawfish. Their many stations offer you a variety of ethnic foods ranging from Italian to Asian and Mexican. Their meat items would be among the best. I favored their grilled sausages (wow, I thought about that sentence to try avoiding any 2nd meanings...). The majority of their food was mediocre at best, but they have some jewels.

The service is pretty efficient here. They come by every so often to check on your status and to refill your drinks. For the most part, they are very nice except for one or two of them. Many of them do have a good sense of humor and had a laugh with us when they came to look at all the plates. A lot of the other patrons came by to take pictures of us and give us some encouragement.

The environment was pretty spacious. It gives you a lot of room to move around without having to run into people on accident like some other buffets. It was a comfortable setting, just don't look around too much to see what other people do with their food. It can become pretty bizarre.

Overall, this is a good place to go to with family and friends. There is plenty of food selections, so you'll be able to find something you enjoy with very little ease. People are overall pretty friendly here, so you won't feel uncomfortable much. If you love crawfish, just come here for that because that alone made it worth the money for us, as you can probably tell from my introduction. I believe lunch was around $8 and dinner around $16. It is definitely worth a visit. 

I gave this restaurant 3 stars because I judge establishments on overall quality, not just on the amount of food that I can eat. If I did that, almost any restaurant would get 5 stars. They do have some excellent food, but overall, there are some bumps. This is a very good 3-star establishment though that will most likely not let you down.

First things yes its good for kids... there is a play area for school age and an arcade room for teens, a movie theater also!! So that there since i havebmy 14 year old was a big plus. I dont play much so it was a good find. Now the buffet breakfast! Was bomb!! Loved the Mexican food section they need to add pozole for the hang over. The spice in the food was perfect.

It was edible. I came here with my mom and grand parents. they wanted to eat here. Think they had crab or something they wanted. It is not very memorable. I have eatin at several better buffets similarly priced. I have been to vegas too many times to like this place. But the food was average, service and atmosphere is the same. I rather eat at the orleans Coasta Cantina. Much better quality.

Since I stayed at The Orleans last weekend, I thought I would give this place a try. This is definitely one of the better casino buffets I've eaten at in Vegas, if not the best (I have to admit, the only buffets I've tried on the strip were at Excalibur's which was pretty bad and The Stardust which was terrible, the worst buffet I've ever had anywhere, even though that's a moot point now since it's no longer there. I also tried the much-hyped Carnival Buffet at The Rio a few years ago and thought for the money it was a rip-off).

The surroundings were nicer than average for a buffet and they had a tremendous variety of food. They have a deal for $21.00 in which you can eat breakfast, lunch, and dinner there. I only had lunch there once ($8.00), but because of the huge variety of items, I'm sure it would be no problem to eat all three meals there and never have a single item twice if you didn't want to. 

The quality of the food was above average for a buffet. There were a few things I tried I did not like, but there was more I liked than disliked. The beef back ribs, in fact, were by far the best I've had at any buffet and they had a braised oxtail stew which was very good, not as good as top quality homemade, but very good nevertheless, probably the single best item I've ever had at a buffet. The mashed potatoes, usually just fair or mediocre at most buffets, were also first rate.

The lines moved quickly and the service was good, although I couldn't understand why you couldn't just get your own water and napkins instead of having to get the attention of a server to do it for you. Also, there didn't seem to be any rhyme or reason to the order or location of the various food stations, i.e. the ribs were two or three stations from the American food station whereas it seems more logical they should have been next to each other. That's a minor thing, though.

In terms of overall value for what you get this place is an easy four stars, although I could not quite bring myself to give it five due to the items I did not care for and most of the stuff just being decent. If I ever go to The Orleans again, though, which is quite likely, I will definitely go to this place again.

I gave a 4 instead of 5 rating for the waitress not the food! She had a lousy attitude. 

We Always make it to the French Market Buffet! Very tasty selections. Over the years have tried many Vegas Buffets..Aria, MGM, Mirage (when it was Great b4 Cravings) Bellagio, Caesar Palace on and on!

But we never leave Vegas without eating here. Sunday February 12th we tried their Sunday Brunch! OMG delicious! I never made it to the pancakes I came for! But the made to order Omelet and the Hush puppy Fried Shrimp were Ridiculously Fantastic....should have eaten more of them!

Well ... Went to vegas this weekend and always try to hit this buffet , but this trip the buffet went south. We went for the breakfast/brunch and were very hungry. The food was sub par to say the least ... Lousy flavor , bland. 

The eggs benedict went right into the trash after the first bite . The corned beef hash was good , as were the bisquits and gravy , but that is where it stopped ... Everything else was horrid. 

The link sausages tasted very strange and were pushed away from me. 
I used to fatten up here and hit the dessert bar BUT after chewing on muck , i passed on dessert ( which i never do ! ). My appetite for later was ruined as i spent most of the day and evening grasping the sides of the toilet with fire ass ! 

Although i am kinda pissed , i hope in the future there is more care in the way food is made .....

Gluten Free Buffet! Sweet! Paper placemat has gluten free items listed on it right at table so you can preview the available menu items. You can order your own gluten free pizza...although I didn't care for the crust. For those who are truly gluten free, guess what? The staff is KNOWLEDGEABLE ( imagine that!), about the ingredients in the food!

Only four stars because of pizza crust...hopefully they find a better alternative as mine fell apart and I had to eat it with a fork but the toppings were great!

This is for the Breakfast buffet. 

I'm not a fan of the all you can eat, and this one reminded my why. 

Everything on my plate was cold and tasteless. Next time my family wants breakfast, we will go down the street to Jack in the box.
Enjoyed the Friday night crab and prime rib.. The buffet has a large variety of dishes. No long lines or overcrowding. Will return again..

A friend who is a Veteran wanted to go here for Veterans Day and although it would not have been my first choice I obliged. The lines were long and the place was packed but the line did move along quickly and when inside Management was everywhere helping to clear tables and seat people ( nice to see ). The food is not above average but it is good and all stations were kept filled. I had broasted chicken, sweet potato and salad and all were fresh and tasty. My guest was happy with everything and I think he tried everything !! The highlight however was not the food but seeing so many of our military in uniform. I'm glad I went.

First meal of the day at Vegas and its breakfast.. I get tons of breakfast foods; eggs, bacon, waffles,donuts, ham, and hash browns. I decide to get a omelet with everything on it including the shrimp. The next few hours I get sick and my stomach is churning like threes no tomorrow. Everyone was fine besides me and I find out I am only the person that got an omelet with shrimp. So it has to be that that got me sick. All around the food was really bland or salty. I was stuffed at the end but who isn't at a buffet. You gotta get your moneys worth. Anyways I would've gave it a 3 star but since I got sick it looses both star and only is left with 1. Too bad.

Im very impressed with the renovation and opening of the new Medley Buffet at the Orleans Hotel/Casino. It had been awhile since I had dined at the Orleans and I was excited to try out the new digs.

Dinner buffet is 20.99 and 18.99 if you have a Boyd gaming card.

The selection is endless! You can have anything from prime rib to veal parmesan and yes...shrimp scampi. I was in the mood for mexican and they offered a taco station, enchilada's, chili releno, street corn and an entire fresh salsa bar with delicious chips. Plus so much more.
I did try the steamed crawfish because I have a weakness for shellfish. They were really good but wasn't in the mood for all that crack a'lacking and messiness.

After dinner we decided to try the desert area. Impressive Boyd Group!
So much to choose from..bread pudding, cobbler, carrot cake, pies, fresh baked cookies and my favorite "The Ice Cream Parlor" This is not an ice cream station its a full size ice cream store! Not some soft freeze ice cream that squirts out of a machine..but endless flavors where an employee scoops it out for you and puts on a cone or a dish. Its kind of hard to describe, you will just have to go see for yourself. I thought it was really cool.

For the price this buffet is worth it! I certainly couldn't eat more than what I had, but if I had a big stomach I would've tried more things!
Boyd Group did good with this buffet as the other Boyd properties have mediocre buffets. 

I definitely recommend if you want an extensive selection of food from around the world and endless deserts. And the renovation is very elegant and classy.

Food: 3/5       Price: 5/5        Service: 3/5     Ambience: 3/5

This buffet is a little far from the Strip, but they offer cheap meals with pretty great taste! We came for the breakfast, and there was a wide selection including Italian(pizza, lasagna ), Mexican(tacos, enchiladas, beans), Chinese(fried rice, pot stickers, sweat and sour chicken), omelette station, American (biscuits and gravy, french toast, waffles, bacon, egg, fish and chips, potatoes), Carving (ham, brisket, ribs), salad bar, and dessert(pies, cakes, bread pudding, ice cream, cookies). Overall very worth the price and I enjoyed the meal.

Pricing 
Breakfast : $9.99
Lunch: $11.99
Dinner : $ 18.99

New remodel but same type of food.  Overpriced breakfast (11.99, 9.99 with card).  Food was cold.  Cold eggs, cold gravy, cold ham.  Only good item was the bread pudding.  Go around the corner to Palms or even The Orleans sister property (Gold Coast) for better food or pricing.

I sincerely hope some manager of Orleans Casino or Boyd Gambling reads reviews cause they need to. I have been going to Orleans Casino for almost as long as it has existed. Great hotel, great pool, great everything despite it being off the strip. Best has been the buffet. It's was inexpensive and good. The locals loved it. Now with a new name and new look called Medley Buffet, it's the same food but much more expensive. Not a good idea. And if management reads this, your American flag flying above the entrance is totally torn up. Replace it please

THIS BUFFET was a total waste of $20 it included DRY MEAT, sloppy shrimp scampi, most of the food was uneatable !!!!! I got full off eating vegetable spring rolls and salad because it was the only thing I could stomach. Not to mention I didn't come on Seafood night and I was craving crab kings. The ice cream was good and the
Fruit was fresh but I would Never Ever eat @ THE FRENCH MARKET BUFFET AGAIN. People must be writing fake reviews to gives this dump 4 or 5 stars!
Excellent food for a very good price. This was our first time here and we will be returning. $57 for a party of 5 on a monday is not bad at all!
Horrible.  Food was terrible, service was terrible.  If you want a refill on your coffee, better order two.  Upside - it was cheap.

For myself I'm kinda a picky eater but French Market Buffet in Orleans Casino blew my expectations. Most of these cooks in each stations from Asian to Italian and Mexican makes Table Mountain and  Chuckchansi buffet very forgettable. Also their server was really efficient and nice refilling my drinks. Every stations was really good it wasn't bland, it had the right amount of sodium the only thing I didn't like was their seafood soup with tomatoe sauce and their "dirty rice" dish. They even have BBQ beef ribs along with prime roast beef you can't beat that for only under $20.00 for AYCE. The buffet is nothing fancy but they have decent foods and good service also their desert slections is awesome so be sure to leave room for that. If you're complaining about paying under $20.00 for decent AYCE buffet I suggest you shut up and go to McDonald's or Burger King for you cheapskates.

When I came into this buffet, I thought it must be just as good as the Ports O'Call Buffet at Gold Coast because of the set up and it did offer the same foods. However, I was wrong. French Market Buffet was just alright. I found a couple things I could eat, but overall, this place was a dud. I found myself placing a lot of salt and pepper on my plate just to give my meal a little bit of flavor. They are definitely other places to go for off the Strip buffets.
No French food here but the Mexican food was great! Hubby went for a second serving of Menudo!

It's not bad for the price. Lots of different choices, from around the world, including desserts. I always eat too much whenever I eat here. Bring your big appetite, Because there is so many choices. There is quite often a line, so be ready for that. It is inside the Orleans Hotel and Casino, if you're a guest here you get a discount on your meal here.

I ate here for breakfast on Saturday. It was only $8.99 including drinks. I expected the worst but suprisingly, I enjoyed the food here. The bacon was crisp, the mexican sausage was especially juicy and you can't go wrong with the biscuits and gravy. There was also an omellete bar. It's a steal at $8.99.

My father just stayed at the Orleans for the past week and we had breakfast here most mornings and dinner one evening. I would say the breakfast is the best value (8.99 with players card) but dinner was still pretty good. If it's a busy weekend prepare to wait in line especially in the morning but they do keep things moving along fairly quick. Drink service can be a bit slow to get to you but it was very busy the times I was there over the week and the servers had many tables.

One of the worst buffets in Vegas. It's tiny and their staff is so slow. I'm a local and decided to try their shrimp and steak night. When I went to get some "steak", they cut off a paper-thin slice so I asked for 2, and she refused stating, "one slice per customer." Really? One paper-thin slice then wait in a line for another 10mins for a second paper-thin slice? On my second trip to the buffet, hoping that maybe their other dishes were palatable, I walk back to my table and the bus-people have completely cleared it off. Our drinks were there and our receipt was still in the little holder indicating people were sitting there. So we had to sit there with our food, waiting for 3mins for a new set of silverware and drinks. Most of the food is way over cooked and the deserts are mediocre. Pass

For the price you pay, this buffet is a good deal.  :)  It's $12 for lunch, or $1 off with a club card, and you get a nice variety of food.  The best section for me is the Cajun section with the smoked ribs and the beef ribs and the gumbo, its all pretty good.  I also actually thought their sushi was pretty descent for a buffet, I have ate sushi at probably about 50 buffets and I thought it actually tasted pretty good, it was a bit dry, but it was still fairly fresh and tasted like sushi, the problem I have with most buffet sushi is it just does not taste like Sushi, not even at Asian Buffet restaurants. 

The sweet and sour pork was surprisingly good, the sauce was separate which was nice so the food was not at all soggy.  :) The craw fish is very tasty and well-cooked, love craw fish those alone are 5stars, and they also have a chocolate fountain, for dinner at least (can't remember if it's there for lunch too)!

Overall, for the price, I think it's pretty damn good.  I have been to a lot of Vegas Buffets and I would rate this higher than many of the buffets on the strip that cost 5-10 dollars more.  The staff was friendly, the food was pretty fresh considering they were pretty dead, and I nothing was poor quality, even if not all the dishes are exceptional, they are at least decent.

God Bless ~Amy

First time here since the remodel...it's like ten times better in execution than the redo of the Palms Casino buffet.... Here it's Old Vegas....the food looks good and actually tastes EXCELLENT! And the line servers are happy  folks and actually want to talk to you if you make eye  contact...  went on a Tuesday and there's definitely price value for what I paid.... Crepes, oxtail stew, Chinese roast duck, prime rib anyways you want it, bbq beef ribs...it's all here

So-so food. But at Sunday Brunch I was surprised to find the roast beef tender and the gravy without clumps of gook....even more surprising were the mashed potatoes being moist and flavorful and not the usual pasty glop.
French fries were crispy hot and tasty... but then again we arrived at the start of Brunch---9 am....Chinese food station--tasteless---looks cute until you bite into it.
....of course the service staff are always top notch to us.
Best selection of food ..bbq is amazing and a variety for every taste. Chocolate fountain too..would recccomend.

For $21 buffet, it's really not too shabby at all.  The variety of food and quality is worthy of another trip.  We came on Friday night, which was steak & shrimp night.  From what I could gather, there is no more seafood night.

There were so much shrimp dishes- butterflied shrimp, shrimp over ice, popcorn shrimp, deep fried shrimp, shrimp linguini, and a few more shrimp dishes in sauces and broth.  I'm starting to sound like Bubba Gump, so you get my drift.  The variety of soup like clam chowder, sweet & spicy, menudo and even pho were all represented with a few more that I can't quite remember. The pork ribs, beef ribs, the variety of meats on the carving board will satiate any carnivore eating habits. 

This is our first time and we were so impressed with the clean dcor, excellent service that was provided throughout the floor.  

Stay for the gelato, the bite-size dessert and if you could believe it, their decaf Folgers coffee was pretty darn good.  To each's own, this place was a pleasant surprise for a buffet.

This may be one of the better Vegas buffets off the strip. A variety of foods such as seafood, Mexican, Chinese, Italian, and Mongolian. 

I had a little bit of everything but my favorite was they're carne asada and seafood enchiladas. Mixed with some salsa, guacamole and sour cream. Oh boy! 

Two salad bars, but who eats salad in Vegas? 

Very big selection of desserts! Not only ice cream and pies, but gelato! That really surprised me. 

Awesome place to eat if you're at The Orleans.

Price was good for what you get.
Did not have to wait in line long only 17 mins., place was already full.
I especially enjoyed the German food. You could tell a lot of time and thought was put into these dishes at the Hofbrau station.
The Wait service met my every needs, I never had to ask for anything.
Very tasty and delicious!

This is my favorite cheap buffet in Vegas! It's a really good deal to eat here and good food. There is a wide selection of food. The line can get long but not long as it does on The Strip or at the Rio. I think the food here is much better than at the Rio buffet. Can't wait to eat here again!

HELL YEAH I know I came out weighing more but who cares, the food was lick my plate good ... I was playing with my B connected players card and thus it made this awesome meal for fahhhhhfreeeeee.. Now good food that is also free is a winner any day in my book!!!

Combination of food, price and service makes this buffet worthwhile.  Nice variety of selection.  Asian, Mexican, American, Southern, and Italian.  I particularly liked the Char Sui and Smoked spare ribs, as well as the desserts.  We also got a very pleasant surprise with the 2 for 1 promotion.

Good value. Decent food. Adequate variety.   We drove out from downtown (about 20 minutes).  The casino and the buffet are very open, meaning not cramped, as many are in the more popular places.  The property is nicely decorated and welcoming.  At a reasonable price, the buffet was OK, but not outstanding.

First let me qualify this it $14.99 lunch.  Luke warm, Bland food.  Selection was meh, desert table a waste of time -70% empty. Service was sssllloooowww. Maybe it was to limit the amount of drink? Maybe they were understaffed due to all the cheerleaders? Regardless - not an enjoyable or tasty experience I would repeat.

Living in Las Vegas, I've been to quite a few buffets at both the big hotels and Station Casinos. This one is definitely one of your best deals (about $16.99 for dinner, $3 discount with BConnected card) for the mid-priced buffets. The prime rib was excellent, and the other offerings included Mexican, Asian, Mongolian, pasta station, delicious dessert station.
